'''Eliaquim Hans Mangala''' (born 13 February 1991) is a French professional [[association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[centre back]] for English [[Premier League]] club [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] and the [[France national football team|France national team]].
Born in France, he moved to Belgium as a child and began his career there at [[Standard Liège]], going onto [[FC Porto|Porto]] in 2011 where he won consecutive [[Primeira Liga]] titles before joining Manchester City in 2014 for £32 million.
Mangala made his debut with the French national team on 6 June 2013 against [[Uruguay national football team|Uruguay]]. He was included in the nation's squads for the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]] and [[UEFA Euro 2016]], helping them to runners-up position in the latter.
==Club career== ===Early career=== Mangala was born in the northwestern Parisian suburb of [[Colombes]] to Congolese parents, but moved to Belgium at the age of five to live in the French-speaking city of [[Namur]]. At the same age, he joined local club ''Athletic Club Lustin'' as a youth player and spent six years at the club before moving to ''CS Wépionnais'' in nearby [[Wépion]]. After two years in Wépion, Mangala joined the biggest club in the city, [[UR Namur]], and quickly impressed. While at Namur, Mangala was utilised as a [[Striker (association football)|striker]] and his positive displays at youth level led to interest from [[Standard Liège]]. In 2007, Mangala and Standard reached an agreement on a three-year youth contract.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.footgoal.net/suite.php?selection=32108 |website=Footgoal.net |title=Mangala a signé un contrat de cinq ans au Standard |language=French |date=22 October 2008 |accessdate=28 December 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121003091620/http://www.footgoal.net/suite.php?selection=32108 |archivedate=3 October 2012 |deadurl=yes}}</ref>
===Standard Liège=== Mangala joined Standard Liège and, upon his arrival, was converted into a [[left back]] and inserted into the club's under-17 team for the 2007–08 season. Mangala's admirable play with the team led to the player being promoted to Standard's under-19 team in January 2008, where he again switched positions, this time moving into [[defender (football)|central defence]]. During his time with the under-19 team, Mangala made the bench several times for Standard's under-21 team, despite being only 17 years old.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.dhnet.be/sports/genk/article/228529/titulaire-la-saison-prochaine.html |newspaper=La Dernière Heure |location=Brussels |title=Eliaquim Mangala a de l'ambition et du talent |language=French |date=24 October 2008 |accessdate=28 December 2010}}</ref>
For the [[2008–09 Belgian First Division|2008–09 season]], Mangala was given the opportunity to train and play with the first team. On 23 October 2008, he signed his first professional contract, agreeing to a five-year deal with the club.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.footgoal.net/suite.php?selection=32124 |website=Footgoal.net |title=Mangala: Je ne réalise pas encore |language=French |date=23 October 2008 |accessdate=28 December 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150924034944/http://www.footgoal.net/suite.php?selection=32124 |archivedate=24 September 2015 |deadurl=yes}}</ref> Mangala was officially promoted to the senior team and assigned the number 22 shirt. On 9 November, he made his professional debut as an 89th-minute substitute in a 3–1 victory over [[K.F.C. Germinal Beerschot|Germinal Beerschot]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.standard.be/fr/c_match.php?id=3451 |publisher=Standard Liège |title=Germinal Beerschot 1–3 Standard de Liège |language=French |date=9 November 2008 |accessdate=28 December 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090507011654/http://www.standard.be/fr/c_match.php?id=3451 |archivedate=7 May 2009 |deadurl=yes}}</ref> He made another late appearance against [[K.A.A. Gent|Gent]] before earning his first career league start against [[F.C. Verbroedering Dender E.H.|Dender]] on 17 January 2009. In the match, Mangala provided the assist on the opening goal scored by [[Milan Jovanović (footballer, born 1981)|Milan Jovanović]] in the 3rd minute of play. Standard won the match 3–2 with Mangala playing the entire match. He finished the season with 11 league appearances as Standard Liège were crowned champions. He also appeared in [[UEFA Cup]] matches against Italian club [[U.C. Sampdoria|Sampdoria]], German club [[VfB Stuttgart|Stuttgart]], and Portuguese team [[Sporting CP]], starting the match against the latter.{{citation needed|date=January 2019}}
Mangala was inserted as a starter for the [[2009–10 Belgian Pro League|2009–10 season]] making his debut in the club's 2–0 victory over [[K.R.C. Genk|Genk]] in the [[2009 Belgian Super Cup|Belgian Supercup]] on 25 July 2009.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.uefa.com/memberassociations/association=bel/news/newsid=864074.html |title=Standard triumph in Belgian Super Cup |publisher=UEFA |date=25 July 2009 |accessdate=17 August 2014}}</ref> On 12 September, Mangala scored his first professional goal in a league match against [[KV Mechelen|Mechelen]] in a 3–0 victory. Four days later, Mangala scored another goal against English club [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] in the club's opening [[2009-10 UEFA Champions League|UEFA Champions League]] group stage match.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/season=2010/matches/round=2000028/match=2000371/postmatch/report/index.html |title=Arsenal fightback flattens Standard |publisher=UEFA |date=12 September 2009 |accessdate=17 August 2014}}</ref> Mangala scored the goal in the 3rd minute and Standard striker Jovanović scored two minutes later to put Standard Liège up 2–0, however, the club went on to lose the match 3–2 following three unanswered goals from the English team.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/europe/8254473.stm |title=Standard Liège 2–3 Arsenal |publisher=BBC Sport |date=16 September 2009 |accessdate=16 September 2009}}</ref>
In what proved to be his final league match for Standard, Mangala converted a [[Steven Defour]] free-kick to give his team a 1–0 lead over [[KRC Genk]] at half-time, but striker [[Kennedy Ugoala Nwanganga]] earned a 1–1 draw for Genk, securing the league title by just half a point over Standard.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.uefa.com/memberassociations/association=bel/news/newsid=1632291.html |title=Genk pip Standard to Belgian title |publisher=UEFA |date=17 May 2011 |accessdate=17 August 2014}}</ref> In his final appearance for the club on 21 May 2011, Mangala scored Standard's first goal in their 2–0 victory over [[K.V.C. Westerlo]] in the [[2011 Belgian Cup Final|final]] of the [[2010–11 Belgian Cup|Belgian Cup]], ending an 18-year cup drought.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.uefa.com/memberassociations/association=bel/news/newsid=1633343.html |title=Standard end 18-year Belgian Cup wait |publisher=UEFA |date=21 May 2011 |accessdate=17 August 2014}}</ref>
===Porto=== [[File:Valais Cup 2013 - OM-FC Porto 13-07-2013 - Eliaquim Mangala.jpg|thumb|upright|Mangala playing for [[FC Porto|Porto]] againstin 2013]]
Mangala joined reigning [[2010-11 UEFA Europa League|Europa League]] champions [[FC Porto|Porto]] on 16 August 2011.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.fcporto.pt/IncFCP/PDF/Investor_Relations/FactosRelevantes/CompraMangala16082011.pdf |title=COMUNICADO |trans-title=Communication |date=16 August 2011 |accessdate=18 August 2011 |publisher=FC Porto |language=Portuguese |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111224082548/http://www.fcporto.pt/IncFCP/PDF/Investor_Relations/FactosRelevantes/CompraMangala16082011.pdf |archivedate=24 December 2011 |deadurl=yes}}</ref> The deal also included Porto signing his Standard teammate [[Steven Defour]] in a combined deal that totalled £11.4 million.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.goal.com/en-gb/news/2885/europe/2011/08/14/2619589/porto-sign-standard-lieges-eliaquim-mangala-steven-defour |title=Porto sign Standard Liege's Eliaquim Mangala & Steven Defour for £11.4m – report |website=Goal.com |publisher=Perform Group |date=14 August 2011 |accessdate=17 August 2014}}</ref> He played his first season with Porto as a substitute behind the likes of [[Rolando (footballer)|Rolando]], [[Maicon Pereira Roque|Maicon]] and [[Nicolás Otamendi]]. He made his first appearance in the [[2012–13 FC Porto season|2012–13 season]] for Porto in the [[2012 Supertaça Cândido de Oliveira|Supertaça Cândido de Oliveira]] against [[Associação Académica de Coimbra – O.A.F.|Académica]] on 11 August 2012, playing the full 90 minutes as Porto won the pre-season title with a 1–0 win.<ref>{{cite news |title=Dragões conquistam Supertaça ao bater Académica com golo de Martínez|trans-title=Dragons win SuperCup by beating Académica with a goal from Martínez |url=http://www.abola.pt/nnh/ver.aspx?id=346792 |newspaper=A Bola |location=Lisbon |accessdate=1 September 2012 |date=11 August 2012 |language=Portuguese |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6FfviDaEg?url=http://www.abola.pt/nnh/ver.aspx?id=346792 |archivedate=6 April 2013 |deadurl=yes}}</ref> He made his first-team breakthrough with Porto that season, becoming the first-choice [[centre back]] and scoring four league goals, one of which was in a 2–2 draw with Benfica on 13 January 2013.<ref>{{cite news |title=Mangala demolidor|trans-title=Mangala at his best |url=https://www.record.pt/futebol/futebol-nacional/liga-nos/fc-porto/detalhe/mangala-demolidor-798964.html |accessdate=23 June 2018 |newspaper=Record |location=Lisbon |date=15 January 2013 |language=Portuguese}}</ref> Mangala featured in Porto's 2–0 win over [[Paços de Ferreira]] on 19 May 2013, leading the club to an undefeated season and a third-straight league title, by just one point over rivals [[S.L. Benfica|Benfica]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.uefa.com/memberassociations/association=por/news/newsid=1954050.html |title=Unbeaten Porto wrap up 27th league title |publisher=UEFA |date=19 May 2013 |accessdate=17 August 2014}}</ref>
On 23 February 2014, Mangala was sent off for a reckless challenge inside the area and Porto fell to a 1–0 defeat to [[G.D. Estoril Praia|Estoril]] as [[Evandro Goebel|Evandro]] converted the spot kick.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2014/02/23/portugal/portuguese-liga-/futebol-clube-do-porto/gd-estoril-praia/1511856/ |title=Porto vs. Estoril 0–1 |website=Soccerway |publisher=Perform Group |accessdate=17 July 2014}}</ref> In Porto's [[2013-14 UEFA Europa League|Europa League]] Round of 16-second leg against [[Eintracht Frankfurt]] on 27 February 2014, Mangala scored two goals, both from headers, as Porto battled back from 2–0 down to draw 3–3 and secure passage to the quarter-finals on away goals.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/live/match/306108/report |title=Europa League: Porto prevail in 3–3 draw with Eintracht Frankfurt |publisher=Sky Sports |date=27 February 2014 |accessdate=17 July 2014}}</ref> On 3 April 2014, Mangala headed in the game's only goal as Porto defeated [[Sevilla FC|Sevilla]] in the first-leg of their quarter-final tie in the Europa League.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/season=2014/matches/round=2000472/match=2012671/postmatch/report/index.html |title=Mangala swoops to earn Porto victory over Sevilla |publisher=UEFA |date=3 April 2014 |accessdate=17 July 2014}}</ref> His goal would not be enough to guide the Portuguese into the next round as they fell to a 4–1 loss in Spain seven days later.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/season=2014/matches/round=2000472/match=2012675/postmatch/report/ |title=Sevilla surge past Porto and into semis |publisher=UEFA |date=10 April 2014 |accessdate=17 July 2014}}</ref>
===Manchester City=== [[File:Eliaquim Mangala 69783.jpg|thumb|upright|Mangala playing for [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] in 2014]]
On 11 August 2014, Mangala signed for English club [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] on a five-year contract,<ref>{{cite web |title=Eliaquim Mangala signs for City |url=http://www.mcfc.co.uk/NewsNewsandFeatures/Team-news/2014/August/Eliaquim-Mangala-signs-for-Manchester-City-FC |publisher=Manchester City F.C. |accessdate=11 August 2014 |date=11 August 2014}}</ref> for a reported £31.8 million transfer fee.<ref>{{cite news |last1=De Menezes |first1=Jack |title=Eliaquim Mangala to Manchester City: Premier League champions hoping to tie up £32m transfer this weekend |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/transfers/eliaquim-mangala-to-manchester-city-premier-league-champions-hoping-to-tie-up-32m-transfer-this-weekend-9654435.html |accessdate=11 August 2014 |newspaper=The Independent |location=London |date=7 August 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |last1=Jolly |first1=Richard |title=Pellegrini hopeful of Mangala deal |url=http://www.espnfc.com/story/1980650/manchester-city-boss-manuel-pellegrini-hopeful-of-eliaquim-mangala-deal |website=ESPN FC |accessdate=11 August 2014 |date=11 August 2014}}</ref> It was however reported 18 months into his contract that the fee was more in the region of £42m due to spiralling costs as a result of Mangala's split ownership at Porto, with City having to pay in the region of £18m to two companies which owned over 40% of Mangala's economic rights. This second figure would have made Mangala the most expensive defender in British transfer history at the time.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Pollard |first1=Rob |title=Manchester City defender Eliaquim Mangala cost over £40m, a leaked document has confirmed |url=http://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-city-defender-eliaquim-mangala-10764233 |newspaper=Manchester Evening News |accessdate=21 January 2016 |date=20 January 2016}}</ref> He reunited with his former partner in Porto's defence, [[Fernando (Brazilian footballer, born 1987)|Fernando]], who had joined City earlier in the summer.{{citation needed|date=January 2019}}
Mangala made his debut in City's fifth match of the [[Premier League]] season, a 1–1 home draw against [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] on 21 September. Lining up alongside captain [[Vincent Kompany]], his performance was described by [[BBC Sport]] as "colossal".<ref>{{cite news |last1=McNulty |first1=Phil |title=Man City 1–1 Chelsea |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29196082 |accessdate=1 October 2014 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=21 September 2014}}</ref> Six days later, an own goal and concession of a penalty by Mangala caused City to lose a 2–0 lead against [[Hull City A.F.C.|Hull City]], although they eventually triumphed 4–2. Despite media criticism, manager [[Manuel Pellegrini]] said "we continue to trust him because he is a very good player who had very bad luck".<ref>{{cite news |last1=Keegan |first1=Mike |title=Hull 2–4 Man City |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29289927 |accessdate=1 October 2014 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=27 September 2014}}</ref> On 30 November, Mangala was sent off for two yellow cards in City's 3–0 win away to [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]].<ref>{{cite news |last1=Jurejko |first1=Jonathan |title=Southampton 0–3 Man City |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30166197 |accessdate=30 November 2014 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=30 November 2014}}</ref>
====Valencia (loan)==== On 31 August 2016, Mangala joined Spanish club [[Valencia CF|Valencia]] on a season-long loan.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.mancity.com/news/first-team/2016/08/31/eliaquim-mangala-joins-valencia-on-loan/1472633027775 |title=Mangala moves to Valencia on loan |publisher=Manchester City F.C. |date=31 August 2016 |accessdate=31 August 2016}}</ref> He made his debut for the ''Che'' on 11 September, starting alongside fellow newcomer [[Ezequiel Garay]] in a 3–2 home loss to [[Real Betis]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Final de traca en Mestalla |url=http://www.marca.com/eventos/marcador/futbol/2016_17/la-liga/jornada_3/val_bet/ |newspaper=Marca |location=Madrid |accessdate=5 September 2017 |date=11 September 2016 |language=Spanish}}</ref> On 28 February 2017, he scored his first goal to defeat [[CD Leganés|Leganés]] at [[Mestalla]],<ref>{{cite news |title=La Liga round-up: Eliaquim Mangala nets rare goal in Valencia win |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/12040/10785892/la-liga-round-up-eliaquim-mangala-nets-rare-goal-in-valencia-win |accessdate=5 September 2017 |publisher=Sky Sports |date=28 February 2017}}</ref> and on 19 March he headed the opening goal of a 4–2 away loss at [[FC Barcelona]] in which he was sent off for pulling at [[Luis Suárez]] in the penalty area.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Creek |first1=Stephen |title=BARCELONA 4 VALENCIA 2: MESSI DOUBLE HELPS TO SEE OFF 10-MAN VALENCIA |url=http://www.goal.com/en-in/match/barcelona-v-valencia/9hsq6m3qf2i3q60jap4x1hg4p |accessdate=5 September 2017 |website=Goal.com |publisher=Perform Group |date=19 March 2017}}</ref>
====Everton (loan)==== Mangala joined Premier League club [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] on loan on 31 January 2018.<ref>{{cite news |title=Eliaquim Mangala: Everton sign Manchester City defender on loan |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42897518 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=1 February 2018 |date=1 February 2018}}</ref> He made his debut against [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]] but was forced off at half-time with a knee injury. He later underwent surgery and was ruled out for the remainder of the season.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/loan-everton-defender-eliaquim-mangala-14351465 |title=On-loan Everton defender Eliaquim Mangala undergoes successful knee surgery |newspaper=Liverpool Echo |last=Gorst |first=Paul |date=28 February 2018 |accessdate=2 March 2017}}</ref>
==International career== [[File:Néry, Ahamada, and Mangala.jpg|thumb|upright|Mangala lining up as the captain of [[France national under-21 football team|France U21]] in 2011]]
Due to being raised in Belgium, Mangala did not feature with any of [[France national youth football team|France's youth football teams]]. In 2008, he was approached by the [[Royal Belgian Football Association]] who called the player up to the country's under-18 national team. However, due to not possessing a passport at the time, the call up was deemed futile. After excelling with Standard Liège's senior team, Mangala drew the interest of the [[French Football Federation]] with [[France national under-21 football team|France under-21]] manager [[Erick Mombaerts]] attending a match between Liège and [[R.E. Mouscron|Mouscron]] at the [[Stade Le Canonnier]] in November.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.fff.fr/selections/espoirs/actualite/531061.shtml |publisher=French Football Federation |title=Angleterre et Belgique |language=French |date=28 October 2009 |accessdate=28 December 2010}}</ref> On 5 November 2009, Mangala was selected, for the first time, to the under-21 team for a [[Exhibition game#Association football|friendly]] match against [[Tunisia national under-21 football team|Tunisia]] on 13 November and a [[2011 UEFA European Under-21 Championship qualification]] match against [[Slovenia national under-21 football team|Slovenia]] on 17 November. Mangala made his under-21 debut in the Tunisia match, but missed the match against Slovenia after withdrawing from the team due to an injury suffered the previous day in training. On 2 March 2010, he earned his second straight selection to the under-21 team and started in central defence alongside [[Captain (association football)|captain]] [[Mamadou Sakho]] in the team's 3–1 win over [[Croatia national under-21 football team|Croatia]].{{citation needed|date=January 2019}}
Mangala made his debut with the [[France national football team|France senior team]] in a 1–0 loss to [[Uruguay national football team|Uruguay]] on 6 June 2013.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.eliaquim-mangala.com/en/component/content/article/28-mangala/137-france-under-21s-career |title=France career |accessdate=13 July 2014 |website=Eliaquim Mangala |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150923235421/http://www.eliaquim-mangala.com/en/component/content/article/28-mangala/137-france-under-21s-career |archivedate=23 September 2015 |deadurl=yes}}</ref> He was included in France's squad for the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]] but did not make an appearance during the tournament, in which ''Les Bleus'' reached the quarter-finals.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.eliaquim-mangala.com/en/component/content/article/28-mangala/137-france-under-21s-career |title=Eliaquim Mangala: Man City in advanced talks for Porto defender |date=12 July 2014 |accessdate=13 July 2014 |website=Eliaquim Mangala |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150923235421/http://www.eliaquim-mangala.com/en/component/content/article/28-mangala/137-france-under-21s-career |archivedate=23 September 2015 |deadurl=yes}}</ref>
Mangala was also included in France's squad that finished runners-up at [[UEFA Euro 2016]] on home soil. He made one appearance in the quarter-finals on 3 July, replacing [[Laurent Koscielny]] for the final 18 minutes of a 5–2 win over [[Iceland national football team|Iceland]] at the [[Stade de France]].<ref>{{cite news |last1=Fletcher |first1=Paul |title=France 5–2 Iceland |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/36632457 |accessdate=5 September 2017 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=3 July 2016}}</ref>

Genk|Genk]], where he was a regular player when they won the [[2010–11 Belgian Pro League]]. In 2012, he joined English club [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]], where he was used sparingly and then loaned to [[SV Werder Bremen|Werder Bremen]]. He signed with [[VfL Wolfsburg|Wolfsburg]] for £18 million in 2014, and in 2015 he was named [[Footballer of the Year in Germany]].{{cite web|url=http://sporza.be/cm/sporza/voetbal/buitenland/Duitsland/1.2400701 |title=De Bruyne is Speler van het Jaar volgens Duitse Journalisten |language=nl |date=26 July 2015 |accessdate=26 July 2015 |work=[[Sporza]] |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160716195857/http://sporza.be/cm/sporza/voetbal/buitenland/Duitsland/1.2400701 |archivedate=16 July 2016 |df= }} Later that year, he joined Manchester City for a club record £54 million. In three seasons with City, De Bruyne has appeared in over 140 matches and won a [[Premier League]] title and two [[EFL Cup|League Cups]]. He had a significant role in City's quest to become the first Premier League team to [[Premier League records and statistics#Points|attain 100 points]] in a single season in the [[2017–18 Premier League|2017–18]]. Additionally, De Bruyne has been named [[Manchester City#Player of the Year|Manchester City's Player of the Year]], twice, in [[2015–16 Manchester City F.C. season|2016]] and [[2017–18 Manchester City F.C. season|2018]]. De Bruyne made his full international debut in 2010, and has since earned over 65 [[Caps (football)|caps]] and scored 15 goals for Belgium. He was a member of the Belgian squads that reached the quarter-finals both at the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]] and at [[UEFA Euro 2016]]. In 2018 he represented Belgium at the [[2018 FIFA World Cup|FIFA World Cup]], winning the [[2018 FIFA World Cup#Third place play-off|third place play-off]] match against [[England national football team|England]]. ==Club career== ===Genk=== De Bruyne began his career with hometown club KVV Drongen in 2003. Two years later, he joined [[K.A.A. Gent|Gent]] and moved to [[K.R.C. Genk|Genk]] in 2005. De Bruyne continued his development in their youth set-up and was rewarded for his progress by being promoted to the first team squad in 2008. De Bruyne made his first team debut for [[K.R.C. web|title=Genk clinch third Belgian title with Liege draw|url=http://uk.reuters.com/article/2011/05/17/uk-soccer-belgium-champions-idUKTRE74G7D120110517|publisher=Reuters|accessdate=27 May 2011|date=17 May 2011}} On 29 October 2011, De Bruyne scored his first hat-trick for Genk against [[Club Brugge K.V.|Club Brugge]], which ended in a 5–4 win for Genk.{{cite web|title=Kevin De Bruyne (3) stars as Genk win 5–4 at Club Brugge|url=http://www.101greatgoals.com/goals/europe/kevin-de-bruyne-3-stars-as-genk-win-5-4-at-club-brugge/}} On 28 January 2012, De Bruyne scored a brace against [[Oud-Heverlee Leuven|OH Leuven]] in a 5–0 win. On 18 February 2012, De Bruyne scored his first goal back at Genk following his agreed transfer to [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] and also assisted the other goal in a 1–2 away win against [[R.A.E.C. Mons|Mons]]. De Bruyne ended the season by wrapping up the scoring in a 3–1 victory over [[K.A.A. Gent|Gent]]. He finished the league campaign with eight goals from 28 appearances. ===Chelsea=== [[File:Kevin De Bruyne Chelsea vs AS-Roma 10AUG2013.jpg|thumb|right|100px|De Bruyne warming up with Chelsea in 2013]] On 31 January 2012, on the winter transfer deadline day, [[Premier League]] club Chelsea and Genk announced the permanent signing of De Bruyne, with the fee rumoured to be in the region of £7 million.{{cite news| title = Genk confirm De Bruyne sale| url =http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11095/7467271/Genk-confirm-De-Bruyne-sale | publisher = Sky Sport| date = 31 January 2012| accessdate = 31 January 2012 | first = Graeme | last = Bailey}} He signed a five-and-a-half-year contract at [[Stamford Bridge (stadium)|Stamford Bridge]], but would stay at Genk for the remainder of the 2011–12 season. De Bruyne told the club website, "To come to a team like Chelsea is a dream but now I have to work hard to achieve the level that's necessary."{{cite news|title=Kevin becomes a blue |url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/2594667 |archive-url=https://archive.is/20130425091338/http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/2594667 |dead-url=yes |archive-date=25 April 2013 |publisher=Chelsea F.C. |date=31 January 2012 |accessdate=7 July 2014 }}{{cite news| title = Chelsea sign Kevin De Bruyne from Genk| url = http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/16721393.stm | publisher = BBC Sport| date = 31 January 2012| accessdate = 31 January 2012}} On 18 July 2012, De Bruyne made his debut for Chelsea in a friendly match against [[Major League Soccer]] (MLS) side [[Seattle Sounders FC]] in a 4–2 win. De Bruyne also played the first half against [[Ligue 1]] giants [[Paris Saint-Germain F.C.|Paris Saint-Germain]] at [[Yankee Stadium]], [[New York City|New York]]. ====Werder Bremen (loan)==== [[File:Kevin de bruyne werder.JPG|thumb|left|175px|De Bruyne during his spell with Werder Bremen in 2012]] On 2 August 2012, Chelsea announced that De Bruyne was to join [[SV Werder Bremen|Werder Bremen]] in the [[Bundesliga]] on a season-long loan deal after having successfully completed a medical.{{cite web|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2182639/Kevin-Bruyne-joins-Werder-Bremen-season-long-loan.html|title=Chelsea send £7m youngster De Bruyne to Werder Bremen on season-long loan|work=Daily Mail}} De Bruyne scored his first goal for Bremen in a 3–2 defeat to [[Hannover 96]] on 15 September, netting from 11 yards out after being played in by [[Eljero Elia]].{{cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.com/gamecast/346384/gamecast.html |title=Hannover 96 3–2 Werder Bremen |publisher=ESPN FC |date=15 September 2012| accessdate = 7 July 2014}}{{cite web |url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/live/match/264956/report|title=Huszti is hero and villain|publisher=Sky Sports|date=15 September 2012|accessdate=7 July 2014}} De Bruyne continued his good form, scoring in Bremen's next game, a 2–2 draw with [[VfB Stuttgart]], on 23 September.{{cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.com/gamecast/346376/gamecast.html |title=Werder Bremen 2–2 VfB Stuttgart |publisher=ESPN FC |date=23 September 2012 | accessdate = 7 July 2014}}{{cite web |url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/live/match/267321/report|title=Honours even at Weser Stadion|publisher=Sky Sports|date=23 September 2012|accessdate=7 July 2014}} De Bruyne got back on the score sheet on 18 November, scoring the winning goal — despite his team being down to 10 men — as Bremen came from a goal down to defeat [[Fortuna Düsseldorf]] 2–1.{{cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.com/gamecast/346299/gamecast.html |title= Werder Bremen 2–1 Fortuna Düsseldorf |publisher=ESPN FC |date=18 November 2012 | accessdate = 7 July 2014}}{{cite web |url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/live/match/279413/report|title=Winning start for Schaaf|publisher=Sky Sports|date=19 November 2012|accessdate=7 July 2014}} De Bruyne scored his first goal in over two months on 4 May 2013, since netting a consolation goal in [[FC Bayern Munich|Bayern Munich]]'s 6–1 hammering of Bremen, putting his side up 2–0 at home to [[TSG 1899 Hoffenheim]] before a late brace from [[Sven Schipplock]] meant that the game finished 2–2.{{cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.com/gamecast/346123/gamecast.html |title=Werder Bremen 2–2 TSG Hoffenheim |publisher=ESPNFC |date=4 May 2013}}{{cite web |url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/live/match/265457/report|title=Hoffenheim fight back to draw|publisher=Sky Sports|date=4 May 2013|accessdate=7 July 2014}} He followed this up with a goal in Bremen's next match, securing a place in the Bundesliga for the next season with a 1–1 draw against [[Eintracht Frankfurt]] on 11 May.{{cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.com/gamecast/346110/gamecast.htm |title=Werder Bremen 1–1 Eintracht Frankfurt |publisher=ESPNFC |date=11 May 2013 }}{{cite web |url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/live/match/265466/report|title=Eagles secure a point|publisher=Sky Sports|date=11 May 2013|accessdate=7 July 2014}} ====Return to Chelsea==== After a successful loan spell in the Bundesliga with Werder Bremen, De Bruyne was linked with a move to stay in Germany with either [[Borussia Dortmund]] or [[Bayer 04 Leverkusen|Bayer Leverkusen]]. Incoming manager [[José Mourinho]], however, assured De Bruyne he was a part of Chelsea's plan for the future, and the player officially returned to Chelsea on 1 July 2013.{{cite web|title=De Bruyne to fight for Chelsea place| url=http://espnfc.com/news/story/_/id/1481782/de-bruyne-fight-chelsea-place?cc=5901|publisher=ESPNFC|date=21 June 2013}} De Bruyne injured a knee while scoring his first goal for Chelsea, in a pre-season friendly game against a Malaysia XI,{{cite news |title=Chelsea: Kevin De Bruyne set for scan on knee injury |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/23400115 |first=Richard |last=Conway |publisher=BBC Sport |date=22 July 2013 |accessdate=3 September 2014}} but was fit to make his competitive debut on the opening day of the [[2013–14 Premier League]] season against [[Hull City A.F.C.|Hull City]], and made an assist for the first goal in a 2–0 win.{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2013/aug/18/chelsea-hull-city-premier-league |title=José Mourinho enjoys stylish return as Chelsea cruise against Hull |first=Daniel |last=Taylor |newspaper=The Guardian |date=18 August 2013 |accessdate=3 September 2014}} ===Wolfsburg=== ====2013–14 season==== On 18 January 2014, [[VfL Wolfsburg|Wolfsburg]] signed De Bruyne for a fee of £18 million (€22 million).{{cite web |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2014/jan/18/chelsea-sell-kevin-de-bruyne-wolfsburg |title=Chelsea sell Kevin De Bruyne to Wolfsburg |work=[[The Guardian]] |date=18 January 2014 |accessdate=18 January 2014}} On 25 January 2014, he made his debut for Wolfsburg in a 3–1 home loss against [[Hannover 96]].{{cite web|url=http://www.sportsmole.co.uk/football/wolfsburg/team-news/team-news-de-bruyne-straight-in-for-wolfsburg_132637.html |title=Team News: Kevin de Bruyne straight in for Wolfsburg |work=Sports Mole |date=25 January 2014 |accessdate=7 July 2014}} On 12 April 2014, De Bruyne assisted 2 goals in their 4–1 home win against [[1. FC Nürnberg]].{{cite web|url=http://www.whoscored.com/Matches/724028/Live/Germany-Bundesliga-2013-2014-Wolfsburg-Nurnberg |title=Wolfsburg-Nurnberg Live |work=Whoscored.com |date= |accessdate=7 July 2014}} After a week he scored his first goal for Wolfsburg in 3–1 away win against [[Hamburger SV]].{{cite web|url=http://www.bundesliga.com/en/liga/news/2013/0000291918.php |title=De Bruyne: 'We want nine points' | VfL Wolfsburg | Matchday 31 | Reaction – Bundesliga – official website |publisher=Bundesliga |date=20 April 2014 |accessdate=7 July 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140422233138/http://www.bundesliga.com/en/liga/news/2013/0000291918.php |archivedate=22 April 2014 |df= }} He also scored in the last two matches of the [[2013–14 Bundesliga|Bundesliga]] helping his team to win against [[VfB Stuttgart]] and [[Borussia Mönchengladbach]]. ====2014–15 season==== [[File:Emirates Cup - Arsenal v Wolfsburg (20011199918).jpg|thumbnail|De Bruyne playing for Wolfsburg against [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] in July 2015]] De Bruyne scored his first goal of the [[2014–15 VfL Wolfsburg season|2014–15 season]] on 2 October 2014, volleying in a clearance from outside the box to salvage a 1–1 draw against [[LOSC Lille Métropole|Lille]] in the [[2014-15 UEFA Europa League|Europa League]].{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/season=2015/matches/round=2000587/match=2014469/postmatch/report/index.html |title=Wolfsburg rally to peg back LOSC |work=UEFA |date=2 October 2014 |accessdate=3 October 2014 }} In the third group match away to [[FC Krasnodar|Krasnodar]] on 23 October, De Bruyne scored twice as Wolfsburg secured their first win in the competition with a 4–2 victory.{{cite web |url=http://www.bundesliga.com/en/el/news/2014/0000305024.php |title=De Bruyne Double Fires Wolfsburg to First European Win |work=Bundesliga |date=23 October 2014 |accessdate=23 October 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141101165628/http://www.bundesliga.com/en/el/news/2014/0000305024.php |archivedate=1 November 2014 }} On 30 January 2015, he scored another brace in a 4–1 home win against Bayern Munich, their first Bundesliga defeat since April 2014.{{cite news|last1=Begley|first1=Emlyn|title= VfL Wolfsburg 4–1 Bayern Munich|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/30991047|accessdate=17 March 2015|work=BBC Sport|date=30 January 2015}} On 1 March 2015, De Bruyne assisted three goals in a 5–3 win over his former club Werder Bremen.{{cite web|url = http://www.espn.co.uk/football/sport/match/540771.html|title = Werder Bremen 3–5 VfL Wolfsburg|date = 1 March 2015|accessdate = 17 March 2015|work = ESPN (UK)|last = |first = }} On 12 March 2015, De Bruyne scored two goals in a 3–1 first-leg Europa League round-of-16 victory over [[F.C. Internazionale Milano|Internazionale]].{{cite web|url = http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/season=2015/matches/round=2000589/match=2014610/postmatch/report/index.html#de+bruyne+unpicks+inter|title = De Bruyne-powered Wolfsburg snap back at Inter|date = 12 March 2015|accessdate = 15 March 2015|website = UEFA.COM|publisher =UEFA |last = |first = }} On 15 March 2015, he scored one goal and assisted another two in 3–0 victory over [[SC Freiburg]].{{cite news|url = https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/31875612|title = VfL Wolfsburg 3–0 Sport-Club Freiburg|date = 15 March 2015|accessdate = 17 March 2015|work = BBC Sport}} De Bruyne ended the league season with 10 goals and 21 assists, the latter a new [[Bundesliga records#Assists|Bundesliga record]], as Wolfsburg finished second in the [[2014–15 Bundesliga|Bundesliga]] and qualified for the [[2015–16 UEFA Champions League]].{{cite news|url=http://www.rtbf.be/sport/football/etranger/allemagne/detail_de-bruyne-entre-dans-l-histoire-de-la-bundesliga?id=8982166|title=De Bruyne entre dans l'histoire de la Bundesliga|language=French|date=16 May 2015|work=RTBF Sport}} On 30 May 2015, he started and scored in the [[2015 DFB-Pokal Final]] as ''Die Wölfe'' defeated [[Borussia Dortmund]] 3–1 at the [[Olympiastadion (Berlin)|Olympiastadion]] in [[Berlin]].{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/32938029|title=Borussia Dortmd 1–3 VfL Wolfsburg|date=30 May 2015|work=BBC Sport}} De Bruyne ended his breakout season with 16 goals and 27 assists in all competitions,{{cite web|title='Kevin De Bruyne is off to Man City' says Wolfsburg director Klaus Allofs|url=http://www.espnfc.com/story/2585622/kevin-de-bruyne-is-off-to-manchester-city-says-wolfsburg|publisher=[[ESPN FC]]|accessdate=28 August 2015|date=28 August 2015}} and was named the 2015 [[Footballer of the Year in Germany]]. ====2015–16 season==== De Bruyne began the season by winning the [[2015 DFL-Supercup]] against [[FC Bayern Munich|Bayern Munich]], providing the cross for [[Nicklas Bendtner]]'s 89th-minute equaliser for a 1–1 draw and then scoring in the subsequent [[penalty shoot-out (association football)|penalty shootout]].{{cite news|last1=Dunbar|first1=Ross|title=Bendtner leads Wolfsburg over Bayern Munich on penalties in German Super Cup clash|url=http://www.foxsports.com/soccer/story/bendtner-leads-wolfsburg-over-bayern-munich-on-penalties-in-german-super-cup-clash-080115?vid=null|accessdate=3 August 2015|publisher=Fox Sports|date=1 August 2015}} On 8 August 2015, he continued his good form by scoring his first goal of the season, and providing two assists in a 4–1 win at [[Stuttgarter Kickers]] in the first round of the [[2015–16 DFB-Pokal|DFB-Pokal]].{{cite web|title=De Bruynes artwork rewarded wide awake Wolves|url=http://www.kicker.de/news/fussball/dfbpokal/spielrunde/dfb-pokal/2015-16/1/2841065/spielbericht_stuttgarter-kickers-26_vfl-wolfsburg-24.html|publisher=Kicker|accessdate=10 August 2015|date=8 August 2015}} In August, De Bruyne, in the midst of transfer speculation, insisted that he would not force Wolfsburg to sell him, but admitted that he could not ignore interest from [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]], saying: "If an offer does come, I will hear about it and how much it is, but I have not yet heard anything... I would not go to England just to prove that I can play there. I do not have to go to England... If I go there it’s because for me and for my family it is a good choice. That’s the key for me."{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/en-gb/news/2892/transfer-zone/2015/08/03/14113752/de-bruyne-i-will-not-force-wolfsburg-to-sell-me |title=Manchester City transfer news: Kevin De Bruyne: I will not force Wolfsburg to sell me |publisher=Goal.com |date=3 August 2015 |accessdate=10 August 2015}} On 10 August, it was reported that Manchester City had made a second bid for De Bruyne worth £47 million. Wolfsburg sporting director, [[Klaus Allofs]], stated that the club would fight to keep him, saying "I think some other clubs have definitely turned Kevin’s head... Some huge figures are doing the rounds and I can understand why Kevin is leaving everything open."{{cite news|author=Jackson, Jamie |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2015/aug/10/kevin-de-bruyne-manchester-city-wolfsburg-47m |title=Manchester City make second bid of £47m for Wolfsburg's Kevin De Bruyne |work=The Guardian |date=10 August 2015 |accessdate=10 August 2015}} On 27 August, it was reported that Manchester City had made a bid for De Bruyne worth £58 million. Klaus Allofs said that City had made an "astonishing" wage offer to De Bruyne.{{cite news|title = Kevin de Bruyne: Man City offer 'astonishing' wages |url = https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34081920 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=27 August 2015 |accessdate=27 August 2015}} ===Manchester City=== ====2015–16 season==== [[File:Kevin De Bruyne (24640482031) (cropped).jpg|thumb|De Bruyne playing for [[Manchester City F.C.|Man City]] in January 2016.|185px]] On 30 August 2015, Manchester City announced the arrival of De Bruyne on a six-year contract, for a reported club-record fee of £55 million (€75 million), making him the second most expensive transfer in British football history after [[Ángel Di María]]'s move to [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] in 2014.{{cite web|url=http://www.mcfc.co.uk/News/Team-news/2015/August/Kevin-De-Bruyne-signs-for-Manchester-City/1440878814 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150831144344/http://www.mcfc.co.uk/News/Team-news/2015/August/Kevin-De-Bruyne-signs-for-Manchester-City/1440878814 |dead-url=yes |archive-date=31 August 2015 |title=Kevin De Bruyne signs for Manchester City |date=30 August 2015 |accessdate=30 August 2015 |publisher=Manchester City |df= }}{{cite news|title = Man City sign midfielder De Bruyne|url = https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33686731 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=30 August 2015 |accessdate=30 August 2015}} He made his debut for the team in the [[Premier League]] on 12 September against [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]], replacing injured [[Sergio Agüero]] in the 25th minute.{{cite news|title=Premier League leaders Manchester City continued their 100% start to the season with an injury-time winner over Crystal Palace.|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/34160754|accessdate=14 September 2015|publisher=[[BBC Sport]]|date=12 September 2015}} On 19 September, he scored his first goal for the club against [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] in first half stoppage time in an eventual 2–1 loss.{{cite news |author=JJ Bull |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/football-live-blogs/11874291/Manchester-City-vs-West-Ham-United-live.html |title=Manchester City vs West Ham United: as it happened |work=[[The Daily Telegraph]] |date=20 September 2015 |accessdate=20 September 2015}} He went on to score in a 4–1 [[2015–16 Football League Cup|League Cup]] win against [[Sunderland A.F.C.|Sunderland]], on 22 September{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34253381 |title=Sunderland 1–4 Manchester City |publisher=BBC Sport |date=22 September 2015 |accessdate=23 September 2015}} and a 4–1 loss to [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] in the Premier League on 26 September.{{cite news |url=http://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/tottenham-hotspur-v-manchester-city-10138638 |title=Recap: Spurs hit four after De Bruyne puts Blues ahead |work=Manchester Evening News |date=26 September 2015 |accessdate=28 September 2015}} On 3 October, he scored in the team's 6–1 win against [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]].{{cite news|last=Bevan |first=Chris |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34366600 |title=Manchester City 6–1 Newcastle United |publisher=BBC Sport |date=3 October 2015 |accessdate=28 January 2016}} On 2 October, De Bruyne was announced as one of the players on the longlist for the prestigious [[FIFA Ballon d'Or]] award, alongside such teammates as Sergio Agüero and [[Yaya Touré]].{{cite news|url=http://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ballon-dor-list-leaked-fifa-10180903 |title=Ballon d'Or shortlist: Eight Manchester-based players in running for award |work=Manchester Evening News |date=2 October 2015 |accessdate=28 January 2016}} Just 18 days later, on 20 October he was revealed by [[FIFA]] as one of the players on the 23-man shortlist for the Ballon d'Or.{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34578624 |title=Ballon d'Or: Ronaldo & Messi joined by Aguero & Toure on list |publisher=BBC Sport |date=20 October 2015 |accessdate=28 January 2016}} On 21 October, De Bruyne scored an injury-time winner against [[Sevilla FC|Sevilla]] in the [[2015–16 UEFA Champions League|UEFA Champions League]], to take City within one point of group leaders [[Juventus F.C.|Juventus]], with three games remaining.{{cite news |author=Daniel Taylor |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2015/oct/21/manchester-city-sevilla-champions-league-match-report |title=Kevin De Bruyne's late strike earns Manchester City victory over Sevilla |work=The Guardian |date= |accessdate=28 January 2016}} On 1 December, he scored a brace in a 4–1 win over [[Hull City A.F.C.|Hull City]] to send Manchester City through to the semi-finals of the Football League Cup.{{cite news |author=Daniel Taylor |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2015/dec/01/manchester-city-hull-city-capital-one-cup-match-report |title=Kevin De Bruyne hits double as Manchester City send Hull packing |work=The Guardian |date= |accessdate=28 January 2016}} On 27 January 2016, De Bruyne scored one in a League Cup semi-final 3–1 victory over [[Everton F.C.|Everton]], but sustained an injury to his right knee that would keep him out of the team for two months.{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/35425113 |title=Kevin de Bruyne: Man City midfielder set for 10 weeks out|publisher=BBC Sport |date= |accessdate=28 January 2016}} On 2 April, De Bruyne made his return from injury in a 4–0 win against [[A.F.C. Bournemouth|Bournemouth]] at [[Dean Court]], scoring the team's second goal in the twelfth minute.{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2016/apr/02/bournemouth-manchester-city-premier-league-match-report|title=Manchester City’s Kevin De Bruyne inspires thrashing of Bournemouth|date=3 April 2016|work=The Guardian}} Four days later, he scored the opening goal in a 2–2 draw with [[Paris Saint-Germain F.C.|Paris Saint-Germain]] in the [[2015–16 UEFA Champions League knockout phase#Quarter-finals|UEFA Champions League quarter-final]] first-leg at the [[Parc des Princes]].{{Cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2016/04/06/psg-2-man-city-2-fernandinho-and-kevin-de-bruyne-give-city-cause/|title=PSG 2 Man City 2: Fernandinho and Kevin de Bruyne give City cause to dream in Champions League|date=6 April 2016|work=The Daily Telegraph}} On 12 April, De Bruyne scored the winning goal against Paris Saint-Germain, advancing Manchester to the Champions League semi-finals, for the first time in the club’s history, on an aggregate score of 3–2. Writing in ''[[The Independent]]'', Mark Ogden said, "It was a stunning goal from the Belgian, who took a touch to control the ball before curling it beyond [[Kevin Trapp]] from the edge of the penalty area."{{cite web|author=Mark Ogden |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/manchester-city-vs-psg-match-report-kevin-de-bruyne-stars-as-slick-city-charge-to-semi-final-a6981596.html |title=Manchester City vs PSG match report: Kevin De Bruyne stars as slick City charge to semi-final |work=The Independent |date=12 April 2016 |accessdate=12 April 2016}} De Bruyne's next goal came on 8 May 2016 in a 2–2 draw with [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]], although the result left City's Champions League qualification hopes out of their own hands.{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36180831|title=Manchester City 2–2 Arsenal|publisher=BBC Sport|date=8 May 2016|accessdate=8 May 2016}}[[File:Kevin de Bruyne 2016-12-26 (cropped).jpg|left|thumb|233x233px|De Bruyne during a match against [[Hull City A.F.C.|Hull City]] on 26 December 2016.]] ====2016–17 season==== {{Quote box | quote = "I think he is a special, outstanding player. He makes everything. Without the ball he is the first fighter, and with the ball he is clear – he sees absolutely everything." | source = —[[Pep Guardiola]] on 17 September 2016 describing De Bruyne after his brilliant performances for City{{cite web | url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11679/10583036/kevin-de-bruyne-just-behind-lionel-messi-says-manchester-city-manager-pep-guardiola | title=Kevin De Bruyne just behind Lionel Messi, says Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola | publisher=Sky Sports | accessdate=18 September 2016}} | align = right | width = 33% }} On 10 September 2016, De Bruyne scored and assisted in the first [[Manchester derby]] of the [[2016–17 Premier League|season]] which City won 2–1 and was awarded the ''Man of the Match''.{{Cite web|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-3782950/Manchester-United-1-2-Manchester-City-Kevin-Bruyne-Kelechi-Iheanacho-Pep-Guardiola-local-bragging-rights-Jose-Mourinho.html|title=Manchester United 1–2 Manchester City: De Bruyne and Iheanacho net|date=10 September 2016|access-date=10 September 2016|work=[[Daily Mail]]}} On 17 September 2016, De Bruyne was awarded the ''Man of the Match'', in a 4–0 win over Bournemouth. De Bruyne scored the first, assisted the fourth, and provided key passes on both the second and third goals.{{cite web|title=Manchester City v Bournemouth Premier League match report|url=http://www.mancity.com/news/first-team/2016/09/17/city-v-bournemouth-16-september/1474036032274|website=Manchester City|date=17 September 2017|accessdate=18 September 2016}} After the international break, Manchester City drew their next game, against Everton, played on 15 October 2016 with the scoreline finishing at 1–1.
