{{Use British English|date=November 2017}} {{Use dmy dates|date=November 2017}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Fabian Delph | image = MC-Shahter (1).jpg | image_size = 200 | caption = Delph playing for [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] in 2017 | fullname = Fabian Delph<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/612828 |title=Updated squads for 2017/18 Premier League confirmed |publisher=Premier League |date=2 February 2018 |accessdate=12 February 2018}}</ref> | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1989|11|21|df=y}}<ref>{{cite book |editor-first=Barry J. |editor-last=Hugman |title=The PFA Footballers' Who's Who 2010–11 |year=2010 |publisher=Mainstream Publishing |location=Edinburgh |isbn=978-1-84596-601-0 |page=114}}</ref> | birth_place = [[Bradford]], England | height = {{convert|1.74|m|order=flip}}<ref name=Soccerway>{{cite web |url=https://uk.soccerway.com/players/fabian-delph/53097/ |title=F. Delph: Summary |website=Soccerway |publisher=Perform Group |accessdate=25 November 2018}}</ref> | position = [[Midfielder]] / [[Left-back]] | currentclub = [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] | clubnumber = 18 | youthyears1 = 2000–2001 | youthclubs1 = [[Bradford City A.F.C.|Bradford City]] | youthyears2 = 2001–2006 | youthclubs2 = [[Leeds United F.C.|Leeds United]] | years1 = 2006–2009 | clubs1 = [[Leeds United F.C.|Leeds United]] | caps1 = 44 | goals1 = 6 | years2 = 2009–2015 | clubs2 = [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]] | caps2 = 112 | goals2 = 3 | years3 = 2012 | clubs3 = → [[Leeds United F.C.|Leeds United]] (loan) | caps3 = 5 | goals3 = 0 | years4 = 2015– | clubs4 = [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] | caps4 = 57 | goals4 = 4 | nationalyears1 = 2008 | nationalteam1 = [[England national under-19 football team|England U19]] | nationalcaps1 = 2 | nationalgoals1 = 0 | nationalyears2 = 2008–2009 | nationalteam2 = [[England national under-21 football team|England U21]] | nationalcaps2 = 4 | nationalgoals2 = 0 | nationalyears3 = 2014– | nationalteam3 = [[England national football team|England]] | nationalcaps3 = 18 | nationalgoals3 = 0 | club-update = 12:51, 27 January 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 00:41, 25 November 2018 (UTC) }} '''Fabian Delph''' (born 21 November 1989) is an English professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[midfielder]] or a [[left-back]] for {{English football updater|ManchesC}} club [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] and the [[England national football team|English national team]].
He was on the books of [[Bradford City A.F.C.|Bradford City]] as a youngster until he moved to [[Leeds United F.C.|Leeds United]] aged 11. Having played 45 matches for Leeds at [[EFL League One|League One]] level and once in the [[EFL Championship|Championship]], he transferred to Premier League club [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]] in August 2009 for £6 million. In 2012, he returned to Leeds for a short loan spell. Delph had a successful start to the [[2012–13 Premier League]] season, leading Villa manager [[Paul Lambert]] to call for his inclusion in the England squad.<ref>{{cite news |publisher=Sky Sports |date=6 October 2013 |title=Paul Lambert wants Fabian Delph to get called-up by England |url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/12016/8960270/paul-lambert-wants-fabian-delph-to-get-called-up-by-england}}</ref> In July 2015, Delph joined Manchester City for £8 million.
Delph represented England at under-19 and [[England national under-21 football team|under-21]] level and made his senior debut in a friendly against [[Norway national football team|Norway]] on 3 September 2014.
==Club career== ===Leeds United=== [[File:Fabian Delph York City v. Leeds United 1.png|thumb|upright|Delph playing for [[Leeds United F.C.|Leeds United]] in 2009]]
Born in [[Bradford]], West Yorkshire on 21 November 1989,<ref name="leeds profile">{{cite web |url=http://origin-www.leedsunited.com/page/PlayerProfiles/0,,10273~39837,00.html |title=Fabian Delph |publisher=Leeds United F.C. |accessdate=30 March 2014 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140331013825/http://origin-www.leedsunited.com/page/PlayerProfiles/0,,10273~39837,00.html |archive-date=31 March 2014 |dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all }}</ref><ref>{{Cite book |title=Leeds United The Next Chapter: Official Handbook 2008/09 |publisher=Leeds United F.C. |year=2008}}</ref> Delph started his career in football as a youngster at [[Bradford City A.F.C.|Bradford City]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.thetelegraphandargus.co.uk/display.var.2034944.0.0.php |title=Youth team provide conveyor-belt of talent |accessdate=11 May 2008 |date=11 February 2008 |newspaper=Telegraph & Argus |location=Bradford}}</ref> Delph left City in September 2001 to join [[Leeds United F.C.|Leeds United]] after he was recommended to their academy coach [[Greg Abbott (footballer)|Greg Abbott]] by former Bradford manager [[Paul Jewell]], whose son played with Delph.<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://www.thetelegraphandargus.co.uk/sport/3674693.City_can_cash_in_on_Delph_progress/ |title=City can cash in on Delph progress |date=15 September 2008 |accessdate=30 March 2014 |newspaper=Telegraph & Argus |location=Bradford |first=Simon |last=Parker}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |url=http://www.news-and-star.co.uk/carlisle_united/latest/1.339259|archive-url=https://archive.is/20120906133143/http://www.news-and-star.co.uk/carlisle_united/latest/1.339259|dead-url=yes|archivedate=6 September 2012 |title=Fab Leeds wonderkid set to take on Carlisle United |date=7 January 2009 |accessdate=16 January 2009 |newspaper=News and Star |location=Carlisle |first=Jon |last=Colman}}</ref> He went to Tong Secondary School, which he left in 2006 to sign a two-year scholarship with Leeds United, at the age of 16 years.{{citation needed|date=April 2017}} He completed his studies at the partner school to Leeds, [[Boston Spa School]].{{citation needed|date=April 2017}}
After a string of impressive performances in spring 2007, Delph was made [[captain (association football)|captain]] of the Leeds Reserves.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-1083120/Leeds-insist-dodgy-deals-Delph-boy.html |title=Leeds insist there will be no dodgy deals for their Delph boy |first=Simon |last=Cass |newspaper=Daily Mail |date=5 November 2008 |accessdate=30 March 2014 |location=London}}{{Unreliable source?|date=April 2017}}</ref> He was given his debut at Leeds as a substitute in the final match of the 2006–07 season against [[Derby County F.C.|Derby County]] on 6 May 2007, a match in which [[Robert Bayly]] was also given a debut for Leeds.<ref name=sb0607/> He was awarded his first professional contract on 11 January 2008,{{citation needed|date=April 2017}} and made two appearances for Leeds in the [[2007–08 Leeds United F.C. season|2007–08 season]], both as a substitute.<ref name=sb0708/>
Delph impressed in the 2008–09 pre-season friendly against [[Barnet F.C.|Barnet]], earning praise from both manager [[Gary McAllister]]<ref>{{cite web |url=http://origin-www.leedsunited.com/news/fabs-chance-20080731_2247585_1355172 |archive-url=https://archive.today/20140331213122/http://origin-www.leedsunited.com/news/fabs-chance-20080731_2247585_1355172 |dead-url=yes |archive-date=31 March 2014 |title=Fab's chance |date=31 July 2008 |accessdate=30 March 2014 |publisher=Leeds United F.C. }}</ref> and former Leeds player [[Eddie Gray (footballer, born 1948)|Eddie Gray]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://109.228.17.149/phpbb/viewtopic.php?f=1&t=774&start=100#p18165|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140331011505/http://109.228.17.149/phpbb/viewtopic.php?f=1&t=774&start=100|dead-url=yes|archivedate=31 March 2014 |title=Mega News Men! Fab Fabian in Euro 2008 squad! |publisher=The Square Ball |date=26 July 2008 |accessdate=30 March 2014}}</ref> He made his first [[EFL Cup|League Cup]] start in Leeds' 5–2 win away at [[Chester City F.C.|Chester City]] in the first round on 13 August 2008.{{citation needed|date=April 2017}} Having gained more first-team experience, on 5 September 2008, Delph signed a new four-year contract at Leeds.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://origin-www.leedsunited.com/page/LatestNewsDetail/0,,10273~1385610,00.html |title=The future's Fab |date=5 September 2008 |accessdate=30 March 2014 |publisher=Leeds United F.C. }}{{Dead link|date=February 2019 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> He celebrated his new contract by scoring his first senior goal the following day as Leeds defeated [[Crewe Alexandra F.C.|Crewe Alexandra]] 5–2.<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_div_2/7588595.stm |title=Leeds 5–2 Crewe |date=6 September 2008 |accessdate=6 September 2008 |publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref> He soon followed it up by scoring twice, both "superb goals" from long range, against [[Walsall F.C.|Walsall]] during a 3–0 win.<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_div_2/7674531.stm |title=Leeds 3–0 Walsall |date=25 October 2008 |accessdate=25 October 2008 |publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref>
Delph's form attracted the attention of Premier League managers, with [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]]'s [[Arsène Wenger]] reported to be lining up a £6 million bid for the midfielder,<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://www.mirrorfootball.co.uk/news/Arsenal-weighing-up-pound-6m-bid-for-Leeds-star-Fabian-Delph-article33682.html |title=Arsenal weighing up £6m bid for Leeds star Fabian Delph |accessdate=30 March 2014 |newspaper=Daily Mirror |location=London}}</ref> and [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]] having a bid rejected by Leeds chairman [[Ken Bates]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-1082885/Leeds-reject-Newcastle-bid-midfield-maestro-Fabian-Delph-Arsenal-continue-circle.html |title=Leeds reject Newcastle bid for midfield maestro Fabian Delph as Arsenal continue to circle |date=4 November 2008 |accessdate=5 November 2008 |newspaper=Daily Mail |location=London}}{{Unreliable source?|date=April 2017}}</ref> His performances also prompted [[Stuart Pearce]] to give Delph his first call-up to the [[England national under-21 football team|England under-21]] squad in November 2008.<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/s/sheff_utd/7722664.stm |title=England call for Blades' Naughton |date=11 November 2008 |accessdate=11 November 2008 |publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref> He was a late substitute for [[Craig Gardner]] as England defeated [[Czech Republic national under-21 football team|Czech Republic]] to win his first under-21 cap on 18 November.<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/internationals/7736671.stm |title=England U21 2–0 Czech Rep U21 |date=18 November 2008 |accessdate=19 November 2008 |publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref> During the January 2009 transfer window, Leeds rejected another two bids from Premier League for Delph, with Bates saying: "We explained to both clubs that we don't deal in petty cash."<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/l/leeds_united/7833086.stm |title=Leeds reject approaches for Delph |date=16 January 2009 |accessdate=16 January 2009 |publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref> The following day he scored a "goal of genuine quality" against [[Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.|Brighton & Hove Albion]] by finding the top corner of the goal with a curling shot following a long run. Manager [[Simon Grayson]] said: "If he scores goals like that, his value is going to go up. It certainly won't go down."<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://www.thetelegraphandargus.co.uk/sport/football/footballleeds/4056468.Delph_strike_adds_to_growing_worth/ |title=Delph strike adds to growing worth |date=18 January 2009 |accessdate=18 January 2009 |newspaper=Telegraph & Argus |location=Bradford}}</ref> Despite the attention of Premier League managers, Delph remained with Leeds as the January transfer window closed.<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://www.yorkshirepost.co.uk/leeds/Leeds-hold-on-to-star.4937760.jp |title=Leeds hold on to star and make double signing |date=2 February 2009 |accessdate=2 February 2009 |newspaper=Yorkshire Post |location=Leeds |first=Richard |last=Sutcliffe}}</ref>
By March 2009, his performances during the 2008–09 season earned Delph a nomination for the League One player of the year, which was won by [[Leicester City F.C.|Leicester City's]] [[Matty Fryatt]], and helped him to win the young player of the year in the end of season [[Football League Awards]].<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/7971194.stm |title=Ebanks-Blake scoops League honour |date=30 March 2009 |accessdate=30 March 2009 |publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref> The awards for the 2008–09 season did not end there, with Delph winning young player of the season, goal of the season, for his strike against Brighton and player's player of the season at the club awards.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/l/leeds_united/7999691.stm |title=Beckford and Delph win top awards |publisher=BBC Sport |date=15 April 2009 |accessdate=11 July 2015}}</ref> After Leeds lost out in the playoff semi-finals against Millwall,<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/competitions/league-one/5325188/Leeds-United-1-Millwall-1-Agg-1-2-Match-report.html |location=London |newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |title=Leeds United 1 Millwall 1: Match report |date=14 May 2009}}</ref> there was much speculation about Fabian's future at Leeds, however he did manage to play in Leeds' early pre-season matches, before ultimately Leeds turned down offers from other clubs and Delph completed his move to [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]].{{citation needed|date=April 2017}}
===Aston Villa=== After Leeds failed to gain promotion from [[EFL League One|League One]], several [[Premier League]] clubs including [[Everton F.C.|Everton]],<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/l/leeds_united/8092928.stm |title=Leeds deny Delph link to Everton |publisher=BBC Sport |date=10 June 2009 |accessdate=11 July 2015}}</ref> [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]],<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/l/leeds_united/8143153.stm |title=Man City move for Leeds teenager |publisher=BBC Sport |date=1 August 2009 |accessdate=11 July 2015}}</ref> [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]], [[Sunderland A.F.C.|Sunderland]],<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.skysports.com/story/0,19528,12876_5421672,00.html |title=Grayson – No bids for star duo |publisher=Sky Sports |accessdate=11 July 2015}}</ref> [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]]<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11675/5455090 |title=Redknapp hails Delph |publisher=Sky Sports |accessdate=11 July 2015}}</ref> and Aston Villa were linked with Delph. On 3 August 2009, Villa agreed an undisclosed fee with Leeds for the transfer of Delph to [[Villa Park]].<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://origin-www.leedsunited.com/news/fabian-delph-club-statement-20090803_2247585_1742285 |archive-url=https://archive.today/20140331213134/http://origin-www.leedsunited.com/news/fabian-delph-club-statement-20090803_2247585_1742285 |dead-url=yes |archive-date=31 March 2014 |title=Fabian Delph: Club statement |date=3 August 2009 |accessdate=30 March 2014 |publisher=Leeds United F.C. }}</ref> The transfer was concluded the following day after Delph completed a medical and agreed personal terms.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.avfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10265~1743439,00.html |title=Webflash: Delph signs |publisher=Aston Villa F.C. |accessdate=11 July 2015 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150713080607/http://www.avfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10265~1743439,00.html |archive-date=13 July 2015 |dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all }}</ref>
====Early career==== Delph's full Premier League debut came at home against [[Wigan Athletic F.C.|Wigan Athletic]] on 15 August 2009, the first day of the [[2009–10 Premier League]] season.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2009/aug/16/aston-villa-wigan-athletic-match-report |title=Aston Villa haunted by stark reality of no Gareth Barry and Martin Laursen |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |date=16 August 2009 |accessdate=9 April 2017}}</ref> In a match that Villa lost 2–0, Delph received a yellow card and was replaced in the 61st minute by [[Steve Sidwell]].<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/8197493.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |title=Aston Villa 0–2 Wigan |date=15 August 2009 |accessdate=2 May 2010}}</ref> On 23 January 2010 Delph scored his first goal for Aston Villa in the [[FA Cup]] win at home against Brighton & Hove Albion.<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/fa_cup/8468450.stm |title=Aston Villa 3–2 Brighton |publisher=BBC Sport |date=23 January 2010 |accessdate=24 January 2010 |first=Marc |last=Vesty}}</ref>
On 17 April 2010, Delph had to be carried away from training on a stretcher after picking up a "serious" knee injury. He was immediately taken for tests on the injury.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.avfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10265~2028597,00.html |title=Fabian Delph injury blow |publisher=Aston Villa F.C. |accessdate=11 July 2015 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150713080602/http://www.avfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10265~2028597,00.html |archive-date=13 July 2015 |dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all }}</ref> It was later revealed on 19 April 2010 that Delph had suffered a [[cruciate ligament]] injury, set to keep him out of action for up to eight months.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.skysports.com/story/0,19528,11677_6104145,00.html |publisher=Sky Sports |title=Delph out for eight months |date=19 April 2010}}</ref>
Delph returned to action on 26 February 2011, in a Premier League victory over [[Blackburn Rovers F.C.|Blackburn Rovers]], when he came on as an impromptu left-back after [[Nathan Baker]] was injured in the first half.{{citation needed|date=April 2017}}
On 3 March 2011, Delph signed a new deal with Aston Villa keeping him at the club until 2015.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/a/aston_villa/9413411.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |title=Delph signs extension with Villa |date=3 March 2011}}</ref> He scored his second goal for Villa against [[Tranmere Rovers F.C.|Tranmere Rovers]] in the League Cup on 28 August 2012.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/19340518 |title=Aston Villa 3–0 Tranmere |publisher=BBC Sport |date=28 August 2012 |accessdate=28 August 2012}}</ref>
On 20 January 2012, Delph re-signed for Leeds United on loan, initially until 25 February 2012.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/16645060.stm |title=Leeds United re-sign Aston Villa's Fabian Delph on loan |publisher=BBC Sport |date=20 January 2012 |accessdate=11 July 2015}}</ref> He made his second Leeds United debut against [[Ipswich Town F.C.|Ipswich Town]] on 21 January.{{citation needed|date=April 2017}} Delph picked up an ankle injury in Leeds' defeat to [[Coventry City F.C.|Coventry City]] and returned to Aston Villa for treatment on the injury.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://origin-www.leedsunited.com/news/20120216/fab-to-miss-rovers-clash_2247585_2613299 |title=Fab to miss Rovers clash |publisher=Leeds United F.C. |date=16 February 2012 |access-date=30 March 2014 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140331010607/http://origin-www.leedsunited.com/news/20120216/fab-to-miss-rovers-clash_2247585_2613299 |archive-date=31 March 2014 |dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all }}</ref> It was revealed that Delph would miss the end of the season, so his loan at Leeds was not renewed and he returned to his parent club.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://origin-www.leedsunited.com/news/20120222/a-not-so-fab-ending-for-delph_2247585_2619530 |title=A not so Fab ending for Delph |publisher=Leeds United F.C. |date=22 February 2012 |access-date=30 March 2014 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140331010612/http://origin-www.leedsunited.com/news/20120222/a-not-so-fab-ending-for-delph_2247585_2619530 |archive-date=31 March 2014 |dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all }}</ref>
During the 2012–13 Premier League season, Delph established himself as a regular in [[Paul Lambert]]'s team, finishing the season with 24 appearances.{{citation needed|date=April 2017}} In the later half of the season, Fabian put in some good performances and began to show a good partnership with [[Ashley Westwood (footballer, born 1990)|Ashley Westwood]] and [[Yacouba Sylla]] in the centre of midfield.{{citation needed|date=April 2017}}
====2013–14 season==== [[File:FabianDelph.JPG|thumb|upright|Delph playing for [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]] in 2013]]
Delph started the 2013–14 season very brightly, and put in some of his best performances in a Villa shirt.{{citation needed|date=April 2017}} In the 3–1 away win against Arsenal on the opening day of the season, Delph made a number of successful tackles and dribbles, as well as completing a large number of passes with a high accuracy percentage.{{citation needed|date=April 2017}} He saw a long range, low driven shot from his favoured left foot hit the inside of Arsenal goalkeeper [[Wojciech Szczęsny]]'s left post, coming very close to his first Premier League goal.{{citation needed|date=April 2017}} His good form continued four days later in a controversial 2–1 loss against Chelsea, and again the following weekend in a 0–1 loss against Liverpool.{{citation needed|date=April 2017}} His first goal of the season came in a 3–0 win over [[Rotherham United F.C.|Rotherham United]] in the League Cup third round.{{citation needed|date=April 2017}} He played a neat one-two with Benteke, took the first touch to control with his favoured left foot and finished with his right within the box.{{citation needed|date=April 2017}} His performances in the opening months of the season earned him the Aston Villa Player of the Month award for August, September and October 2013.{{citation needed|date=April 2017}}
Delph scored for the first time in Premier League with "a goal of brutal brilliance" to complete a 3–2 win away at [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] on 4 December.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2013/dec/04/southampton-aston-villa-premier-league-match-report |title=Fabian Delph's late strike earns Aston Villa thrilling victory at Southampton |first=Dominic |last=Fifield |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |date=4 December 2013 |accessdate=28 May 2014}}</ref> His performances over the season including stand out performances against Everton, Liverpool and Chelsea, resulted in him being voted Player of the Year by Aston Villa supporters.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.avfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10265~3807173,00.html |title=He's fab! Villa fans vote Delph their player of the year |publisher=Aston Villa F.C. |accessdate=11 July 2015 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150711064304/http://www.avfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10265~3807173,00.html |archive-date=11 July 2015 |dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all }}</ref>
====2014–15 season==== After reports that he could leave the club at the end of the season due to his contract expiring, Delph signed a four-and-a-half-year contract on 25 January 2015, keeping him at Villa until 2019.<ref>{{cite news |title=Fabian Delph: Aston Villa midfielder extends contract |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30974613 |accessdate=25 January 2015 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=25 January 2015}}</ref>
On 7 March, Delph scored the first goal as Villa defeated local rivals [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]] 2–0 to reach their first [[FA Cup semi-final]] since 2010. The victory prompted a pitch invasion by fans, who Delph claimed stole his captain's armband while kissing and biting him.<ref>{{cite news |title=FA Cup pitch invasion: Villa Park scenes disgraceful – Tony Pulis |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/31784681 |accessdate=8 March 2015 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=7 March 2015}}</ref> He scored the winning goal in the semi-final on 19 April, as Villa came from behind to defeat [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] 2–1 and reach their first [[FA Cup final]] since [[2000 FA Cup Final|2000]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Aston Villa 2–1 Liverpool |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/32273487 |accessdate=19 April 2015 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=19 April 2015}}</ref> On 30 May, Delph captained Aston Villa in the [[2015 FA Cup Final]] at [[Wembley Stadium]], where the team were defeated 4–0 by Arsenal.<ref name=2015FAC>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/32856754 |title=Arsenal 4–0 Aston Villa |first=Phil |last=McNulty |publisher=BBC Sport |date=30 May 2015 |accessdate=25 November 2018}}</ref>
On 10 July, Delph was reported to be having a medical ahead of an £8 million transfer to Manchester City.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11679/9909378/fabian-delph-to-have-manchester-city-medical-ahead-of-1638m-move-from-aston-villa |title=Fabian Delph to have Manchester City medical ahead of £8m move from Aston Villa |publisher=Sky Sports |accessdate=11 July 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33486125 |title=Fabian Delph: Man City set to sign Aston Villa captain |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=11 July 2015}}</ref> Delph never showed up for his scheduled medical, and subsequently released a statement on the Aston Villa website confirming he would be staying at the club and would not be moving to Manchester City.<ref name=AVStatement>{{cite web |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150713080557/http://www.avfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0%2C%2C10265~4856901%2C00.html |url=http://www.avfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10265~4856901,00.html |archivedate=13 July 2015 |date=11 July 2015 |title=Fabian Delph statement |publisher=Aston Villa F.C. |accessdate=17 November 2015 |deadurl=yes}}</ref> However, reports a week later emerged that Delph had again changed his mind and was having a medical at Manchester City ahead of a prospective move.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/man-city-transfers-fabian-delph-9678724 |title=Delph deal back on |newspaper=Manchester Evening News |accessdate=17 July 2015}}</ref>
===Manchester City=== ====2015–17==== On 17 July 2015, Delph signed a five-year contract with Premier League club Manchester City for a reported fee of £8 million, just six days after saying he would be staying at Aston Villa to captain them into the next season.<ref name=AVStatement/><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33571351 |title=Fabian Delph: Manchester City sign Aston Villa captain |publisher=BBC Sport |date=17 July 2015 |accessdate=17 July 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.espnfc.com/story/2526615/fabian-delph-moves-to-manchester-city-for-8-million |title=Fabian Delph moves to Manchester City from Aston Villa for £8 million |publisher=ESPN FC |date=17 July 2015 |accessdate=17 July 2015}}</ref> He made his debut a week later against [[Real Madrid C.F.|Real Madrid]] in the [[2015 International Champions Cup]] at the [[Melbourne Cricket ground]], but was substituted after 18 minutes for [[Jesús Navas]] due to injury, and City lost 1–4.<ref>{{cite news |title=Man City: Fabian Delph injured on debut in defeat by Real Madrid |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33651263 |accessdate=24 July 2015 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=24 July 2015}}</ref> Delph scored his first goal for Manchester City on 28 November 2015 against Southampton, the second in an eventual 3–1 win.<ref>{{cite news |title=Aston Villa 0–0 Manchester City |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/34691261 |accessdate=10 November 2015 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=8 November 2015}}</ref> His third goal for the club came in a 1–0 win over [[FC Steaua București|Steaua Bucharest]] in a Champions League qualifier in August 2016.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2016/aug/24/manchester-city-steaua-bucharest-champions-league-match-report |title=Fabian Delph's header helps Manchester City push past Steaua Bucharest |last=Jackson |first=Jamie |date=24 August 2016 |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |accessdate=27 October 2016}}</ref>
====2017–==== After an injury to [[Benjamin Mendy]], Delph established himself as Manchester City's starting left-back in the first half of the team's record breaking start to the [[2017–18 Manchester City F.C. season|2017–18 season]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2017/10/21/fabian-delph-became-pep-guardiolas-born-again-full-back/ |title=How Fabian Delph became Pep Guardiola's born-again full-back |date=21 October 2017 |newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |location=London}}</ref> He started 14 consecutive matches in the Premier League, scoring once against [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]], as City set a new [[Premier League records and statistics|record]] of 18 consecutive league wins.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11679/11186910/manchester-city-have-won-18-games-in-a-row-who-can-stop-them-now |title=Manchester City have won 18 games in a row: Who can stop them now? |date=27 December 2017 |publisher=Sky Sports}}</ref> He was sent off in the [[2017–18 FA Cup|FA Cup]] defeat to [[Wigan Athletic]] in February 2018 and then suffered a muscle problem, not returning to fitness until April.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.mancity.com/news/first-team/first-team-news/2018/april/liverpool-man-city-injury-news-champions-league |title=Liverpool v City: Aguero, Delph injury latest |date=3 April 2018 |publisher=mancity.com |accessdate=16 April 2018}}</ref>
==International career== [[File:Fabian Delph 2018-06-28 1.jpg|thumb|upright|Delph playing for [[England national football team|England]] at the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]]]]
In March 2008, Delph started his international career, making his debut as a substitute for the [[England national under-19 football team|England national under-19 team]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.thefa.com/england/mens-u19s/News/2009/U19s_report_russia |title=Tomkins at the double |accessdate=30 March 2014 |date=25 March 2008 |publisher=The Football Association}}</ref>
On 28 August 2014, Delph was named in the senior [[England national football team|England]] squad for the first time, ahead of a friendly against Norway and the first [[UEFA Euro 2016 qualifying|Euro 2016 qualifier]] against [[Switzerland national football team|Switzerland]].<ref>{{cite web |title=Roy calls up four new faces for Norway and Switzerland |url=http://www.thefa.com/news/england/2014/aug/norway-switzerland-squad-announcement-rose-colback-delph-chambers |accessdate=28 August 2014 |publisher=The Football Association |date=28 August 2014}}</ref> He made his international debut in the friendly against Norway on 3 September 2014, coming on as a 69th-minute substitute for [[Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain]] as England won 1–0.<ref>{{cite news |last1=McNulty |first1=Phil |title=England 1–0 Norway |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/28947896 |accessdate=3 September 2014 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=3 September 2014}}</ref> Five days later, in England's first match of UEFA Euro 2016 qualification, Delph made his first start and played the entirety of a 2–0 victory away to Switzerland at [[St. Jakob-Park]], [[Basel]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Switzerland 0–2 England |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29008534 |accessdate=8 September 2014 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=8 September 2014}}</ref> On 16 May 2016, Delph was announced to have been selected for the provisional [[UEFA Euro 2016]] England squad.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36300164 |title=Euro 2016: Marcus Rashford makes England provisional squad |publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=21 May 2016}}</ref> However, on 26 May he was ruled out of the tournament with a groin injury.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://metro.co.uk/2016/05/26/manchester-city-midfielder-fabian-delph-out-of-euro-2016-after-suffering-groin-injury-5906992/ |title=Manchester City midfielder Fabian Delph out of Euro 2016 after suffering groin injury |date=26 May 2016 |publisher=Metro |accessdate=16 April 2018}}</ref>
Delph was named in the 23-man squad for the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44138600 |title=England World Cup squad: Trent Alexander-Arnold in 23-man squad |publisher=BBC Sport |date=16 May 2018 |accessdate=17 May 2018}}</ref> He made his World Cup debut against [[Panama national football team|Panama]], coming on as a 63rd-minute substitute in a 6–1 win.<ref>{{Cite web |title=World Cup Player Focus #9: Fabian Delph |first=Rob |last=Pollard |publisher=Manchester City F.C. |date=27 June 2018 |accessdate=5 July 2018 |url=https://www.mancity.com/news/first-team/first-team-news/2018/june/world-cup-russia-fabian-delph-man-city-profile}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |title=World Cup 2018: England put six past Panama to reach last 16 |first=Phil |last=McNulty |publisher=BBC Sport |date=24 June 2018 |accessdate=5 July 2018 |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44439183}}</ref> He played the full 90 minutes of the final group game, against [[Belgium national football team|Belgium]].<ref>{{Cite web |title=World Cup 2018: England lose 1-0 to Belgium in final group game |first=Phil |last=McNulty |publisher=BBC Sport |date=28 June 2018 |accessdate=5 July 2018 |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44439312}}</ref>
Prior to his competitive debut for England, Delph was also eligible to represent [[Guyana national football team|Guyana]] through his ancestry.<ref>{{cite news |title=Where have the Golden Jaguars been hiding? |url=http://www.guyanatimesgy.com/?p=47039 |newspaper=Guyana Times |date=19 January 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140530002414/http://www.guyanatimesgy.com/?p=47039 |archivedate=30 May 2014}}</ref>
==Personal life== On 23 December 2008, Delph was arrested by police and charged for [[Driving under the influence|drink driving]] in [[Rothwell, West Yorkshire|Rothwell]], [[Leeds]], while driving home with four friends.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/england/west_yorkshire/7803336.stm |title=Footballer in drink drive charge |date=29 December 2008 |accessdate=29 December 2008 |publisher=BBC News}}</ref> He pleaded guilty at Leeds Magistrates' Court to the charge of driving whilst over the limit; he was fined £1,400, disqualified from driving for 18 months and ordered to pay costs of £60.<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://www.yorkshireeveningpost.co.uk/leedsunited/VIDEO-Leeds-United-star-banned.4916199.jp |title=Leeds United star banned for drink driving |date=27 January 2009 |accessdate=28 January 2009 |newspaper=Yorkshire Evening Post |location=Leeds |first=Stuart |last=Robinson}}</ref>
Delph has three daughters, the youngest of whom was born during the 2018 World Cup.<ref>{{Cite web |title=World Cup 2018: England's Fabian Delph welcomes third daughter |publisher=BBC Sport |date=4 July 2018 |accessdate=5 July 2018 |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44716124}}</ref>

{{Use dmy dates|date=August 2018}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Leroy Sané | image = 20180602 FIFA Friendly Match Austria vs. Germany Leroy Sané 850 0668.jpg | image_size = 200 | caption = Sané with [[Germany national football team|Germany]] in 2018 | fullname = Leroy Aziz Sané<ref name=FIFA>{{cite web |url=http://tournament.fifadata.com/documents/FCC/2017/PDF/FCC_2017_SQUADLISTS.PDF |title=FIFA Confederations Cup Russia 2017: List of players: Germany |publisher=FIFA |format=PDF |page=4 |date=20 March 2018 |accessdate=4 October 2018}}</ref> | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1996|1|11|df=y}}<ref name=FIFA/> | birth_place = [[Essen]], Germany | height = 1.83 m<ref name=PremProfile/> | position = [[Midfielder#Winger|Winger]] / [[Midfielder#Attacking midfielder|Attacking midfielder]] | currentclub = [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] | clubnumber = 19 | youthyears1 = 2001–2005 | youthclubs1 = [[SG Wattenscheid 09]] | youthyears2 = 2005–2008 | youthclubs2 = [[FC Schalke 04|Schalke 04]] | youthyears3 = 2008–2011 | youthclubs3 = [[Bayer 04 Leverkusen|Bayer Leverkusen]] | youthyears4 = 2011–2014 | youthclubs4 = [[FC Schalke 04|Schalke 04]] | years1 = 2014–2016 | clubs1 = [[FC Schalke 04|Schalke 04]] | caps1 = 47 | goals1 = 11 | years2 = 2016– | clubs2 = [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] | caps2 = 81 | goals2 = 23 | nationalyears1 = 2014–2015 | nationalteam1 = [[Germany national youth football team|Germany U19]] | nationalcaps1 = 11 | nationalgoals1 = 8 | nationalyears2 = 2015– | nationalteam2 = [[Germany national under-21 football team|Germany U21]] | nationalcaps2 = 10 | nationalgoals2 = 5 | nationalyears3 = 2015– | nationalteam3 = [[Germany national football team|Germany]] | nationalcaps3 = 17 | nationalgoals3 = 2 | club-update = 10:49, 7 February 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 23:58, 20 January 2019 (UTC) }} '''Leroy Aziz Sané''' ({{IPA-fr|ləʁwa sane}}, {{IPA-de|ˈliːʁɔʏ zaˈneː}}; born 11 January 1996) is a German professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Midfielder#Winger|winger]] and as an [[Midfielder#Attacking midfielder|attacking midfielder]] for {{English football updater|ManchesC}} club [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] and the [[Germany national football team|German national team]].
He made his professional debut for [[FC Schalke 04|Schalke 04]] in 2014 and transferred to Manchester City in 2016 for an initial £37 million fee. He was voted [[PFA Young Player of the Year]] in 2017–18 after helping City win the [[Premier League]] and [[EFL Cup]].
Sané made his senior international debut for Germany in November 2015 and was part of their squad that reached the semi-finals of [[UEFA Euro 2016]].
==Club career== ===Early career=== Sané began playing football in 2001 for the youth team of [[SG Wattenscheid 09]], for which his [[Souleyman Sané|father]] played early in his career. In 2005, he joined [[FC Schalke 04|Schalke 04]]. Three years later, he joined [[Bayer 04 Leverkusen|Bayer Leverkusen]]. In 2011, Sané returned to the youth academy (''Nachwuchsleistungszentrum'') of Schalke 04.
===Schalke 04=== On 21 March 2014, Sané signed a three-year professional contract with Schalke 04 extending until 30 June 2017.<ref name="Sane commits to Schalke">{{cite web |url=http://www.schalke04.de/en/news/140321_sane/page/827--86--.html |title=Sane commits to Schalke |publisher=FC Schalke 04 official website |date=21 March 2014 |accessdate=27 August 2014}}</ref> He made his [[Bundesliga]] debut on 20 April 2014 against [[VfB Stuttgart]].<ref name="VfB Stuttgart vs. Schalke 04 at Soccerway"/> He replaced [[Max Meyer (footballer)|Max Meyer]] after 77 minutes in a 3–1 away defeat.<ref name="VfB Stuttgart vs. Schalke 04 at Soccerway">{{cite web |url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2014/04/20/germany/bundesliga/vfb-stuttgart-1893-ev/fc-schalke-04/1487295/ |title=Stuttgart vs. Schalke 04 3 – 1 |publisher=Soccerway |date=20 April 2014 |accessdate=5 August 2015}}</ref> He scored his first goal of the [[2014–15 FC Schalke 04 season|season]] in a 2–1 home defeat to [[1. FC Köln]] on 13 December.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bundesliga.com/en/news/Bundesliga/blmd12v-ten-things-about-leroy-sane-fc-schalke-04.jsp |title=Ten things about Leroy Sané |publisher=Bundesliga |accessdate=17 August 2018}}</ref> On 11 March 2015, Sané scored in his first [[UEFA Champions League]] match in a 4–3 victory over [[Real Madrid C.F.|Real Madrid]], although his side were knocked out of the [[2014–15 UEFA Champions League|competition]] on 5–4 aggregate.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2015/mar/10/real-madrid-schalke-champions-league-match-report |title=Real Madrid made to sweat by never-say-die Schalke but shock averted |publisher=The Guardian |accessdate=17 August 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/31802502 |title=Real Madrid 3–4 Schalke (5–4 agg) |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=17 August 2018}}</ref>
===Manchester City===
====2016–17 season==== [[File:Manchester United v Manchester City, October 2016 (18).JPG|left|thumb|upright|Sané playing for [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] during the [[Manchester derby]] in October 2016.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/37700029 |title=Manchester United 1–0 Manchester City |date=26 October 2016 |work=BBC Sport|access-date=7 September 2018 |language=en-GB}}</ref>]] On 2 August 2016, Sané joined [[Premier League]] club [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]], signing a five-year contract for a reported £37 million transfer fee, with performance-related add-ons potentially making the fee £46.5 million.<ref name="Sane completes transfer to City">{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/36950347 |title=Leroy Sane: Germany midfielder joins Man City in £37m deal |publisher=BBC Sport |date=2 August 2016 |accessdate=2 August 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.espnfc.com/story/2920739/manchester-city-complete-signing-of-leroy-sane-from-schalke |title=Manchester City complete signing of Leroy Sane from Schalke |publisher=ESPN FC |date=2 August 2016 |accessdate=2 August 2016}}</ref> He made his debut in a 1–2 win, in the [[Manchester derby]] against [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]], on 10 September.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2016/sep/10/manchester-united-manchester-city-premier-league-match-report |title=Manchester City's derby delight as De Bruyne inspires win over United |work=The Guardian |accessdate=18 September 2016}}</ref> His first goal for City came in a 2–1 win against [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] at home in the Premier League, on 18 December.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/38279282 |title=Manchester City 2–1 Arsenal |publisher=BBC Sport |date=18 December 2016 |accessdate=28 January 2017}}</ref> Following a spell on the sidelines due to injury, Sané made his return in a game against [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] and scored in a 2–2 draw at the [[City of Manchester Stadium]] on 21 January 2017.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/38620041 |title=Manchester City 2–2 Tottenham Hotspur |publisher=BBC Sport |date=21 January 2017 |accessdate=28 January 2017}}</ref> On 28 January, he scored in a 3–0 away win over Crystal Palace in the [[2016–17 FA Cup|FA Cup]] [[2016–17 FA Cup#Fourth Round Proper|fourth round]] match.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/38700695 |title=Crystal Palace 0–3 Manchester City |date=2017 |work=BBC Sport|access-date=7 September 2018 |language=en-GB}}</ref> On 21 February, he scored in a 5–3 comeback win over [[AS Monaco FC|Monaco]] in the [[2016–17 UEFA Champions League|UEFA Champions League]] [[2016–17 UEFA Champions League#Round of 16|round of sixteen]] [[2016–17 UEFA Champions League knockout phase#Manchester City v Monaco|first leg match]].<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/39030973 |title=Manchester City 5–3 Monaco |date=21 February 2017 |work=BBC Sport|access-date=7 September 2018 |language=en-GB}}</ref> On 1 March, he scored in a 5–1 home win over Huddersfield Town in the [[2016–17 FA Cup|FA Cup]] [[2016–17 FA Cup#Fifth Round Proper|fifth round]] replay match.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/39035253 |title=Manchester City 5–1 Huddersfield Town |date=1 March 2017 |work=BBC Sport|access-date=7 September 2018 |language=en-GB}}</ref> Four days later, on 5 March, he scored in a 2–0 away win over Sunderland.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/live/football/38604372 |title=Aguero and Sane see off Sunderland |date=27 February 2017 |work=BBC Sport|access-date=7 September 2018 |language=en-GB}}</ref> On 15 March, he scored in the [[2016–17 UEFA Champions League knockout phase#Monaco v Manchester City|return fixture]] of the [[2016–17 UEFA Champions League|UEFA Champions League]] match against [[AS Monaco FC|Monaco]], but City lost 1–3, knocking them out from the tournament on the [[away goals rule]].<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/39248906 |title=Monaco 3–1 Manchester City |date=15 March 2017 |work=BBC Sport|access-date=7 September 2018 |language=en-GB}}</ref> On 2 April, he scored the opening goal in an eventual 2–2 draw with Arsenal.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/39396482 |title=Arsenal 2–2 Manchester City |date=2 April 2017 |work=BBC Sport|access-date=7 September 2018 |language=en-GB}}</ref> On 15 April, he scored in a 3–0 win over [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]].<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/39536675 |title=Southampton 0–3 Manchester City |date=15 April 2017 |work=BBC Sport|access-date=7 September 2018 |language=en-GB}}</ref>
In July 2017, Sané revealed he believed his debut season at City had been limited by his inability to breathe through his nose.<ref name=":0" /> He said he particularly suffered during matches, with his constantly blocked nose hampering his performance and causing him intense frustration.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/leroy-sane-manchester-city-nose-10875407 |title=Leroy Sane gets a nose job as he looks to get Man City career back on track |last=Association |first=Press |date=26 July 2017 |work=mirror|access-date=5 February 2018}}</ref> He opted to have corrective surgery during the off-season break. Although this caused him to miss that year's [[2017 FIFA Confederations Cup|FIFA Confederations Cup]], he said his chronic nasal congestion was becoming increasingly unbearable for him and that he wished to enter the next season feeling happy and healthy.<ref name=":0">{{Cite news |url=https://talksport.com/football/nose-surgery-rules-manchester-city-and-germany-winger-leroy-sane-out-2017-confederations |title=Nose surgery rules Manchester City and Germany winger Leroy Sane out of 2017 Confederations Cup |last=talkSPORT |date=23 May 2017 |work=talkSPORT|access-date=5 February 2018 |language=en}}</ref>
====2017–18 season==== [[File:Leroy Sané in December 2017 (cropped).jpg|thumb|upright|Sané playing during the [[Manchester derby]] in December 2017.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/42212593 |title=Manchester United 1–2 Manchester City |date=10 December 2017 |work=BBC Sport|access-date=7 September 2018 |language=en-GB}}</ref>]] On 9 September 2017, Sané scored his first two goals of the [[2017–18 Manchester City F.C. season|2017–18 season]] in City's 5–0 home win against [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2017/sep/09/manchester-city-liverpool-premier-league-match-report |title=Manchester City and Gabriel Jesus hammer 10-man Liverpool 5–0 |date=9 September 2017 |work=The Guardian}}</ref> On 20 September, he scored twice in a 2–1 away win over [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]] in the [[2017–18 EFL Cup#Third round|third round match]] of the [[2017–18 EFL Cup|League Cup]].<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/41249726 |title=West Bromwich Albion 1–2 Manchester City |date=20 September 2017 |work=BBC Sport|access-date=7 September 2018 |language=en-GB}}</ref> On 23 September, he scored in a 5–0 win over [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]].<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/41290318 |title=Manchester City 5–0 Crystal Palace |date=23 September 2017 |work=BBC Sport|access-date=7 September 2018 |language=en-GB}}</ref> On 14 October, he scored in a 7–2 win over [[Stoke City F.C.|Stoke City]].<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/41534300 |title=Manchester City 7–2 Stoke City |date=14 October 2017 |work=BBC Sport|access-date=7 September 2018 |language=en-GB}}</ref> On 21 October, he scored in a 3–0 win over [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]].<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/41618798 |title=Manchester City 3–0 Burnley |date=21 October 2017 |work=BBC Sport|access-date=7 September 2018 |language=en-GB}}</ref> On 28 October, he scored in a 3–2 away win over [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]].<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/41703865 |title=West Bromwich Albion 2–3 Manchester City |date=28 October 2017 |work=BBC Sport|access-date=7 September 2018 |language=en-GB}}</ref> After scoring and assisting once in each of his three matches, he earned the [[Premier League Player of the Month]] award for October 2017.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/512728 |title=Sane wins EA SPORTS Player of the Month award|access-date=19 December 2017 |language=en}}</ref> On 6 January 2018, he scored in a 4–1 win in the [[2017–18 FA Cup|FA Cup]] [[2017–18 FA Cup#Third Round Proper|third round]] over Burnley.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/42519596 |title=Manchester City 4–1 Burnley |date=2018 |work=BBC Sport|access-date=7 September 2018 |language=en-GB}}</ref> On 14 January, he scored in a 4–3 defeat to Liverpool.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/42594403 |title=Liverpool 4–3 Manchester City |date=2018 |work=BBC Sport|access-date=7 September 2018 |language=en-GB}}</ref> Nine days later, on 23 January, he scored in a 3–2 away win over Bristol City, securing advancement into the [[2018 EFL Cup Final|League Cup final]], in which he played 77 minutes before being substituted off as City won 3–0 over [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] to clinch their first trophy under [[Pep Guardiola]].<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/42698924 |title=Bristol City 2–3 Manchester City (Agg: 3–5) |date=2018 |work=BBC Sport|access-date=7 September 2018 |language=en-GB}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/43101681 |title=Arsenal 0–3 Manchester City |date=25 February 2018 |work=BBC Sport|access-date=7 September 2018 |language=en-GB}}</ref> On 1 March, five days following the win in the final, he scored against Arsenal in a 3–0 league away win.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/43150331 |title=Arsenal 0–3 Manchester City |date=2 March 2018 |work=BBC Sport|access-date=7 September 2018 |language=en-GB}}</ref> On 31 March, he scored in a 3–1 away win over Everton, putting City just a win away from winning the league title.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/43524315 |title=Everton 1–3 Manchester City |date=31 March 2018 |work=BBC Sport|access-date=7 September 2018 |language=en-GB}}</ref> On 29 April, he scored in a 4–1 away win over West Ham United.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/43854105 |title=West Ham United 1–4 Manchester City |date=29 April 2018 |work=BBC Sport|access-date=7 September 2018 |language=en-GB}}</ref>
Sané was voted the [[PFA Young Player of the Year]] for his part in Manchester City's [[2017–18 Premier League]] title win, edging teammates [[Raheem Sterling]] and [[Ederson Moraes|Ederson]], as well as [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]]'s [[Harry Kane]].<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.express.co.uk/sport/football/949689/PFA-Young-Player-of-the-Year-shortlist-awards-sportgalleries |title=PFA Young Player of the Year: Full shortlist ahead of tonight's awards |last=Potts |first=Michael |date=22 April 2018 |work=Express.co.uk|access-date=26 April 2018 |language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |url=http://www.espn.com/soccer/manchester-city/story/3466866/manchester-citys-leroy-sane-named-pfa-young-player-of-the-year |title=Sane named PFA Young Player of the Year |work=ESPN.com|access-date=26 April 2018}}</ref><ref name="PFA">{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/43860354 |title=PFA Player of the Year 2017–18: Liverpool's Mohamed Salah wins top award |date=23 April 2018 |accessdate=23 April 2018 |publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref> With [[2017–18 Premier League#Top assists|15 assists]], Sané just missed out on winning the inaugural [[Premier League Playmaker of the Season]] award to fellow teammate [[Kevin De Bruyne]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/690283|title=De Bruyne edges Playmaker award|website=www.premierleague.com|language=en|date=14 May 2018}}</ref>
====2018–19 season==== On 15 September 2018, Sané scored the opening goal and his first of the [[2018–19 Manchester City F.C. season|2018–19 season]] in City's 3–0 home win against [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45456654|title=Manchester City 3–0 Fulham|publisher=BBC Sport|date=15 September 2018|accessdate=29 November 2018}}</ref> He later scored the final goal in consecutive home match wins over Burnley and Southampton.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45847417|title=Manchester City 5–0 Burnley|publisher=BBC Sport|date=20 October 2018|accessdate=29 November 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/46007194|title=Manchester City 6–1 Southampton|publisher=BBC Sport|date=4 November 2018|accessdate=29 November 2018}}</ref> On 24 November, Sané assisted a first-half goal for Sterling and scored a brace in a 4–0 away win over West Ham United.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45456654|title=West Ham 0–4 Manchester City|publisher=BBC Sport|date=15 September 2018|accessdate=29 November 2018}}</ref>
On 3 January 2019, he scored the winning goal for [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] in the 72nd minute of the game against [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]], which resulted in Liverpool's unbeaten run in the [[English Premier league|English Premier League]] coming to an end.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/man-city-liverpool-result-match-report-sergio-aguero-goal-a8710436.html|title=Leroy Sane’s pinpoint finish ends Liverpool’s unbeaten run to reignite title race|date=2019-01-03|website=The Independent|language=en|access-date=2019-01-05}}</ref>
==International career== Sané was first called up to the [[Germany national under-21 football team|Germany under-21 team]] by youth coach [[Horst Hrubesch]] on 28 August 2015 for the friendly against Denmark and for the [[2017 UEFA European Under-21 Championship]] qualifier against [[Azerbaijan national under-21 football team|Azerbaijan]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.kicker.de/news/fussball/u21/startseite/633965/artikel_brandt-26-co-_hrubesch-holt-17-neue.html#omsearchresult |title=Brandt & Co.: Hrubesch holt 17 Neue |author= |work=kicker online |publisher=Olympia Verlag GmbH |date=28 August 2015 |accessdate=22 November 2015 |language=de}}</ref> On 3 September 2015, he made his debut for the German U21 side in a 2–1 win at [[Stadion an der Lohmühle]] in [[Lübeck]] against [[Denmark national under-21 football team|Denmark]], where he was replaced after 73 minutes by [[Julian Brandt]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.kicker.de/news/fussball/intligen/intwettbewerbe/u-21-nationalteams-freundschaftsspiele/2015/1/2839788/spielanalyse_deutschland-3096_daenemark-u-21.html#omsearchresult |title=Sieg trotz Rückstand: DFB-Elf zeigt Moral |author= |work=kicker online |publisher=Olympia Verlag GmbH |date=3 September 2015 |accessdate=22 November 2015 |language=de}}</ref> [[File:20161011 U21 AUT GER 9584.jpg|left|thumb|upright|Sané playing for the Germany youth side in October 2016.]] Sané received his first senior call-up to the [[Germany national football team|German senior team]] on 6 November 2015 in a friendly against [[France national football team|France]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.dw.com/en/gomez-returns-trapp-and-sané-selected/a-18833110 |title=Gomez returns, Trapp and Sané selected |work=Deutsche Welle |date=6 November 2015 |accessdate=12 November 2015}}</ref> On 13 November 2015, he was substituted in the 61st-minute for [[Julian Draxler]] in a friendly match against France in [[Stade de France|Saint-Denis]], in what would be a 2–0 defeat for the Germans, overshadowed by [[November 2015 Paris attacks|shootings and explosions around the stadium]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.kicker.de/news/fussball/nationalelf/startseite/fussball-nationalteams-freundschaftsspiele/2015/6/2856069/spielbericht_frankreich_deutschland.html |title=Frankreichs Sieg verkommt zur Fußnote |author= |work=kicker online |publisher=Olympia Verlag GmbH |date=13 November 2015 |accessdate=22 November 2015 |language=de}}</ref>
Sané was selected by Germany boss [[Joachim Löw]] to represent the country at [[UEFA Euro 2016]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuro-finals/season=2016/teams/team=47/squad/index.html |title=UEFA EURO 2016 – Germany – Squad |work=UEFA.com |accessdate=6 December 2016}}</ref> He participated in one match, replacing [[Bastian Schweinsteiger]] on 79 minutes in Germany's 2–0 semi-final defeat to [[France national football team|France]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36669829 |title=Germany 0–2 France |work=BBC Sport |date=7 July 2016 |accessdate=6 December 2016}}</ref>
Sané was eligible to play for France because he holds [[French nationality law|French citizenship]].<ref name=":1">{{Cite news |url=https://www.bailiwickexpress.com/jsy/life/sport-xtra/5-things-you-need-know-about-manchester-city-target-leroy-sane/ |title=5 things you need to know about Manchester City target Leroy Sane |last=Express |first=Bailiwick |work=Bailiwick Express|access-date=26 March 2018 |language=en}}</ref>
Sané was omitted from Germany's final 23-man squad for the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]] on 4 June 2018.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.dw.com/en/germany-announce-final-world-cup-squad-with-manuel-neuer-without-leroy-san%C3%A9/a-44064011 |title=Germany announce final World Cup squad, with Manuel Neuer, without Leroy Sané |publisher=Deutsche Welle |accessdate=4 June 2018}}</ref> In September 2018, after he was selected for the squad to face games against France and Peru, he left the team hotel after a discussion with [[Joachim Löw]], citing "personal reasons" as his cause for leaving.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/45452552 |title=Leroy Sane: Man City winger leaves Germany team hotel after talks with Joachim Low |date=7 September 2018 |work=BBC Sport|access-date=7 September 2018 |language=en-GB}}</ref> It was later revealed that the reason for leaving was due to the birth of his daughter.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/45452552 |title=Leroy Sane: Man City winger announces birth of daughter after leaving Germany team hotel |date=8 September 2018 |work=BBC Sport|access-date=8 September 2018 |language=en-GB}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |url=https://twitter.com/LeroySane19/status/1038393386821210112 |title=Leroy Sané on Twitter |work=Twitter|access-date=8 September 2018 |language=en}}</ref>
On 16 November 2018 he scored his first goal for [[Germany national football team|Germany]] against [[Russia national football team|Russia]] following an assist from [[Serge Gnabry]]. The goal came in the 8 th minute of the game as Germans won the game by 3-0.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.goal.com/en-ar/news/18722/main/2018/11/16/49389132/germany-3-russia-0-sane-on-target-as-lows-men-stroll |title=International friendly: Germany 3 Russia 0 {{!}} Goal.com|website=www.goal.com|language=en|access-date=2018-11-18}}</ref>
==Personal life== Sané is the son of former German [[Rhythmic gymnastics|rhythmic gymnast]], the [[1984 Summer Olympics]] bronze medalist [[Regina Weber]] and former footballer and [[Senegal national football team|Senegalese international]] [[Souleyman Sané|Souleymane Sané]].<ref name="Sane commits to Schalke" /><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11887/9231944/transfer-news-schalke-reward-academy-star-leroy-sane-with-two-year-deal |title=Schalke reward academy star Leroy Sane with two-year deal |author=Zocher, Thomas |publisher=Sky Sports |date=25 March 2014 |accessdate=26 April 2014}}</ref> Souleymane Sané was raised in France; he moved to Germany through his service in the [[French Army]]. Leroy Sané was born in [[Essen]], [[North Rhine-Westphalia]], and raised near the [[Lohrheidestadion]], [[Wattenscheid]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.westline.de/fussball/schalke04/Leroy-Sane-Nicht-einfach-zwischen-den-Welten-zu-switchen%3Bart2009,2278266 |title=Leroy Sane: Nicht einfach zwischen den Welten zu switchen |author=Philipp Rentsch |work=westline |publisher=westline GbR: Aschendorff Medien GmbH & Co. KG und WestOnline GmbH & Co. KG in Gesellschaft bürgerlichen Rechts |date=26 May 2015 |accessdate=26 August 2015 |language=de}}</ref> He was named Leroy in honor of [[Claude Le Roy]], a former head coach of his father.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.lequipe.fr/Football/Actualites/Allemagne-leroy-sane-schalke-04-aurait-il-pu-jouer-pour-l-equipe-de-france/606705 |title=Allemagne : Leroy Sané (Schalke 04) aurait-il pu jouer pour l'équipe de France ? |author=Hugues Sionis |publisher=L'Équipe |date=12 November 2015 |accessdate=12 November 2015 |language=fr}}</ref> He has [[Multiple citizenship|dual]] [[German nationality law|German]] and [[French nationality law|French]] citizenship.<ref name=":1" /><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.eurosport.de/fussball/testspiel/2015/leroy-sane-eine-chance-fur-den-senkrechtstarter_sto4986250/story.shtml |title=Senkrechtstarter Leroy Sané: Eine Chance in der deutschen Nationalmannschaft |author=Fabian Kunze |publisher=Eurosport |date=11 November 2015 |accessdate=14 November 2015 |language=de}}</ref>
