Benfica|Benfica]] | caps2 = 1 | goals2 = 0 | years3 = 2014–2015<!-- DO NOT REMOVE LOAN PERIOD --> | clubs3 = → [[AS Monaco FC|Monaco]] (loan) | caps3 = 15 | goals3 = 2 | years4 = 2015–2017 | clubs4 = [[AS Monaco FC|Monaco]] | caps4 = 86 | goals4 = 22 | years5 = 2017– | clubs5 = [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] | caps5 = 61 | goals5 = 11 | nationalyears1 = 2013 | nationalteam1 = [[Portugal national under-19 football team|Portugal U19]] | nationalcaps1 = 13 | nationalgoals1 = 2 | nationalyears2 = 2013–2015 | nationalteam2 = [[Portugal national under-21 football team|Portugal U21]] | nationalcaps2 = 14 | nationalgoals2 = 6 | nationalyears3 = 2015– | nationalteam3 = [[Portugal national football team|Portugal]] | nationalcaps3 = 33 | nationalgoals3 = 3 | club-update = 02:37, 11 February 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 11 October 2018 }} '''Bernardo Mota Veiga de Carvalho e Silva''' ({{IPA-pt|bɨɾˈnaɾdu ˈsiɫvɐ}}; born 10 August 1994) is a Portuguese professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[midfielder]] for {{English football updater|ManchesC}} club [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] and the [[Portugal national football team|Portugal national team]].
Born in [[Lisbon]], Silva came through [[S.L. Benfica|Benfica]]'s youth academy. In 2013, he began playing for the club's [[S.L. Benfica B|reserve side]] and was promoted to the first team the following season. He was on loan at the [[Ligue 1]] side [[AS Monaco|Monaco]] during the 2014–15 season, with ''Les Monégasques'' making the move permanent in the winter of 2015. After winning the [[List of Ligue 1 champions|national championship]] with them in 2017, Silva was sold to the English club [[Manchester City]] for a reported fee of £43.5 million. He subsequently won the Premier League and [[EFL Cup]] in [[2017–18 Manchester City F.C. season|his first season]] in England.
Silva made his senior debut for Portugal in 2015 after previously being [[Cap (sport)|capped]] by Portugal youth teams at [[Portugal national under-21 football team|under-21]] and [[Portugal national under-19 football team|under-19]] levels. He was chosen in Portugal's squads for the [[2017 FIFA Confederations Cup|2017 Confederations Cup]] and [[2018 FIFA World Cup|2018 World Cup]].
==Club career== ===Benfica=== A product of [[S.L. Benfica|Benfica]]'s youth system, Silva played for its ranks, and in 2013 they won the 2012–13 Portuguese Juniors Championship.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://expresso.sapo.pt/comentario-benfica-garante-titulo-nacional-de-juniores-com-bis-de-joao-cancelo=f808015 |title=Benfica garante título nacional de juniores com "bis" de João Cancelo|trans-title=Benfica gains portuguese juniors title with a brace from João Cancelo|work=Expresso|date=18 May 2013|accessdate=24 May 2013}}</ref> He made his debut for [[S.L. Benfica B|Benfica B]] in a [[Segunda Liga]] match against [[C.D. Trofense|Trofense]] on 10 August 2013 (Matchday 1).<ref>{{cite web|title=Trofense 0 – 0 Benfica B|url=http://www.lpfp.pt/segunda_liga/pages/jogo.aspx?epoca=20132014&jornada=1&jogo=8342|work=LPFP|date=10 August 2013}}</ref>
On 19 October 2013, Silva made his debut for [[S.L. Benfica|Benfica]] at the age of 19, in a [[2013–14 Taça de Portugal]] third round 1–0 away victory against [[Campeonato de Portugal (league)|Campeonato Nacional de Seniores]] club C.D. Cinfães, coming out of the bench in the 80th minute.<ref>{{cite web|title=Porto e Benfica cumprem na terceira eliminatória|url=http://pt.uefa.com/memberassociations/association=por/news/newsid=2012030.html|work=pt.uefa.com|accessdate=25 January 2014|language=Portuguese|date=19 October 2013}}</ref> His good performance for Benfica B in the [[2013–14 Segunda Liga]] earned him the league's Breakthrough Player of the Year award.<ref name="breakthrough award">{{cite news|title=Bernardo Silva considerado o Jogador Revelação da II Liga|url=http://www.slbenfica.pt/noticias/detalhedenoticia/tabid/2788/ArticleId/37198/language/pt-PT/.aspx|work=SL Benfica website|date=6 July 2014|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140819083100/http://www.slbenfica.pt/noticias/detalhedenoticia/tabid/2788/ArticleId/37198/language/pt-PT/.aspx|archivedate=19 August 2014}}</ref> He was a member of Benfica's domestic [[Treble (association football)|treble]]-winning team of the [[2013–14 S.L. Benfica season|2013–14 season]].
===Monaco=== On 7 August 2014, Silva joined [[AS Monaco FC|Monaco]] on one-year loan deal.<ref>{{cite news|title=Futebol: Ivan Cavaleiro e Bernardo Silva emprestados|url=http://www.slbenfica.pt/noticias/detalhedenoticia/tabid/2788/ArticleId/37653/language/pt-PT/.aspx|work=SL Benfica|date=7 August 2014|deadurl=yes|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140810003640/http://www.slbenfica.pt/noticias/detalhedenoticia/tabid/2788/ArticleId/37653/language/pt-PT/.aspx|archive-date=10 August 2014}}</ref> He made his Monaco debut on 17 August in a Ligue 1 away match against [[Girondins de Bordeaux]], replacing [[Lucas Ocampos]] in the second half.<ref>{{cite news|title=Bordeaux – Monaco|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/28784326|accessdate=17 August 2014|work=BBC Sport|date=17 August 2014}}</ref> On 21 September, he made his first start for Monaco, in a 1–0 Ligue 1 home win against [[En Avant de Guingamp|Guingamp]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Monaco sort de la zone rouge|url=http://news.fr.msn.com/sport/monaco-sort-de-la-zone-rouge-3|accessdate=24 September 2014|work=news.fr.msn.com|date=21 September 2014|language=French}}</ref> On 14 December, he scored the only goal of the 1–0 home win against [[Olympique de Marseille]] in a [[Ligue 1]] match.<ref name=sw>{{Soccerway}}</ref> [[File:CSKA-Monaco (4).jpg|thumb|Bernardo Silva playing for Monaco in the [[2016–17 UEFA Champions League|2016–17 Champions League]]]] On 20 January 2015, Benfica announced that Silva's economic and sports rights had been sold to Monaco for €15.75 million;<ref>{{cite web|url=http://web3.cmvm.pt/sdi2004/emitentes/docs/FR53634.pdf|title=Comunicado|language=Portuguese|trans-title=Announcement|date=20 January 2015|work=[[S.L. Benfica]]|publisher=[[Portuguese Securities Market Commission|CMVM]]|format=PDF|accessdate=21 January 2015}}</ref> he signed a contract for Monaco that would expire on 30 June 2019.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.asm-fc.com/en/article/bernardo-silva-commits-to-the-club-until-2019-67008.html|title=Bernardo Silva commits to the club until 2019|date=21 January 2015|website=[[AS Monaco FC]]|accessdate=23 January 2015|dead-url=yes|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150127002350/http://www.asm-fc.com/en/article/bernardo-silva-commits-to-the-club-until-2019-67008.html|archive-date=27 January 2015}}</ref>
On 10 April 2015, he scored twice in a 3–0 away win against [[Stade Malherbe Caen|Caen]] in a Ligue 1 match.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2015/04/10/france/ligue-1/stade-malherbe-caen-calvados-basse-norma/association-sportive-monaco-fc/1687321/|title=Caen vs. Monaco|date=10 April 2015|website=Soccerway|access-date=17 May 2015}}</ref>
On 10 August 2015, Silva extended his contract by one year, tying him to the club until June 2020.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.asmonaco.com/fr/article/bernardo-silva-prolonge-d-un-an-68591.html|title=Bernardo Silva prolonge d'un an|publisher=AS Monaco official website|date=10 August 2015|access-date=28 May 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180111164930/http://www.asmonaco.com/fr/article/bernardo-silva-prolonge-d-un-an-68591.html|archive-date=11 January 2018|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
In the [[2016–17 UEFA Champions League group stage|2016–17 Champions League group stage]] away match against [[PFC CSKA Moscow|CSKA Moscow]] on 18 October 2016, Silva scored Monaco's equalizer in the 87th minute to ensure that the match finished in 1–1 draw.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.goal.com/en-gb/match/cska-moskva-vs-monaco/2348365?ICID=FX|title=CSKA Moscow vs Monaco, 2016–2017 UEFA Champions League group stage|publisher=www.goal.com|date=18 October 2016}}</ref> On 15 January 2017, he scored Monaco's last two goals in a 4–1 away victory against [[Olympique de Marseille|Marseille]] to help Monaco move to the top of the Ligue 1 table for the first time since Week 5 of the current Ligue 1 season.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.ligue1.com/ligue1/article/monaco-blast-way-to-top-spot.htm|title=Monaco blast way to top spot|publisher=www.ligue1.com|date=15 January 2017}}</ref> On 29 January, Silva scored the 92nd-minute equalizer to cancel out [[Edinson Cavani]]'s 81st-minute goal in the 1–1 Ligue 1 draw against the reigning Ligue 1 champions [[Paris Saint-Germain F.C.|Paris Saint-Germain]] at the [[Parc des Princes]] to help Monaco return to the Ligue 1 summit.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.ligue1.com/ligue1/article/monaco-return-to-ligue-1-summit-with-psg-draw.htm|title=Monaco return to Ligue 1 summit with PSG draw|publisher=www.ligue1.com|date=29 January 2017}}</ref>
Silva finished the 2016–17 season with 8 goals and 9 [[assist (football)|assists]] in Ligue 1 and 11 goals and 12 assists in 58 matches across all competitions.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://bleacherreport.com/articles/2707934-bernardo-silva-joins-manchester-city-on-5-year-contract-from-monaco|title=Bernardo Silva Joins Manchester City on 5-Year Contract from Monaco|publisher=Bleacher Report|date=27 May 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2017/may/28/bernardo-silva-monaco-manchester-city|title=Bernardo Silva: the ‘bubble gum player’ bringing his magic to Manchester City|publisher=The Guardian|date=28 May 2017}}</ref>
===Manchester City=== On 26 May 2017, [[Manchester City F.C|Manchester City]] confirmed the signing of Silva on a five-year contract after passing his medical tests. Although the transfer fee remains undisclosed, it has been reported to amount to €50 million (£43.5 million).<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.lequipe.fr/Football/Actualites/Bernardo-silva-transfere-de-monaco-a-manchester-city/804732|title=Bernardo Silva transféré de Monaco à Manchester City|date=26 May 2017|language=fr|work=[[L'Équipe]]|accessdate=28 May 2017}}</ref>
Silva officially joined the club on 1 July 2017, ahead of the [[2017–18 Manchester City F.C. season|2017–18 season]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.mancity.com/news/first-team/2017/05/26/man-city-to-sign-bernardo-silva-monaco-transfer/1495797186416|title=Bernardo Silva agrees to join Manchester City|date=26 May 2017|author=Rob Pollard|publisher=[[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City Football Club]]|accessdate=26 May 2017}}</ref>
On 13 February 2018, he scored his first [[UEFA Champions League|Champions League]] goal for the City in a 4–0 away victory against [[FC Basel|Basel]] in the first leg of the round of 16 stage.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/43038304|title=FC Basel 0-4 Manchester City|date=13 February 2018|work=BBC Sport|access-date=14 February 2018|language=en-GB}}</ref>
On 5 March 2018, he scored the solitary winning goal against Chelsea at home – a key win which put them only three wins away from winning the Premier League title.<ref>{{Cite web|title=Manchester City 1 - 0 Chelsea|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/43186392|work=BBC Sport|date=5 March 2018}}</ref> Silva has established himself as a consistent performer, playing the most matches of any City player in the season up to the end of February 2018.<ref>{{Cite web|title=Bernardo Silva has played more times for Manchester City in 2017-18 than any other star, including Kevin De Bruyne|url=https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/football/5611411/manchester-city-most-games-played-shock/|work=The Sun|date=19 February 2018}}</ref> By the end of the season, Silva had played for Manchester City 53 times in all competitions – the most of any City player that season and helped them to a record 100 points in the Premier League and the EFL Cup.
==International career== In 2013, Silva represented Portugal at the [[2013 UEFA European Under-19 Championship|2013 European Under-19 Championship]],<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.record.xl.pt/Futebol/selecoes/interior.aspx?content_id=833181|title=Sub-19: Rui Silva substitui José Costa|trans-title=Sub-19: Rui Silva replaces José Costa|publisher=Record|language=Portuguese|date=14 July 2013|accessdate=14 July 2013|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150924150341/http://www.record.xl.pt/Futebol/selecoes/interior.aspx?content_id=833181|archivedate=24 September 2015}}</ref> reaching the semi-finals. For his performances, Silva was named among the top 10 talents under the age of 19 in Europe by a selection of [[UEFA]] reporters.<ref>{{cite news| url=http://www.uefa.com/under19/news/newsid=1978673.html| title=Ten Under-19 talents to watch|publisher=uefa.com|date=2 August 2013|accessdate=5 August 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Bernardo Silva entre os maiores talentos europeus|url=http://www.record.xl.pt/Futebol/Nacional/1a_liga/Benfica/interior.aspx?content_id=836687|newspaper=Record|date=2 August 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Bernardo Silva, o Messizinho do Seixal que sofre pelo clube|url=https://maisfutebol.iol.pt/reportagem-benfica-bernardo-silva-jorge-jesus-seixal-formacao-benfica-juniores-benfica-equipa-b-benfica-topnews/527bdb08e4b0034d0f843bec.html|website=Maisfutebol|date=18 November 2013}}</ref>
On 31 March 2015, he made his senior debut for Portugal, starting in a 0–2 friendly defeat to [[Cape Verde national football team|Cape Verde]] in [[Estoril]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Portugal 0–2 Cape Verde Islands|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/32140214|accessdate=31 March 2015|work=BBC Sport|date=31 March 2015}}</ref>
On 27 June 2015, he scored [[Portugal national under-21 football team|Portugal U21]]s' first goal in a 5–0 win against [[Germany national under-21 football team|Germany U21]] in the semi-finals of the [[2015 UEFA European Under-21 Championship|European Under-21 Championship]] in Czech Republic.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/under21/season=2015/matches/round=2000409/match=2015382/postmatch/report/index.html|title=Five-goal Portugal stun Germany in semi-finals|last=Hart|first=Simon|date=27 June 2015|publisher=[[UEFA]]|access-date=27 June 2015}}</ref> He was left out of the [[Portugal national football team|Portugal]] squad for the finals of [[Euro 2016]] due to injury.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/football/2653149/bernardo-silva-manchester-city-transfer-monaco/|title=Who is Bernardo Silva? Manchester City and United transfer target and Monaco ace – here's what we know|date=26 May 2017|publisher=The Sun}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=https://uk.reuters.com/article/uk-soccer-euro-por-squad/silva-out-sanches-in-as-portugal-name-euro-squad-idUKKCN0Y82SF|title=Silva out, Sanches in as Portugal name Euro squad|publisher=Reuters|date=18 May 2016|accessdate=24 January 2018}}</ref>
Silva was selected for the [[Portugal national football team|Portugal]] squad for the [[2017 FIFA Confederations Cup|2017 Confederations Cup]] which was hosted in [[Russia]]. He scored the second goal of the match in the group stage of the tournament, a 4-0 win over [[New Zealand national football team|New Zealand]].<ref> {{cite news |url=https://www.fifa.com/confederationscup/matches/round=274633/match=300334887/index.html |title=New Zealand vs Portugal |work=FIFA |accessdate=26 February 2019}}</ref> The national team reached the semi-finals before losing out to [[Chile national football team|Chile]] in a [[Penalty shoot-out (association football)|penalty shootout]] after a 0–0 draw at the end of regulation time. Silva missed the [[2017 FIFA Confederations Cup knockout stage#Third place play-off|third place play-off]] in which Portugal defeated [[Mexico national football team|Mexico]] 2–1 after extra time.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.fifa.com/confederationscup/matches/round=274643/match=300334886/match-report.html|title=Portugal come from behind to finish third|website=FIFA|date=2 July 2017|accessdate=2 July 2017|quote=Portugal finished their FIFA Confederations Cup Russia 2017 campaign on a high by beating Mexico 2-1 after extra time in the play-off for third place at the Spartak Stadium in Moscow in front of 42,659 fans. }}</ref>
Silva was named in Portugal's 23-man squad for the [[2018 FIFA World Cup|2018 World Cup]] in Russia.<ref>{{cite news |last=Crawford |first=Stephen |url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/revealed-every-world-cup-2018-squad-23-man-preliminary-lists/oa0atsduflsv1nsf6oqk576rb |title=Revealed: Every World Cup 2018 squad – Final 23-man lists |work=GOAL |accessdate=18 September 2018}}</ref> He featured in all 4 matches with Portugal, but was knocked out of the tournament after a 1-2 loss to Uruguay.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.fifa.com/worldcup/players/player/395205/ |title=Bernardo Silva |work=FIFA |accessdate=24 February 2019}}</ref>
Silva was selected for three matches in the [[2018-19 UEFA Nations League]] group stage, scoring a goal in a 3-2 victory against [[Poland national football team|Poland]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.uefa.com/uefanationsleague/season=2019/teams/player=250059115/statistics/ |title=Bernardo Silva ||work=UEFA |accessdate=26 February 2019}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.uefa.com/uefanationsleague/season=2019/matches/round=2000959/match=2024021/index.html?iv=true&iv=true |title=Poland vs Portugal |work=UEFA |accessdate=26 February 2019}}</ref>
==Personal life== Silva is a supporter of [[S.L. Benfica|Benfica]].<ref>{{cite news|date=20 March 2017|title=Para Bernardo Silva, Benfica tem vantagem no clássico|trans-title=To Bernardo Silva, Benfica have advantage in the classic|url=https://rr.sapo.pt/noticia/78874/para_bernardo_silva_benfica_tem_vantagem_no_classico|language=Portuguese|website=Renascença|access-date=28 August 2017}}</ref> His English has been described as "perfect" by the media,<ref>{{Cite web|title=Bernardo Silva: Five things about 'little Messi,' set to join Manchester City|quote=It's reasonable to suppose he will settle quickly in England, especially considering his more-than-passable English skills, despite never having lived there.|url=http://www.espn.co.uk/football/blog/soccer-transfers/3/post/3041796/bernardo-silva-five-things-about-little-messi-set-to-join-manchester-city|work=ESPN|date=26 May 2017}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|title=Calm and collected: Bernardo Silva ready to make his name in the Premier League with Manchester City|quote=He grew up in a comfortable middle-class home; his mother is an art teacher, his father a businessman. They sent him to private school – his English is immaculate with an American tinge – and wanted him to keep studying.|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/manchester-city-bernardo-silva-interview-ready-to-make-name-manchester-city-a7937211.html|work=The Independent|date=8 September 2017}}</ref> partly as a result of his parents sending him to an English-speaking school in Lisbon when he was six years old.<ref>{{Cite web|title=Bernardo Silva reveals his Man City goals|quote=He speaks softly, earnestly and in perfect English - a skill picked up from studying in a British college in Lisbon from a young age and improved further (more importantly) when it was established that it was the only common language he shared with his French girlfriend.|url=https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/man-city-news-bernardo-silva-13435458|work=Manchester Evening News|date=6 August 2017}}</ref> Silva is a [[cousin]] of [[Matilde Fidalgo]]. Both were born in 1994 and they also share the same [[Grandparent#Great-grandparents|great-grandparents]] and play internationally for the Portugal national team.<ref>{{cite web|title=Bernardo Silva e Matilde: primos à conversa na seleção|url=https://bancada.pt/futebol/portugal/bernardo-silva-e-matilde-primos-a-conversa-na-selecao|website=Bancada.pt|accessdate=16 April 2018}}</ref>

Silva''' ({{IPA-es|daˈβið ˈsilβa}}; born 8 January 1986) is a Spanish professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays for English club [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]]. Silva plays mainly as a [[Midfielder#Central midfielder|central]] or an [[attacking midfielder]] but can also play as a [[Left winger|winger]] or [[second striker]]. He is predominantly a [[left-footed]] player<ref name="How Pellegrini will seek to get the best out of City's wide men">{{cite web |url=http://www.fourfourtwo.com/features/how-pellegrini-will-seek-get-best-out-citys-wide-men |title=How Pellegrini will seek to get the best out of City's wide men |publisher=Four Four Two |author=Michael Cox |date=22 August 2013 |accessdate=24 December 2014}}</ref> and his passing ability and possession-retaining qualities have earned him the nicknames "[[Merlin]]" and "El Mago" from his teammates and fans,<ref name="David Silva, or is it Merlin?">{{cite web |url=http://www.mcfc.co.uk/news/team-news/2011/august/david-silva-magic-intro |title=David Silva, or is it Merlin? |publisher=Manchester City F.C. |first=Chris |last=Bailey |date=2 August 2011 |accessdate=4 June 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110808151347/http://www.mcfc.co.uk/News/Team-news/2011/August/David-Silva-magic-intro |archivedate=8 August 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.mcfc.co.uk/News/Team-news/2013/January/Silva-birthday |title=Happy Birthday Merlin! |publisher=Manchester City F.C. |date=8 January 2013 |accessdate=9 January 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130110013157/http://www.mcfc.co.uk/News/Team-news/2013/January/Silva-birthday |archivedate=10 January 2013}}</ref> and he is considered by many to be one of the best midfielders in Europe.<ref>{{cite web |first=James |last=Stroud |url=http://www.givemesport.com/1212153-jamie-redknapp-reveals-the-premier-league-duo-that-are-most-alike-xavi-and-iniesta |title=Jamie Redknapp reveals the Premier League duo that are most alike Xavi and Iniesta |date=10 December 2017 |work=GiveMeSport|access-date=14 December 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |first=Jack |last=Gaughan |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-5176877/David-Silva-Manchester-Citys-Andres-Iniesta.html |title=David Silva is Manchester City's Andres Iniesta... 'Merlin's' magical display against Swansea is Pep Guardiola in action |date=13 December 2017 |work=Daily Mail|access-date=14 December 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |first=Nick |last=Elliott |url=https://www.dreamteamfc.com/c/news-gossip/364525/why-david-silva-should-be-considered-one-of-the-premier-leagues-best-ever-midfielders/ |title=THE TAKE Why David Silva should be considered one of the Premier League’s best ever midfielders |date=11 December 2017 |work=Dream Team FC|access-date=14 December 2017}}</ref>
Silva spent six years of his professional career with [[Valencia CF]], appearing in more than 150 games and winning one [[Copa del Rey]] in [[2007–08 Copa del Rey|2008]], before moving in the summer of 2010 to Manchester City. Since joining City, Silva has appeared in over 300 matches and is in his eighth season at the club. He has won the [[FA Cup]], four [[EFL Cup|League Cup]]s and three [[Premier League]] titles. He is regarded as one of Manchester City's greatest ever players alongside [[Billy Meredith]], [[Bert Trautmann]], [[Colin Bell]] and [[Sergio Agüero]].<ref>{{Cite web |title=The 25 greatest players in the history of the Premier League |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/premier-league-at-25-greatest-players-ranked-jack-pitt-brooke-a7886646.html |work=The Independent |date=11 August 2017}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |title=David Silva is Manchester City's greatest ever player, says Jamie Carragher |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/29327/11155615/david-silva-is-manchester-citys-greatest-ever-player-says-jamie-carragher |work=Sky Sports |date=4 December 2017 |accessdate=29 August 2018}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |title=David Silva has found a new level under Pep Guardiola… but where does the magician rank in the top 10 list of Manchester City's all-time greats? |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-5494873/Where-does-David-Silva-rank-10-Man-Citys-time-greats.html |date=13 March 2018 |accessdate=29 August 2018}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |title=9 reasons why David Silva is Manchester City’s greatest EVER player |url=https://www.dreamteamfc.com/c/news-gossip/304601/david-silva-manchester-city-greatest-ever-player/ |work=dreamteamfc.com |date=11 December 2017 |accessdate=29 August 2018}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |title=Is David Silva Manchester City’s greatest ever player? |url=https://inews.co.uk/sport/football/football-opinion/david-silva-manchester-city-greatest/ |work=inews.co.uk |date=1 December 2017 |accessdate=29 August 2018}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |title=Zabaleta: Silva is the greatest City player ever |url=https://www.mancity.com/news/first-team/first-team-news/2017/april/man-city-players-on-david-silva |work=Manchester City |date=9 April 2017 |accessdate=29 August 2018}}</ref>
Silva also represented [[Spain national football team|Spain]], from his debut for the senior team in 2006 until his international retirement in 2018. He started his international career at the age of 20. He is one of 13 [[Spain national football team#Most capped players|Spanish players to have amassed 100 caps]], he scored 35 goals in his international career, making him the [[Spain national football team#Top goalscorers|4th highest goalscorer in Spain's history]], and also provided 28 assists, making him 2nd highest assist provider in Spain's history. He was an integral member of the squads that won three consecutive international tournaments – [[UEFA Euro 2008]], [[2010 FIFA World Cup]], and [[UEFA Euro 2012]].
==Early life== Silva was born in [[Arguineguín]], [[Gran Canaria]], [[Canary Islands]], to Fernando Jiménez, a former municipal police officer who eventually was responsible for the safety of the [[Valencia CF]] stadium and Eva Silva. His father, Fernando, is [[Spaniards|Spanish]] (Canarian) while his mother, Eva, is of Japanese descent, claimed by the Canarian media.<ref>{{cite news |title=David Silva, el nieto de 'la tirajanera' |url=http://www.laprovincia.es/secciones/noticia.jsp?pRef=2008063000_1_160807__Portada-Las-Palmas-David-Silva-nieto-tirajanera}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-1290896/Manchester-City-new-boy-David-Silva-Prada-wearing-machete-fighter-started-life-goal.html |title=Manchester City new boy David Silva: The Prada-wearing Japanese machete fighter who started life in goal... |newspaper=Daily Mail |first1=Max |last1=Lakey |first2=Josh |last2=Taylor |date=1 July 2010 |accessdate=4 November 2011 |location=London}}</ref>
Silva began playing football in the youth team of UD San Fernando, near [[Maspalomas]]. Originally, he played as a [[Goalkeeper (association football)|goalkeeper]], before becoming a [[Winger (association football)|winger]]<ref name="career">{{Cite news |title=David Silva: From a childhood in a Spanish fishing village to Premier League superstar... |last=Kay |first=Alex |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2051589/David-Silva-From-Spanish-fishing-village-Premier-League-superstar.html |newspaper=Daily Mail |date=20 October 2011 |accessdate=28 October 2011 |location=London}}</ref> and mirrored his game around his footballing idol as a youth, [[Michael Laudrup]].<ref name="career"/> When he was 14, he received an offer to become a youth player at [[Valencia CF]], which he accepted. He stayed in Valencia's youth set-up until he was 17.
==Club career== ===Valencia=== [[File:David Silva vs Newcastle.jpg|thumb|upright|200px|Silva playing for Valencia]] A product of [[Valencia CF|Valencia]]'s youth system, Silva made his professional debut in [[2004–05 Segunda División|2004–05]], with [[Segunda División]]'s [[SD Eibar|Eibar]], while on loan from Valencia, playing 35 league games and scoring on five occasions. In the [[2005–06 La Liga|following season]], he was again out on loan, this time to [[Celta de Vigo]], where he played 34 matches, scoring four goals. After two late [[Substitute (association football)|substitute]] appearances, the first in a 2–0 home win over [[Málaga CF|Málaga]] on 28 August 2005, Silva finished as an undisputed starter as the [[Galicia (Spain)|Galician]] side reached the [[UEFA Europa League|UEFA Cup]] straight from the second-tier.
Silva returned to Valencia in the summer of 2006, becoming an automatic first-choice despite his young age of 20. In two seasons combined, he only missed six matches and netted 14 goals, his first league goal coming on 5 November 2006 in a 1–1 draw at [[RCD Espanyol|Espanyol]]. In August 2008, he extended his contract by five years, amidst interest of several [[Premier League]] teams.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/teams/m/man_utd/7559788.stm |title=Silva opts to stay with Valencia |publisher=[[BBC Sport]] |accessdate=13 August 2008}}</ref> He won the [[2007–08 Copa del Rey|Copa del Rey 2008]], his first title in [[Spain]].
After not appearing in the first three months of [[2008–09 La Liga|2008–09]] due to a chronic [[ankle]] ailment,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/news/newsid=748802.html |title=Silva resigned to three-month absence |publisher=UEFA |date=12 September 2008}}</ref> Silva returned to the call-ups in mid-December. On 3 January 2009, he scored twice in a 3–1 home win over [[Atlético Madrid]],<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.uefa.com/memberassociations/news/newsid=790351.html |title=Barça stride on, Silva inspires Valencia |publisher=UEFA |date=3 January 2009}}</ref> still contributing with 19 matches (four goals) as the ''Che'' qualified for the [[2009–10 UEFA Europa League|Europa League]].
In the [[2009–10 La Liga|2009–10 season]], Silva scored a career-best eight goals, as Valencia finished in third position and [[2010–11 UEFA Champions League|returned]] to the [[UEFA Champions League]]. On 15 April 2010, he scored a brace against [[Athletic Bilbao]] for a 2–0 home win,<ref>[http://www.marca.com/marcador/futbol/2009_10/primera/jornada_32/val_ath/ La Champions es más fácil con Silva (Champions League is easier with Silva)]; [[Diario Marca]], 15 April 2010 {{es icon}}</ref> adding three assists in the 4–4 thriller at [[SV Werder Bremen|Werder Bremen]] for the Europa League's [[2009–10 UEFA Europa League|round of 16]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/matches/season=2010/round=2000039/match=2000954/postmatch/quotes/index.html |title=Villa revels in Valencia's 'crazy' night |publisher=UEFA |first=Trevor |last=Huggins |date=18 March 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100322194435/http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/matches/season%3D2010/round%3D2000039/match%3D2000954/postmatch/quotes/index.html |archivedate=22 March 2010}}</ref>
===Manchester City=== ====2010–11==== [[File:David Silva.jpg|thumb|upright|200px|Silva with Manchester City in April 2011]] On 30 June 2010, [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] announced that they had reached an agreement with Valencia over the transfer of Silva and that he would join the club on a four-year deal, prior to the start of the [[2010–11 Premier League|2010–11 season]].<ref>[http://www.skysports.com/story/0,19528,11661_6238493,00.html City clinch Silva deal] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150926004450/http://www.skysports.com/story/0%2C19528%2C11661_6238493%2C00.html |date=26 September 2015 }}; [[Sky Sports]], 30 June 2010</ref> On 14 July, the Premier League side completed the signing<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.espnfc.com/story/808743/new-manchester-city-boy-david-silva-targets-champions-league |title=New City boy Silva targets Champions League |publisher=ESPN FC |date=14 July 2010 |accessdate=4 November 2011}}</ref> and Silva was awarded the number 21 shirt, the same number he wore for Valencia and when playing for [[Spain national football team|Spain]]. Manchester City had previously tried to sign Silva and his Valencia teammate [[David Villa]] in 2008, but were put off when Valencia quoted a £135 million combined price tag on both players.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2010/aug/14/david-silva-manchester-city |title=David Silva the little man thinks big at Manchester City |work=[[The Guardian]] |first=Daniel |last=Taylor |date=14 August 2010 |accessdate=9 November 2010 |location=London}}</ref>
City manager [[Roberto Mancini]] mainly deployed Silva as a winger<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/sport/2011/aug/26/small-talk-pat-nevin |title=Pat Nevin: 'Why can't England produce a Messi or a Zidane?' |work=The Guardian |first=Jacob |last=Steinberg |date=26 August 2011 |accessdate=1 October 2011 |location=London}}</ref> and later in a [[trequartista]] role in his first season.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.sport.co.uk/football/mancini-tips-fantastic-silva-to-fulfil-trequartista-role/52438 |title=Mancini Tips "Fantastic" Silva To Fulfil Trequartista Role |publisher=Sport.co.uk |date=8 April 2011}}</ref> Silva made his [[Premier League]] debut on 14 August 2010 in a 0–0 draw against [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] at [[White Hart Lane]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.espnfc.com/report?id=293013&cc=5739&league=ENG.1 |title=Tottenham Hotspur 0–0 Manchester City |publisher=ESPN FC |date=14 August 2010 |accessdate=17 August 2010}}</ref> He scored his first goal for the club on 16 September, eight minutes into the [[2010–11 UEFA Europa League|Europa League group match]] against [[FC Red Bull Salzburg|Red Bull Salzburg]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/europe/8994528.stm |title=Red Bull Salzburg 0–2 Man City |publisher=BBC Sport |first=Saj |last=Chowdhury |date=16 September 2010}}</ref> On 17 October, he scored his first league goal in a game against [[Blackpool F.C.|Blackpool]], netting City's third goal in a 3–2 away win.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/9085637.stm |title=Blackpool 2–3 Man City |publisher=BBC Sport |date=17 October 2010 |accessdate=19 October 2010}}</ref> In a 3–1 home win in the [[2010–11 UEFA Europa League|Europa League]] against [[Lech Poznań]], he set up two goals for [[Emmanuel Adebayor]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://menmedia.co.uk/manchestereveningnews/sport/football/manchester_city/s/1346250_football_so_easy_for_silva_says_mancini |title=Football so easy for Silva, says Mancini |work=Manchester Evening News |date=22 October 2010}}</ref> He made another assist slipping through [[Adam Johnson (footballer)|Adam Johnson]] for Manchester City's third in a 3–1 away win against [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.mcfc.co.uk/News/Match-reports/2010/December/West-Ham-v-City |title=City at West Ham match report |publisher=Manchester City F.C. |first=Chris |last=Bailey |date=11 December 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101213112015/http://www.mcfc.co.uk/News/Match-reports/2010/December/West-Ham-v-City |archivedate=13 December 2010}}</ref> Erroneous media reports emerged suggesting Silva could return to Spain and cited homesickness and difficulty to adapt to the English game.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-1358378/Atletico-Madrid-target-Manchester-City-star-David-Silva--EXCLUSIVE.html |title=Manchester City face fight to keep hold of homesick Silva as Atletico Madrid prepare summer move |newspaper=Daily Mail |location=London |first=Alex |last=Kay |date=19 February 2011 |accessdate=4 November 2011}}</ref> His performances, however, impressed City [[Manchester City F.C. supporters|supporters]] and earned him three consecutive Manchester City Player of the Month awards from October to December 2010.<ref name="Hat-trick">{{cite web |url=http://www.mcfc.co.uk/News/Team-news/2011/January/Silva-streak-as-David-completes-hat-trick |title=Silva streak as David completes hat-trick |publisher=Manchester City F.C. |first=David |last=Clayton |date=7 January 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110110112716/http://www.mcfc.co.uk/News/Team-news/2011/January/Silva-streak-as-David-completes-hat-trick |archivedate=10 January 2011}}</ref>
On 12 February 2011, he was credited for the equalising goal in the 2–1 loss to rivals [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] when an [[Edin Džeko]] shot deflected off his back and into the net. On 2 March, he scored from 20 yards out in an [[FA Cup]] win (3–0) against [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]]. Three days later, he scored the only goal in Manchester City's win against [[Wigan Athletic F.C.|Wigan Athletic]]. Silva netted the third goal in City's 5–0 rout of [[Sunderland A.F.C.|Sunderland]] on 3 April. His assist to [[Yaya Touré]] against [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] at [[Goodison Park]] took Silva to 15 assists in all competitions for the season.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.dailystar.co.uk/football/view/189937/Everton-2-Man-City-1-No-gold-for-Silva/ |title=Everton 2 Man City 1: No Gold for Silva |work=Daily Star |first=Paul |last=Hetherington |date=8 May 2011}}</ref>
Following his debut season in the Premier League, Silva emerged as one of the league's finest playmakers. [[Carlos Tevez]] lauded him as "the best signing we [Manchester City] have made."<ref>{{cite web |url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/news/story/_/id/878034/carlos-tevez:-david-silva-is-manchester-city's-best-signing?cc=5739 |title=Carlos Tevez: David Silva is Manchester City's best signing |publisher=ESPN FC |date=9 February 2011 |accessdate=1 October 2011}}</ref>
====2011–12==== [[File:SilvaLFC.jpg|thumb|left|180px|Silva prior to a league match against Liverpool in 2011]] Silva began the [[2011–12 Premier League|2011–12 season]] in fine form, scoring the third goal in City's 4–0 thrashing of [[Swansea City A.F.C.|Swansea City]]<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2011/aug/15/manchester-city-swansea-premier-league |title=Manchester City 4–0 Swansea City – Premier League match report |work=The Guardian |location=London |first=Daniel |last=Taylor |date=15 August 2011}}</ref> and was voted [[man of the match]]. He also scored the following week against [[Bolton Wanderers F.C.|Bolton Wanderers]], and was again named man of the match.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/competitions/premier-league/8711595/Bolton-Wanderers-2-Manchester-City-3-match-report.html |title=Bolton Wanderers 2 Manchester City 3: match report |work=The Daily Telegraph |location=London |first=Henry |last=Winter |date=21 August 2011}}</ref> Silva then set up two of [[Sergio Agüero]]'s three goals in City's second home game against Wigan Athletic. After a series of magnificent displays from Silva, City boss Roberto Mancini compared him to fellow Spain internationals [[Xavi]] and [[Andrés Iniesta]] and said that Silva is "one of the best players in the world."<ref>{{cite news |url=http://menmedia.co.uk/manchestereveningnews/sport/football/manchester_city/s/1458480_david-silva-can-rival-barcelona-star-as-best-in-world |title=David Silva can rival Barcelona star as best in world |work=Manchester Evening News |first=Stuart |last=Brennan |date=12 September 2011 |accessdate=1 October 2011}}</ref> On 1 October, Silva was awarded the [[Premier League Player of the Month]] for his outstanding performances, making it the first time ever that two Manchester City players have won the award in back-to-back months with Edin Džeko winning it the month before.<ref name="POTM1">{{cite web |url=http://www.mcfc.co.uk/News/Team-news/2011/September/Silva-picks-up-prestigious-award |title=Silva picks up prestigious award |publisher=Manchester City F.C. |date=30 September 2011 |accessdate=26 September 2016 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111002120358/http://www.mcfc.co.uk/News/Team-news/2011/September/Silva-picks-up-prestigious-award |archivedate=2 October 2011}}</ref>
In the first [[Manchester Derby]] of the season at [[Old Trafford]], Manchester City won 6–1, with Silva proving, yet again, to be instrumental in the Manchester City attack, scoring the fifth goal, setting up Edin Džeko's second with a chested volley pass through the United defense, and participating in the first two goals with excellent passing to [[James Milner]] to assist [[Mario Balotelli]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.espn.co.uk/football/sport/story/117650.html |title=Triple Dutch |publisher=ESPN |first=Chris |last=Murphy |date=24 October 2011 |accessdate=4 November 2011}}</ref> On 25 October 2011, in an interview with a Spanish radio station, Silva revealed that he turned down [[FC Barcelona|Barcelona]] and [[Real Madrid C.F.|Real Madrid]] so he could sign for City, and that he wants to stay at the club for years. He commented, "Madrid and Barcelona are great teams, but I'm happy here and I would like to stay here for many years."<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.espnfc.com/story/974625/david-silva-confirms-barcelona-and-real-madrid-rejections |title=David Silva confirms Barcelona and Real Madrid rejections |publisher=ESPN FC |date=October 2011}}</ref> Former City and [[England national football team|England]] defender [[Earl Barrett]] said he is almost impossible to stop due to his ability to create space<ref>{{cite news |url=http://menmedia.co.uk/manchestereveningnews/sport/football/manchester_city/s/1462991_david-silva-is-just-pure-gold-says-former-manchester-city-defender-earl-barrett |title=David Silva is just pure gold |work=Manchester Evening News |date=26 October 2011}}</ref> and [[Andy Cole]], who mostly played for Manchester United, has stated that Silva "is a joy to watch."<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.thenational.ae/thenationalconversation/sport-comment/citys-david-silva-shaping-up-among-worlds-best-midfielders |title=City's David Silva shaping up among world's best midfielders |work=The National |date=3 November 2011 |accessdate=4 November 2011}}</ref>
Silva scored a goal in City's 3–2 away win against [[Queens Park Rangers F.C.|Queens Park Rangers]] on 5 November<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/15503963 |title=QPR 2–3 Man City |publisher=BBC Sport |first=Phil |last=Dawkes |date=5 November 2011}}</ref> and also scored in City's 1–0 home win against [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] on 18 December.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/eng_prem/16129455.stm |title=Man City 1–0 Arsenal |publisher=BBC Sport |first=Alistair |last=Magowan |date=18 December 2011}}</ref> He also contributed by scoring the fourth goal in City's 4–0 win against [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]] on 11 April 2012.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/17606956 |title=Man City 4–0 West Brom |publisher=BBC Sport |first=Phil |last=Dawkes |date=11 April 2012}}</ref> In addition to winning his first Premier League medal with Manchester City, he also finished the season on top of the assists table with 15 assists to his name<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.espnfc.com/english-premier-league/23/statistics/assists?season=2011 |title=English Premier League Statistics |publisher=ESPN FC |accessdate=14 May 2012}}</ref> and was one of four City players who made it in the PFA's [[PFA Team of the Year|Premier League Team of the Year]].<ref name=1112PFA>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/17797832 |title=Arsenal striker Robin van Persie named PFA Player of the Year |publisher=BBC Sport |date=22 April 2012 |accessdate=5 May 2018}}</ref>
====2012–13==== {{Quote box|quote="He is the maestro, he knows where the passes are going to go. He runs the game. A joy to watch."|source=[[Jamie Redknapp]]|width=29%|align=right}} On 17 September 2012, Silva signed a new five-year deal at City, committing himself to the Etihad Stadium until 2017.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/news/story/_/id/1162033/david-silva-agrees-new-city-deal?cc=5901 |title=Silva signs new Man City deal |publisher=ESPNFC |date=17 September 2012}}</ref> He injured himself playing for Spain, which meant he had to miss four games for Manchester City. On 11 November, he provided the crucial assist, a lofted through-ball, to striker [[Edin Džeko]], who converted in the 88th minute to steal a 2–1 victory over [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]]. His first league goal of the season came in a 5–0 thrashing of [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]] at home in the very next league match, on 17 November.
On 19 January 2013, Silva scored twice against [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]] at home in a 2–0 win. On 9 March, he scored the fifth and final goal in Manchester City's 5–0 win against [[Barnsley F.C.|Barnsley]] at the [[City of Manchester Stadium]] in the quarter-finals of the [[2012–13 FA Cup|FA Cup]], sealing progression to the semi-finals. He finished the season with four goals and ten assists in 32 league appearances for a City squad that finished runners-up to city rivals [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] for the Premier League title.
====2013–14==== On 19 August 2013, Silva scored Manchester City's opening goal of the [[2013–14 Premier League]] season in a 4–0 win against [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]] at the City of Manchester Stadium.<ref>{{cite news |last=Winter |first=Henry |title=Manchester City 4 Newcastle United 0: match report |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/competitions/premier-league/10241976/Manchester-City-4-Newcastle-United-0-match-report.html |accessdate=3 February 2014 |newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |location=London |date=19 August 2013}}</ref> On 10 December 2013, he scored his first [[2013–14 UEFA Champions League|Champions League]] goal of the season in a 3–2 win at champions [[FC Bayern Munich|Bayern Munich]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/live/match/301292/analysis |title=Silva lining |publisher=Sky Sports |date=10 December 2013 |accessdate=30 April 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140203153744/http://www1.skysports.com/football/live/match/301292/analysis |archivedate=3 February 2014}}</ref> He was named Manchester City's Player of the Month for March 2014, after scoring in away matches against [[Hull City A.F.C.|Hull City]] and [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]].<ref name="Mar14POTM">{{cite web |url=http://mcfc.co.uk/News/Team-news/2014/April/Silva-is-player-of-the-month |title=Silva voted Etihad Player of the Month |publisher=Manchester City F.C. |date=9 April 2014 |accessdate=30 April 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140411133659/http://mcfc.co.uk/News/Team-news/2014/April/Silva-is-player-of-the-month |archivedate=11 April 2014}}</ref>
====2014–15==== On 10 August, Silva played in the [[2014 FA Community Shield]], a match City lost 3–0 to [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/28647186 |title=Arsenal 3–0 Man City |publisher=BBC Sport |first=Mandeep |last=Sanghera |date=10 August 2014 |accessdate=7 March 2015}}</ref> Two days later, he signed a five-year contract extension with City.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.mcfc.co.uk/News/Team-news/2014/August/David-Silva-announcement |title=David Silva signs five-year deal at City |publisher=Manchester City F.C. |date=12 August 2014 |accessdate=12 August 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140812122542/http://www.mcfc.co.uk/News/Team-news/2014/August/David-Silva-announcement |archivedate=12 August 2014}}</ref> Like the previous season, on 17 August, Silva scored Manchester City's opening goal of the [[2014–15 Premier League]] season in a 2–0 away win against Newcastle United. Silva then scored against West Brom on Boxing Day.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/competitions/premier-league/11313830/West-Bromwich-Albion-1-Manchester-City-3-match-report-David-Silva-sparkles-as-champions-shrug-off-snow-storm.html |title=West Bromwich Albion 1 Manchester City 3, match report: David Silva sparkles as champions shrug off snow storm |work=The Daily Telegraph |first=Jonathan |last=Liew |date=26 December 2014 |accessdate=7 March 2015}}</ref>

====2017–18==== Silva started the [[2017–18 Manchester City F.C. season|2017–18 season]] with yet another display of finesse, providing eight Premier League assists in 14 appearances, which was the highest total for any player in Europe's top five leagues.<ref>{{cite web |first=Josh |last=Wright |url=https://www.whoscored.com/News/HEdbzjliAUaS6rPvHMnGmw/Show/Manchester-City-midfielder-signs-new-one-year-deal |publisher=WhoScored |date=30 November 2017 |accessdate=1 December 2017 |title=Manchester City midfielder signs new one-year deal}}</ref> On 30 November 2017, Silva signed a one-year contract extension with Manchester City keeping him at the club until 2020.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.mancity.com/news/first-team/first-team-news/2017/november/man-city-david-silva-contract-extension |title=David Silva signs new City deal |first=Rob |last=Pollard |date=30 November 2017 |accessdate=1 December 2017 |publisher=Manchester City}}</ref> He also scored in the [[2018 EFL Cup Final]] against [[Arsenal F.C.]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/43101681 |title=EFL Cup |publisher=BBC Sport |date=25 February 2018 |accessdate=1 March 2018}}</ref> For his contributions, Silva was nominated for the [[PFA Players' Player of the Year|PFA Player of the year]] as City won the [[2017–18 Premier League|Premier League]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/pfa-player-of-the-year-who-are-the-nominees-when-is-the/zd8xpgzrmob1juy7gk6mza14 |title=PFA Player of the Year |publisher=Goal.com |date=22 April 2018}}</ref> Silva finished the season with 10 goals and 13 assists across all competitions.<ref>{{cite web |title=David Silva: Football Statistics |url=https://www.whoscored.com/Players/14102/Show/David-Silva}}</ref>
====2018–19==== On 15 September 2018, in a 3–0 home win over Fulham, Silva scored his 50th Premier League goal in his 253rd appearance in the competition, also making his 350th appearance for Manchester City in the same match.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/45456654 |title=Manchester City 3-0 Fulham |publisher=BBC Sport |author1=Alex Bysouth |date=15 September 2018 |accessdate=22 September 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.fourfourtwo.com/sg/news/quickest-50-premier-league-goals-silva-reaches-milestone |title=The quickest to 50 Premier League goals as Silva reaches milestone |publisher=FourFourTwo |date=17 September 2018 |accessdate=22 September 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.skysports.com/football/news/11679/11499307/watch-david-silvas-manchester-city-highlights-as-midfielder-hits-50-premier-league-goals |title=WATCH: David Silva's Manchester City highlights as midfielder hits 50 Premier League goals |publisher=Sky Sports |date=15 September 2018 |accessdate=22 September 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.mancity.com/news/first-team/media-watch/2018/september/man-city-transfer-gossip-bernardo-silva-david-silva-sep-16 |title=Media watch: Praise for City's Silva streak! |publisher=www.mancity.com |date=16 September 2018 |accessdate=22 September 2018}}</ref>
==International career== [[File:David Silva and Leonardo Bonucci Euro 2012 final.jpg|thumb|right|200px|Silva (left) on the ball for Spain in the [[UEFA Euro 2012 Final]]]] Silva first represented Spain in the [[2003 FIFA U-17 World Championship]] in [[Finland]], scoring three goals. In 2006, he became an [[Spain national under-21 football team|under-21 international]] and scored four goals during the [[2005 FIFA World Youth Championship]]; this was enough to earn him joint-fourth place in the goal ranking, alongside Italian [[Forward (association football)|striker]] [[Graziano Pellè]].
Silva made his [[Spain national football team|senior international]] debut in the 1–0 friendly home defeat to [[Romania national football team|Romania]] on 15 November 2006, and continued to receive call-ups to the side after good contributions in his first games. On 22 August 2007, he scored his first two goals for Spain, netting twice in a 3–2 friendly win versus [[Greece national football team|Greece]], and was then called up to the squad of 23 for [[UEFA Euro 2008]].
In the semi-finals game versus [[Russia national football team|Russia]], Silva scored the third goal for Spain after a quick counter-attack in which [[Cesc Fàbregas]] delivered a low cross, and he sent the ball into [[Igor Akinfeev]]'s goal with his left foot.<ref>[http://www.euro2008.uefa.com/tournament/matches/match=301698/index.html Clinical Spain set up Germany final date] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080911200335/http://www.euro2008.uefa.com/tournament/matches/match%3D301698/index.html |date=11 September 2008 }}</ref> In [[UEFA Euro 2008 Final|the final]], he was involved in an incident with [[Germany national football team|Germany]]'s [[Lukas Podolski]]. After he pulled Podolski to the ground, the German approached Silva, which resulted in an angry exchange of words and a coming together of heads that the referee decided not to punish. Shortly afterward, Spanish coach [[Luis Aragonés]] substituted Silva for [[Santi Cazorla]] in an attempt to calm the tensions.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/euro_2008/7363545.stm |title=Germany 0–1 Spain |publisher=BBC Sport |first=Phil |last=McNulty |date=29 June 2008 |accessdate=1 October 2011}}</ref>
After appearing regularly during [[2010 FIFA World Cup]] [[2010 FIFA World Cup qualification (UEFA)|qualification]] – Spain won all ten fixtures – Silva was also picked for the squad for the finals in [[South Africa]]. His participation was, however, a small one, as the national team won the tournament: he started in the first match, a 0–1 group stage defeat against [[Switzerland national football team|Switzerland]], then played the last four minutes of the 1–0 win against Germany in the semi-finals.
On 11 August 2010, during an international friendly with [[Mexico national football team|Mexico]], Silva scored two minutes into second-half injury time, ending the game with a 1–1 draw.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/report?id=290887&league=FIFA.FRIENDLY&cc=5739 |title=Silva salvages draw for Spain |publisher=ESPNsoccernet |date=11 August 2010 |accessdate=17 August 2010}}</ref> In a [[UEFA Euro 2012 qualifying|Euro 2012 qualifier]] against [[Liechtenstein national football team|Liechtenstein]] on 3 September 2010, Silva scored after 62 minutes, in a 4–0 away win.<ref>[http://soccernet.espn.go.com/report?id=299308&cc=4716 Torres grabs brace for Spain] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100907044308/http://soccernet.espn.go.com/report?id=299308&cc=4716 |date=7 September 2010 }}; ESPNsoccernet, 3 September 2010</ref> The following month, in the same competition, he scored through a rare header, as the national team downed [[Lithuania national football team|Lithuania]] in [[Salamanca]] (3–1).
In a friendly against [[Colombia national football team|Colombia]] on 9 February 2011, he came off the bench to score the game's only goal with just four minutes remaining, helping Spain to a hard-fought 1–0 win.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.goal.com/en-gb/match/57279/spain-vs-colombia/report |title=Spain 1–0 Colombia: Substitute David Silva grabs late winner to save lacklustre world champions |work=Goal.com |date=9 February 2011}}</ref> He scored twice and provided one assist in Spain's 3–1 victory against [[Scotland national football team|Scotland]] in their final match of the [[UEFA Euro 2012 qualifying|Euro 2012 qualifiers]]. The win saw the Spaniards enter the tournament with a perfect qualifying record by winning all their group games.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2047545/Spain-3-Scotland-1-Silva-double-ensures-Leveins-men-miss-Euro-play-offs.html |title=Spain 3 Scotland 1: Levein's dream dies in six minutes as Silva stars in Spanish win |date=11 October 2011 |location=London |work=Daily Mail |first=Peter |last=Jardine}}</ref> He scored the first goal in Spain's 2–2 comeback against [[Costa Rica national football team|Costa Rica]], a friendly match where he came on as a substitute in the second half with Spain trailing 2–0.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.goal.com/en-gb/match/70171/costa-rica-vs-spain/report |title=Costa Rica 2–2 Spain: Silva & Villa save world champions after Arsenal's Joel Campbell looked to have secured victory |publisher=Goal.com |date=15 November 2011}}</ref> He once again scored in a friendly against [[Venezuela national football team|Venezuela]] to make the score 2–0 in a match that ended in a 5–0 win. Heading into Euro 2012, he scored in their pre-tournament friendly against [[China football team|China]] by finishing off a short give and go from [[Andrés Iniesta]] in the 84th minute.
Silva was a starter in all six matches of Spain's Euro 2012 campaign. In the 14th minute of the [[UEFA Euro 2012 Final|Euro 2012 Final]], he headed home a Cesc Fàbregas cross, giving Spain a 1–0 lead.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://espnfc.com/en/report/346764/report.html?=dsf |title=Spain claim historic win |date=1 July 2012 |publisher=ESPN FC |accessdate=29 November 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130115231727/http://espnfc.com/en/report/346764/report.html?=dsf |archivedate=15 January 2013}}</ref> The match ended 4–0 and concluded the tournament in which Silva scored two goals and made three assists, the best efficiency (goals and assists) of any player at the Euros.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://espnfc.com/en/records/index/league/uefa-euro/season/2012/statsnrecords.html |title=Stats & Records |publisher=ESPN FC |date=2 July 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120615173808/http://www.espnfc.com/en/records/index/league/uefa-euro/season/2012/statsnrecords.html |archivedate=15 June 2012}}</ref> He was subsequently named in UEFA's Euro 2012 Team of the Tournament for his performances.<ref>{{cite web |title=UEFA EURO 2012 Team of the Tournament |url=http://www.uefa.org/mediaservices/mediareleases/newsid=1838241.html?rss=1838241+UEFA+EURO+2012+Team+of+the+Tournament |publisher=UEFA |accessdate=3 February 2014 |date=2 July 2012}}</ref>
[[File:David Silva 2018.jpg|thumb|upright|Silva represented [[Spain national football team|Spain]] at the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]] in Russia.]]
Silva was named in Vicente del Bosque's 23-man squad list for Spain's contestation of the [[2013 FIFA Confederations Cup]], held in Brazil. On 20 June 2013, he scored two goals in Spain's 10–0 [[2013 FIFA Confederations Cup Group B|group stage]] demolition of [[Tahiti national football team|Tahiti]] at the [[Maracanã Stadium|Maracanã]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://espnfc.com/us/en/report/365339/report.html?soccernet=true&cc=5901 |title=Torres' 4 goals inspire Spanish rout |date=20 June 2013 |accessdate=22 June 2013 |publisher=ESPN FC}}</ref>
After being part of Spain's consecutive unsuccessful campaigns at [[2014 FIFA World Cup]] and [[UEFA Euro 2016]], Silva continued his goal scoring record under new boss Julen Lopetegui, scoring 9 times in 12 matches.{{citation needed|date= June 2017}} In May 2018 Silva was named to Spain's squad for the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]] in Russia.<ref>(Simpson, Christopher) [https://bleacherreport.com/articles/2777080-david-de-gea-isco-headline-spains-full-2018-world-cup-provisional-squad-roster David De Gea, Isco Headline Spain's Full 2018 World Cup Provisional Squad Roster] ''Bleacher Report''. Retrieved 22 May 2018.</ref>
After the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]] Silva announced his retirement from international football.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/45176114 |title=David Silva: Manchester City's Spain midfielder retires from international football |accessdate=21 November 2018 |date=13 August 2018 |publisher=bbc.com}}</ref>

|author1=Simon Curtis |date=30 October 2013 |accessdate=25 January 2016}}</ref> Silva is known for having an excellent first touch, good [[dribbling]] skills, and outstanding technical ability, which, along with his intelligent attacking movements, allow him to retain possession in tight spaces, and to create space for himself and teammates to open up a defence.<ref name="Play without a striker">{{cite web |url=http://www.espnfc.us/barclays-premier-league/23/blog/post/2204679/no-striker-no-problem-for-city |title=A novel idea to solve Manchester City's striker crisis: Play without a striker |publisher=ESPN FC |author1=Simon Curtis |date=18 December 2014 |accessdate=25 January 2016}}</ref><ref name="David Silva as good as Eden Hazard and Arjen Robben">{{cite web |url=http://www.espnfc.us/manchester-city/story/2343814/david-silva-as-good-as-eden-hazard-and-arjen-robben-says-frank-lampard |title=David Silva as good as Eden Hazard and Arjen Robben, says Frank Lampard |publisher=ESPN FC |author1=Richard Jolly |date=12 March 2015 |accessdate=25 January 2016}}</ref> Essentially a traditional number 10,<ref name="David Silva the shining light as Manchester escape United shadow |work=The Guardian |author1=Paul Hayward |date=24 October 2011 |accessdate=25 January 2016}}</ref> his composure on the ball, as well as his vision, passing accuracy, ability to read the game, pick a pass, and control the tempo of his team's play have seen him become one of the best players in the world in his position, and earned him the nickname ''[[Merlin]]''.<ref name="How Pellegrini will seek to get the best out of City's wide men"/><ref name="David Silva as good as Eden Hazard and Arjen Robben"/><ref name="David Silva the shining light as Manchester City escape United shadow"/><ref name="Man City want Silva and Aguero back as soon as possible">{{cite web |publisher=ESPN FC |date=13 November 2015 |accessdate=25 January 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/14883765 |title=David Silva among world's best, says Roberto ==Personal life== During December 2017, Silva had been missing games to return to Spain for personal reasons. On 3 January 2018, he said that his new son, Mateo, had been born extremely prematurely and was fighting to stay alive.<ref>{{cite news |title=David Silva says prematurely born son is 'fighting day by day' |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2018/jan/03/david-silva-premature-son-manchester-city |accessdate=3 January 2018 |work=The Guardian |date=3 January 2018}}</ref> On 11 May 2018, Mateo was reported as healthy and was allowed to come home.{{citation needed|date=October 2018}}
