Benfica|Benfica]] | years1 = 2011–2012 | clubs1 = [[G.D. Ribeirão|Ribeirão]] | caps1 = 29 | goals1 = 0 | years2 = 2012–2015 | clubs2 = [[Rio Ave F.C.|Rio Ave]] | caps2 = 37 | goals2 = 0 | years3 = 2015 | clubs3 = [[S.L. Benfica B|Benfica B]] | caps3 = 4 | goals3 = 0 | years4 = 2015–2017 | clubs4 = [[S.L. Benfica|Benfica]] | caps4 = 37 | goals4 = 0 | years5 = 2017– | clubs5 = [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] | caps5 = 62 | goals5 = 0 | nationalyears1 = 2014 | nationalteam1 = [[Brazil national under-23 football team|Brazil U23]] | nationalcaps1 = 5 | nationalgoals1 = 0 | nationalyears2 = 2017– | nationalteam2 = [[Brazil national football team|Brazil]] | nationalcaps2 = 3 | nationalgoals2 = 0 | club-update = 10:59, 7 February 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 20 November 2018 }} '''Ederson Santana de Moraes''' (born 17 August 1993), known simply as '''Ederson''' ({{IPA-pt|ˈɛdɛɾsõ|br}}), is a Brazilian professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[goalkeeper (association football)|goalkeeper]] for {{English football updater|ManchesC}} club [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] and the [[Brazil national football team|Brazil national team]]. He is considered the world's most expensive goalkeeper from a transfer value perspective by the [[International Centre for Sports Studies|CIES]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.football-observatory.com/IMG/sites/b5wp/2018/239/en/ |title=Updated transfer valuations: Mbappé takes the lead |publisher=International Centre for Sports Studies (CIES) |first1=Raffaele |last1=Poli |first2=Roger |last2=Besson |first3=Loïc |last3=Ravenel |date=5 November 2018 |accessdate=5 November 2018}}</ref>
He started his career at [[São Paulo FC|São Paulo]] in 2008 before joining Portuguese side [[S.L. Benfica|Benfica]] one year later, where he would spend two seasons. In 2012, he transferred from [[G.D. Ribeirão|Ribeirão]] to [[Primeira Liga]] side [[Rio Ave F.C.|Rio Ave]] and became a regular starter there. He rejoined Benfica in 2015 and was assigned to the [[S.L. Benfica B|reserves]] before debuting for the first team, with whom he would win four major titles in two seasons.
For the 2017–18 season, Ederson joined English club Manchester City for £35 million and became the most expensive goalkeeper of all-time in terms of the nominal value of [[pound sterling]] at the time of his transfer.<ref>{{cite news|date=8 June 2017|title=Ederson Moraes:Manchester City sign goalkeeper from Benfica for £35 million|trans-title=Most expensive goalkeeper in history in sterling|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40080163|website=BBC Sport|access-date=8 June 2017}}</ref> He went on to win the Premier League and [[EFL Cup]] in [[2017–18 Manchester City F.C. season|his first season]] in England.
Ederson made his senior debut for Brazil in 2017 after previously being [[Cap (sport)|capped]] at [[Brazil national under-23 football team|under-23]] level. He was chosen in Brazil's squad for the [[2018 FIFA World Cup|2018 World Cup]].
==Club career== ===Early career / Rio Ave=== Born in [[Osasco]], [[São Paulo (state)|São Paulo]], Ederson started his [[association football|football]] career in 2008 at local club [[São Paulo FC]] with whom he played one season, before joining [[S.L. Benfica|Benfica]] in Portugal. Here, at the age of 16, he spent two years as a [[S.L. Benfica Juniors|junior]], eventually leaving for [[Portuguese Second Division|Second Division]] side [[G.D. Ribeirão|Ribeirão]] in 2011. A year later, he joined [[Primeira Liga]] side [[Rio Ave F.C.|Rio Ave]]. In summer 2012, he officially signed a contract with Rio Ave. In May 2015, following a string of good performances and a call to the [[Brazil national under-23 football team|Brazil under-23 squad]], he signed a new contract with the club that would last until 2019.{{Citation needed|date=December 2016}}
===Benfica=== [[File:Zenit-Benf (7).jpg|alt=|thumb|318x318px|left|Ederson playing for [[S.L. Benfica|Benfica]] against [[FC Zenit Saint Petersburg|Zenit]] in 2016]] On 27 June 2015, Ederson joined Portuguese champions Benfica.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.dn.pt/desporto/benfica/interior/conheca-os-novos-reforcos-do-benfica-4648648.html|title=Conheça os 10 novos reforços do Benfica|language=Portuguese|trans-title=Meet the 10 new Benfica players|last=Ruela|first=João|date=27 June 2015|publisher=[[Diário de Notícias]]|access-date=28 June 2015}}</ref> Then, in July, he officially signed a five-year contract with the club, in a deal worth €500,000, and set a €45 million release clause. Rio Ave would keep 50% of the upcoming keeper's economic rights. In the [[2015–16 S.L. Benfica season|2015–16 season]], Ederson started as a second choice in line for the first team, defended by compatriot and international [[Júlio César (football goalkeeper, born 1979)|Júlio César]]. Ederson first played some matches in the [[Segunda Liga]] with the [[S.L. Benfica B|reserve team]] and in the [[Taça da Liga]] with the main squad, before playing in the Primeira Liga on 5 March 2016 against [[Derby de Lisboa|local rivals]] [[Sporting CP]], replacing injured Júlio César. Benfica won the Lisbon derby 0–1 and took the first place of Primeira Liga. He would then be part of eleven more victories that would seal Benfica's 35th league title, their third in a row.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.thefinalball.com/player_results.php?id=136885&epoca_id=145&ps=0|title=Ederson Moraes|website=thefinalball.com|access-date=22 December 2016}}</ref> Five days later, he played the [[2016 Taça da Liga Final|Taça da Liga final]] against [[C.S. Marítimo|Marítimo]], which Benfica won 6–2. In addition, he played three matches in the [[2015–16 UEFA Champions League|Champions League campaign]], where Benfica reached the quarter-finals. In his [[2016–17 S.L. Benfica season|next season]], he and Benfica won the treble of [[2016–17 Primeira Liga|Primeira Liga]], [[2016–17 Taça de Portugal|Taça de Portugal]] and [[2016 Supertaça Cândido de Oliveira|Supertaça Cândido de Oliveira]].
===Manchester City=== [[File:Ederson Moraes (36243872090) (cropped).jpg|thumb|right|Ederson with Manchester City in 2017]] On 1 June 2017, Benfica announced that Ederson had joined [[Premier League]] club [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] for £35 million (€40 million).<ref>{{cite news|date=1 June 2017|title=Ederson transferido para o Manchester City|trans-title=Ederson transferred to Manchester City|url=http://www.slbenfica.pt/30/news/info/t8JYPAn5zkKsW8hlgu_4Dg|language=Portuguese|website=S.L. Benfica|access-date=1 June 2017}}</ref> At the time, the transfer made him the [[Goalkeeper (association football)#Highest fees|second most expensive goalkeeper of all-time]] – currently fourth highest –<ref>{{cite news|date=8 June 2017|title=Ederson Moraes:Manchester City sign goalkeeper from Benfica for £35 million|trans-title=Most expensive goalkeeper in history in sterling, not euro|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40080163|website=BBC Sport|access-date=8 June 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|date=1 June 2017|title=Segundo guardião mais caro da história|trans-title=Second most expensive goalkeeper in history|url=http://www.slbenfica.pt/30/news/info/2Kdv5qwR8EychtYuojW0Jw|language=Portuguese|website=S.L. Benfica|access-date=1 June 2017}}</ref> after [[Gianluigi Buffon]] (£33 million), whose transfer fee, although the second highest ever in pounds sterling, still remained the highest of all time in euros (€52 million in 2001) until [[Alisson (footballer, born 1992)|Alisson]]'s (€75 million in 2018) and now [[Kepa Arrizabalaga|Kepa]]'s (€80 million in 2018).<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/44890499|title=Alisson: Liverpool make Brazilian world's most expensive keeper|date=19 July 2018|publisher=bbc.com}}</ref> Ederson's transfer equalled [[Axel Witsel]]'s as the largest fee a club has ever paid for a Benfica player.<ref>{{cite news|date=1 June 2017|title=Fotos: Ederson iguala Witsel como a transferência mais cara do Benfica|trans-title=Photos: Ederson equals Witsel as Benfica's highest transfer|url=https://desporto.sapo.pt/futebol/primeira_liga/artigo/2017/06/01/ederson-iguala-witsel-na-transferencia-mais-cara-do-benfica|language=Portuguese|website=[[SAPO (company)|Sapo Desporto]]|access-date=1 June 2017}}</ref>
Ederson was immediately inserted as [[Pep Guardiola]]'s first choice goalkeeper, supplanting [[Claudio Bravo]]. He made his competitive debut for the club on 12 August 2017 in a 0–2 away win at [[Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.|Brighton]], where he kept a clean sheet.<ref>{{cite news|date=12 August 2017|title=Brighton & Hove Albion 0–2 Manchester City|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40835422|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=22 August 2017}}</ref> On 9 September against [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]], Ederson suffered a kick to the face by [[Sadio Mané]], and was forced to leave the game after eight minutes of treatment.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.espnfc.com/manchester-city/story/3199384/manchester-city-keeper-ederson-avoids-broken-bone-but-may-miss-one-game |title=Man City keeper Ederson avoids broken bone, may miss one game |work=ESPN FC |first=Jonathan |last=Smith |date=9 September 2017}}</ref> Ederson received eight stitches, and Mané was sent off by referee [[Jonathan Moss (referee)|Jon Moss]] and banned for the subsequent three matches.{{citation needed|date=December 2018}} Ederson made his next start the following week in the [[2017–18 UEFA Champions League#Group stage|Champions League]] against [[Feyenoord]], sporting a piece of protective headgear.{{citation needed|date=December 2018}}
On 19 August 2018, Ederson became the first Manchester City goalkeeper in [[Premier League]] history to have recorded an assist, as his goal-kick was converted by [[Sergio Agüero]] for the opening goal in an eventual 6–1 win over [[Huddersfield Town A.F.C.|Huddersfield Town]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.standard.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-city-6-huddersfield-1-sergio-aguero-scores-hattrick-as-terriers-are-hit-for-six-a3915101.html|title=Aguero scores hat-trick as Man City hit Huddersfield for six|work=Evening Standard|access-date=20 August 2018|language=en-GB}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.squawka.com/en/news/ederson-makes-man-city-history-with-assist-against-huddersfield/1054269#IWl6mfS2YFRpicyy.97|title=Ederson makes Man City history with assist against Huddersfield|work=Squawka Football News|access-date=20 August 2018|language=en}}</ref>
==International career== [[File:Ederson.png|left|thumb|208x208px|Ederson training with [[Brazil national football team|Brazil]] in 2018]] Ederson was named in [[Brazil national football team|Brazil]]'s provisional squad for [[Copa América Centenario]]<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.goal.com/brasilglobaltour/en/news/5457/brasil-global-tour/2016/04/29/22949232/dunga-names-40-man-preliminary-copa-america-squad|title=Dunga names 40-man preliminary Copa America squad |work=[[Goal (website)|Goal]] |date=29 April 2016 |accessdate=30 June 2016}}</ref> but was cut from the final squad due to injury.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.maisfutebol.iol.pt/benfica/internacional/brasil-ederson-falha-a-copa-america-por-lesao|title=Brasil: Ederson falha a Copa América por lesão|work=Maisfutebol|language=pt|date=31 May 2016|accessdate=31 October 2018}}</ref> His debut for the national team came in a 3–0 win over [[Chile national football team|Chile]] in a [[2018 FIFA World Cup qualification (CONMEBOL)|2018 World Cup qualifier]] in October 2017.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.espn.com/soccer/report?gameId=431551|title=Gabriel Jesus, Paulinho help Brazil end Chile's World Cup hopes|publisher=ESPN|date=11 October 2017|accessdate=31 October 2018}}</ref> In May 2018, he was named in [[Tite (football manager)|Tite]]'s final [[Brazil national football team|23-man squad]] for the [[2018 FIFA World Cup|World Cup]] in Russia.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44116590|title=World Cup: Neymar named in Brazil's 23-man squad|work=BBC Sport|date=14 May 2018|accessdate=31 October 2018}}</ref>
==Style of play== An agile, large, courageous, energetic, commanding, and physically imposing keeper,<ref name="profiled">{{cite web|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11679/10897209/who-is-benficas-ederson-moraes-man-city-transfer-target-profiled|title=Who is Ederson Moraes? Manchester City's new goalkeeper profiled|publisher=Sky Sports|author1=Jack Wilkinson|date=8 June 2017|accessdate=17 January 2018}}</ref><ref name="perfect fit">{{cite news|url=http://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/man-city-keeper-ederson-news-13848752|title=Man City goalkeeper Ederson proving 'the perfect fit' for Pep Guardiola|work=Manchester Evening News|author1=Richard Fay|date=2 November 2017|accessdate=17 January 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/blog/2017/sep/10/manchester-city-liverpool-pep-guardiola-jurgen-klopp-ederson|title=Ederson’s bravery exposes Liverpool’s flaws on Jürgen Klopp’s day to forget|work=The Guardian|author1=Barney Ronay|date=10 September 2017|accessdate=17 January 2018}}</ref><ref name="A&E GK Brazil Strengths">{{cite web |url=http://www.espn.com/soccer/club/brazil/205/blog/post/3440627/alisson-ederson-make-goalkeeper-one-of-brazils-greatest-strengths|title=Alisson, Ederson make goalkeeper one of Brazil's greatest strengths |publisher=ESPN FC |author1=Tim Vickery |date=2 April 2018 |accessdate=21 January 2019 }}</ref> Ederson possesses physical strength, excellent reflexes<ref name="perfect fit"/><ref name="Who is Ederson?">{{cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2017/05/29/ederson-benfica-star-man-city-could-make-worlds-expensive-goalkeeper/|title=Who is Ederson? The Benfica star Man City could make the world's most expensive goalkeeper|work=The Daily Telegraph|author1=JJ Bull|date=29 May 2017|accessdate=17 January 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.calciomercato.com/news/1993-la-serie-la-caccia-al-portiere-25047|title=1993 - La Serie: la caccia al portiere|publisher=Calciomercato.com|language=Italian|author1=Emanuele Tramacere|date=16 May 2017|accessdate=16 January 2018}}</ref> and shot-stopping abilities between the posts,<ref name="profiled"/><ref name="Who is Ederson?"/> and developed a reputation as a penalty saving specialist during his time with Benfica.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://it.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/news/newsid=2480913.html#/|title=Rigori: chi li para e chi no|publisher=UEFA.com|language=Italian|date=21 June 2017|accessdate=16 January 2018}}</ref> However, he is mostly highly regarded for his outstanding distribution and skill with the ball at his feet: his control and confidence on the ball enables him to retain possession and quickly play the ball out from the back on the ground with his hands or either foot – even when put under pressure – or launch an attack with long kicks.<ref name="profiled"/><ref name="perfect fit"/><ref name="Who is Ederson?"/><ref>{{cite Cup|2015]]}} {{Medal|Silver|[[FIFA U-20 World Cup]]|[[2015 FIFA U-20 World Cup|2015]]}} }} '''Gabriel Fernando de Jesus''' (born 3 April 1997), commonly known as '''Gabriel Jesus''' ({{IPA-pt|ɡabɾiˈɛw ʒeˈzus}}), is a Brazilian professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Forward (association football)|forward]] for {{English football updater|ManchesC}} club [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] and the [[Brazil national football team|Brazil national team]].
Jesus began his career at [[Sociedade Esportiva Palmeiras|Palmeiras]]. He was voted the [[Prêmio Craque do Brasileirão|best newcomer]] of the [[2015 Campeonato Brasileiro Série A]], a year in which he also helped his team win the [[Copa do Brasil]]. The following year he was named the [[Bola de Ouro|player of the season]] as Palmeiras [[2016 Campeonato Brasileiro Série A|won their first national league title in 22 years]]. He joined Manchester City in January 2017 for a transfer fee of €32 million,<ref name="CityConfirm">{{Cite news |title=Man City confirm Gabriel Jesus move |url=https://www.mancity.com/news/first-team/2017/01/19/manchester-city-welcome-gabriel-jesus/1483615876492 |publisher=Manchester City FC|date=19 January 2017 |accessdate=19 January 2017}}</ref> and won the [[Premier League]] and [[EFL Cup]] in 2018.
After winning 21 caps and scoring seven goals at youth level, including reaching the final of the [[2015 FIFA U-20 World Cup]] and winning an [[Olympic medal|Olympic gold medal]] at the [[Football at the 2016 Summer Olympics – Men's tournament|2016 Summer Olympics]],<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.rio2016.com/en/news/brazil-s-two-gabriels-set-to-light-up-rio-2016-olympic-football-tournament |last=Marché |first=Patrick |title=Brazil's two Gabriels set to light up Rio 2016 Olympic football tournament |publisher=International Olympic Committee |date=13 July 2016 |accessdate=17 July 2016 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160805192530/https://www.rio2016.com/en/news/brazil-s-two-gabriels-set-to-light-up-rio-2016-olympic-football-tournament |archivedate= 5 August 2016 |df= }}</ref> Jesus made his senior debut for [[Brazil national football team|Brazil]] in September 2016.
==Early life== Born in [[São Paulo]], Jesus grew up in the neighborhood of Jardim Peri. After initially playing street football, he joined amateur clubs in the region, his last one being Associação Atlética Anhanguera.<ref name="PTD">{{cite web|url=http://www.verdao.net/noticia.php?n=12383|title=PTD fala com Gabriel Fernando, destaque do sub-17|trans-title=PTD speaks with Gabriel Fernando, under-17's spotlight|website=Verdao.net|publisher=Palmeiras Todo Dia|language=pt|accessdate=23 February 2016|date=4 August 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://globoesporte.globo.com/futebol/times/palmeiras/noticia/2015/01/joia-2015-famoso-na-base-gabriel-jesus-e-fenomeno-do-palmeiras.html|title=Famoso na base, Gabriel Jesus é "fenômeno" do Palmeiras|trans-title=Famous at the youth setup, Jesus is Palmeiras' "phenomenon"|publisher=[[Globo Esporte]]|language=pt|date=1 January 2015|accessdate=23 February 2016}}</ref>
==Club career==
===Palmeiras=== On 1 July 2013, Jesus signed a youth contract with [[Sociedade Esportiva Palmeiras|Palmeiras]].<ref name="PTD"/> He was also the club's top goalscorer during the year, scoring 54 goals in 48 matches.
In January 2014, after lengthy negotiations, Jesus signed a three-year contract for Palmeiras with an additional two, with his salary to increase from [[Brazilian real|R$]]15,000 to four times as much in the fifth year; the fee to buy him out from his contract increased tenfold to R$30 million.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.palmeiras.com.br/noticias/ler/34888-artilheiro-do-paulista-sub-17-atacante-gabriel-jesus-renova-com-o-palmeiras|title=Artilheiro do Paulista Sub-17, atacante Gabriel Jesus renova com o Palmeiras|trans-title=Paulista under-17's top scorer, forward Gabriel Jesus renews with Palmeiras|publisher=Palmeiras' official website|language=pt|accessdate=23 February 2016}}</ref> However, the deal changed the balance of his economic rights from 75–25% in favour of Palmeiras, to 70–30% in favour of his agents.<ref name=estadao>{{cite news|last1=Batista|first1=Gabriel|title=Gabriel Jesus luta para superar a timidez e lidar com fama no Palmeiras|trans-title=Gabriel Jesus fought to overcome shyness and lead Palmeiras to glory|url=http://esportes.estadao.com.br/noticias/futebol,desafio-de-gabriel-jesus-e-se-acostumar-com-os-holofotes-no-palmeiras,1751885|accessdate=23 February 2016|publisher=Estadão|date=28 August 2015|language=Portuguese}}</ref>
Jesus scored 37 goals in 22 games for Palmeiras in the 2014 edition of the state under-17 championship, leading to offers from clubs throughout the country and abroad.<ref name="PTD"/> He was first included in Palmeiras' squad for a senior match on 27 August 2014, remaining an unused [[Substitute (association football)|substitute]] as they lost 0–1 at home to [[Clube Atlético Mineiro]] in the [[2014 Copa do Brasil knockout stages|first leg of the last 16]] of [[2014 Copa do Brasil|the year]]'s [[Copa do Brasil]]. He did not make any senior appearances during the campaign, as his side was seriously threatened with relegation;<ref>{{cite web|url=http://esporteinterativo.com.br/futebol-brasileiro/joia-do-palmeiras-gabriel-jesus-acredita-ser-muito-cedo-para-jogar-no-elenco-profissional/|title=Joia do Palmeiras, Jesus acredita ser muito cedo para jogar no elenco profissional|trans-title=Palmeiras' pearl, Jesus thinks it is too soon to play in the main squad|publisher=[[Esporte Interativo]]|language=pt|accessdate=23 February 2016}}</ref> this decision, took by managers [[Ricardo Gareca]] and [[Dorival Júnior]], was widely criticized by the supporters, who demanded a change for the youngster through a [[petition]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://globoesporte.globo.com/futebol/times/palmeiras/noticia/2014/12/em-jogo-do-ano-torcedor-faz-abaixo-assinado-e-exige-escalacao-de-joia.html|title=Em jogo do ano, torcedor faz abaixo-assinado e "exige" escalação de Joia|trans-title=In game of the year, supporters create petition and "demand" pearl in the line-up|publisher=Globo Esporte|language=pt|accessdate=23 February 2016}}</ref>
[[File:Gabriel Jesus 2015.jpg|thumb|left|upright|Jesus warming up for [[Sociedade Esportiva Palmeiras|Palmeiras]] in 2015]]
Jesus made his senior debut on 7 March 2015 in the season's [[Campeonato Paulista]], replacing [[Leandro Pereira]] in the 73rd minute of a 1–0 win over [[CA Bragantino]] at [[Allianz Parque]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Gabriel Jesus estreia, e Palmeiras vence 6ª seguida|trans-title=Gabriel Jesus debuts, and Palmeiras win for the 6th consecutive time|url=http://esportes.terra.com.br/futebol/estaduais/campeonato-paulista/gabriel-jesus-estreia-e-palmeiras-vence-6-seguida,629a4135166fb410VgnVCM10000098cceb0aRCRD.html|accessdate=23 February 2016|publisher=Terra|date=7 March 2015|language=Portuguese}}</ref> He totalled eight appearances, all off the bench, as the ''Verdão'' lost on a [[penalty shoot-out (association football)|penalty shootout]] in [[2015 Campeonato Paulista|the final]] against [[Santos FC|Santos]].
Jesus made his first career start on 29 April in the [[2015 Copa do Brasil Second Round|second leg of the second round]] of [[2015 Copa do Brasil|the year's cup]], a 1–1 draw at [[Sampaio Corrêa Futebol Clube]] (6–2 aggregate). On 9 May, he made his first appearance in the [[Campeonato Brasileiro Série A]], starting in a 2–2 home draw against Atlético Mineiro on the first day of [[2015 Campeonato Brasileiro Série A|the season]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Ribeiro Júnior|first1=Ronaldo|title=Rafael Marques marca no último minuto e Verdão arranca empate contra o Galo|trans-title=Rafael Marques scores in the last minute and the ''Verdão'' start with a draw against the ''Galo''|url=http://www.goal.com/br/match/palmeiras-vs-atl%C3%A9tico-mg/2015177/report|accessdate=23 February 2016|publisher=Goal.com|date=9 May 2015|language=Portuguese}}</ref>
Jesus' first professional goal came in [[2015 Copa do Brasil Third Round|the next round of the cup]], away to [[Agremiação Sportiva Arapiraquense]] on 15 July, the only goal of the two-legged tie.<ref>{{cite news|title=Gabriel Jesus marca, Palmeiras vence o ASA e avança na Copa do Brasil|trans-title=Gabriel Jesus scores, Palmeiras defeat ASA and advance in the Copa do Brasil|url=http://globoesporte.globo.com/al/futebol/copa-do-brasil/jogo/15-07-2015/asa-arapiraca-palmeiras/|accessdate=23 February 2016|publisher=Globo|date=17 July 2015|language=Portuguese}}</ref> On 26 August, his two first-half strikes at the [[Estádio Governador Magalhães Pinto]] gave Palmeiras a 3–2 win over [[Cruzeiro Esporte Clube]] (5–3 aggregate), putting them into the quarter-finals.<ref>{{cite news|title=Jogo rápido e show de Gabriel Jesus: como o Palmeiras eliminou o Cruzeiro|trans-title=Fast play and Gabriel Jesus show: how Palmeiras eliminated Cruzeiro|url=http://globoesporte.globo.com/futebol/times/palmeiras/noticia/2015/08/jogo-rapido-e-show-de-gabriel-jesus-como-o-palmeiras-eliminou-o-cruzeiro.html|accessdate=23 February 2016|publisher=Globo|date=27 August 2015|language=Portuguese}}</ref> Four days later he got his first league goals, starting and finishing a 3–2 win over [[Joinville Esporte Clube]]; the first goal came after 52 seconds.<ref>{{cite news|title=Só Jesus salva! Garoto brilha de novo e põe Palmeiras no G-4|trans-title=Only Jesus saves! Lad shines again and puts Palmeiras into the G-4|url=http://esportes.terra.com.br/futebol/brasileiro-serie-a/campeonato-brasileiro-palmeiras-x-joinville,5b17ed17e986d2605aebeb83bce79b28x4qoRCRD.html|accessdate=23 February 2016|publisher=Terra|date=30 August 2015|language=Portuguese}}</ref>
Jesus finished the campaign with four goals from 20 games, and his team defeated Santos to win the cup; he was also a starter in both legs of [[2015 Copa do Brasil Finals|the finals]], but being substituted before half-time due to a [[shoulder]] injury. He was elected [[Prêmio Craque do Brasileirão|Best Newcomer]] in the league.<ref name="CBF">{{cite news|last1=de Sousa|first1=Luan|title=Gabriel Jesus é eleito revelação do Brasileiro em prêmio da CBF|trans-title=Gabriel Jesus is elected revelation of the Brasileiro at the CBF awards|url=http://www.palmeiras.com.br/noticias/ler/36891-gabriel-jesus-e-eleito-revelacao-do-brasileiro-em-premio-da-cbf#.VsvcTfmLTIU|accessdate=23 February 2016|publisher=Sociedade Esportiva Palmeiras|date=1 December 2015|language=Portuguese}}</ref>
On 4 February 2016, Jesus scored his first ''Paulista'' goal, opening a 2–2 home draw with [[Esporte Clube São Bento]] in the second game of [[2016 Campeonato Paulista|the season]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Com gol no fim, Palmeiras sofre para empatar com São Bento por 2 a 2 no Pacaembu|trans-title=With a goal at the end, Palmeiras suffer in order to draw 2–2 with São Bento in the Pacaembu|url=http://www.parana-online.com.br/editoria/esportes/news/932489/?noticia=COM+GOL+NO+FIM+PALMEIRAS+SOFRE+PARA+EMPATAR+COM+SAO+BENTO+POR+2+A+2+NO+PACAEMBU|accessdate=3 April 2016|publisher=Paraná Online|date=4 February 2016|language=Portuguese}}</ref> Twelve days later, he scored his first goal in continental football, a 2–2 draw away to Uruguay's [[Club Atlético River Plate (Montevideo)|River Plate]] in the opening game of the [[2016 Copa Libertadores second stage|group stage]] of [[2016 Copa Libertadores|the year's]] [[Copa Libertadores]], after coming on at the interval in place of fellow youngster [[Erik Lima]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.foxsports.com/soccer/story/copa-lib-palmeiras-held-by-river-plate-tachira-down-olimpia-021716|title=Palmeiras held by River Plate, Táchira down Olimpia|publisher=[[Fox Sports]]|date=16 February 2016|accessdate=23 February 2016}}</ref> Away to [[Rosario Central]] on 6 April, he scored twice in a 3–3 draw but was sent off for the first time in his career for fighting with Damián Musto; he later apologised for his misconduct.<ref>{{cite news|title=Gabriel Jesus explica expulsão e admite erro: 'Fui infeliz em revidar'|trans-title=Gabriel Jesus explains his expulsion and admits his error: "I was irresponsible to retaliate"|url=http://esporte.uol.com.br/futebol/campeonatos/libertadores/ultimas-noticias/2016/04/07/gabriel-jesus-explica-expulsao-na-argentina-fui-infeliz-em-revidar.htm#fotoNav=8|accessdate=7 April 2016|publisher=UOL|date=7 April 2016|language=Portuguese}}</ref>
In the opening game of the [[2016 Campeonato Brasileiro Série A|national season]] at home to [[Clube Atlético Paranaense]] on 14 May, Jesus scored twice in the second half of a 4–0 win.<ref>{{cite news|title=Gabriel Jesus brilha, e Palmeiras goleia Atlético-PR na estreia do Brasileirão|trans-title=Gabriel Jesus shines, and Palmeiras thrash Atlético-PR in the opening game of the ''Brasileirão''|url=http://espn.uol.com.br/noticia/598904_gabriel-jesus-brilha-e-palmeiras-goleia-atletico-pr-na-estreia-do-brasileirao|accessdate=29 June 2016|publisher=UOL|date=14 May 2016|language=Portuguese}}</ref> He scored 12 goals as the team won their first national championship since 1994, and was named ''[[Bola de Ouro]]'' for player of the season.<ref>{{cite news|title=Manchester City-bound Gabriel Jesus earns Brazil's Bola de Ouro|url=http://www.espnfc.com/manchester-city/story/3018497/manchester-city-bound-gabriel-jesus-earns-brazil-league-bola-de-ouro|accessdate=20 December 2016|publisher=ESPN FC|date=13 December 2016}}</ref>
===Manchester City=== [[File:MC-Shahter (5).jpg|thumb|Gabriel Jesus in action against [[Shakhtar Donetsk]] in September 2017]] On 3 August 2016, it was announced that Jesus would sign for [[Premier League]] club [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] in January 2017 on a contract until the summer of 2021.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.mancity.com/news/first-team/2016/07/25/city-sign-gabriel-jesus/1469474304156 |title=City sign Gabriel Jesus |publisher=Manchester City F.C. |date=3 August 2016 |accessdate=18 August 2016 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160817211140/http://www.mancity.com/news/first-team/2016/07/25/city-sign-gabriel-jesus/1469474304156 |archivedate=17 August 2016 }}</ref> City paid a reported fee of £27 million/€33 million, plus add-ons.<ref>{{cite news |first=Simon |last=Stone |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36964045 |title=Gabriel Jesus: Man City sign Brazilian winger from Palmeiras |publisher=BBC Sport |date=3 August 2016 |accessdate=18 August 2016}}</ref> The transfer was fully completed on 19 January 2017.
Jesus made his first Premier League appearance on 21 January, coming on as an 82nd-minute substitute for [[Raheem Sterling]] in a 2–2 draw with [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] at the [[City of Manchester Stadium]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.mancity.com/news/first-team/2017/01/21/manchester-city-gabriel-jesus-interview-tottenham-debut/1485033558304|title=Gabriel Jesus reflects on City debut|date=21 January 2017|publisher=Manchester City Football Club}}</ref> A week later, Jesus made his first appearance in Manchester City's starting XI, assisting a goal for Sterling in a 3–0 [[2016–17 FA Cup|FA Cup]] win over [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/pep-guardiola-hails-gabriel-jesus-9713159|title=Pep Guardiola hails Gabriel Jesus "the future of Man City" as £27million man bags assist in fourth round FA Cup win|date=28 January 2017|work=The Mirror}}</ref> On 1 February he made his first [[Premier League]] start in place of [[Sergio Agüero]], and assisted [[Kevin De Bruyne]] in the 17th minute and then scored his first goal for the club in the 39th. With this, he became the first Manchester City player to have a goal and an assist in their first Premier League start, as well as only the third City player to be involved in two or more goals in their first Premier League start.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/1862/premier-league/2017/02/01/32216682/gabriel-jesus-is-first-man-city-player-ever-to-score-and|title=The Brazil international, who replaced Sergio Aguero in the XI against West Ham, set up the opener before scoring his first goal for his new club|date=1 February 2017|work=Goal.com}}</ref> In his fourth game (third league start) Jesus broke a metatarsal in his right foot and was expected to be out for the remainder of the [[2016–17 Premier League]] season.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/39009054|title=Gabriel Jesus: Manchester City forward 'may be out for season'|publisher=BBC Sport|date=17 February 2017|accessdate=19 February 2017}}</ref> However, he returned in April for the [[Manchester Derby]], coming on as a substitute in a goalless draw.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/39018821|title=Manchester City 0-0 Manchester United|publisher=BBC Sport|date=27 April 2017|accessdate=27 April 2017}}</ref> Jesus ended the 2016–17 season with 7 goals and 4 assists in 11 games.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.premierleague.com/players/19680/Gabriel-Jesus/stats?co=1&se=54|title=Gabriel Jesus Statistics|publisher=Premier League|date=21 August 2017|accessdate=22 August 2017}}</ref>
He scored his first Premier League goal of the [[2017–18 Premier League|2017–18 season]] on 26 August, an equaliser in a 2–1 away win over [[A.F.C. Bournemouth|AFC Bournemouth]],<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40984015|title=AFC Bournemouth 1–2 Manchester City|publisher=BBC Sport|date=26 August 2017}}</ref> and added two more in a 5–0 win against [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] on 9 September.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/41133350|title=Manchester City 5–0 Liverpool|publisher=BBC Sport|date=9 September 2017}}</ref> He had a 14-game goal drought between 18 November 2017 and 7 March 2018 that encompassed a knee medial ligament injury on New Year's Eve, and after breaking his duck in the Champions League loss to [[FC Basel]] he admitted that fear of getting injured was affecting his game.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Wallace|first1=Sam|title=Gabriel Jesus still playing with fear of being injured again after lay-off|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2018/03/08/gabriel-jesus-still-playing-fear-injured-lay-off/|accessdate=23 April 2018|work=The Daily Telegraph|date=8 March 2018}}</ref> Jesus scored the last Premier League goal in the 2017–18 season against Southampton in the 94th minute, to secure City a league record 100 points.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Johnston|first1=Neil|title= Man City reach 100 point with late goal against Southampton|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/44020180|accessdate=13 May 2018|work=BBC Sport|date=13 May 2018}}</ref>On 9 January 2019, Gabriel Jesus scored 4 goals for the first time in his career against [[Burton Albion F.C.|Burton Albion]] in a 9-0 victory.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2019/jan/09/manchester-city-burton-albion-carabao-cup-match-report|title=Gabriel Jesus hits four in Manchester City’s 9-0 destruction of Burton Albion|last=Stadium|first=Daniel Taylor at the Etihad|date=2019-01-09|work=The Guardian|access-date=2019-01-20|language=en-GB|issn=0261-3077}}</ref>
==International career== [[File:ECUADOR vs BRASIL - ARCO SUR (29393657185).jpg|thumb|Jesus on his debut with senior national team.]] Jesus was part of the [[Brazil national under-20 football team|Brazil under-20 team]] that finished as runners-up at the [[2015 FIFA U-20 World Cup|2015 U-20 World Cup]] in New Zealand. He scored their first goal of the tournament in a 4–2 win over [[Nigeria national under-20 football team|Nigeria]] in [[New Plymouth]],<ref>{{cite news|title=Brazil triumph in Taranaki thriller|url=https://www.fifa.com/u20worldcup/matches/round=271602/match=300269536/match-report.html|accessdate=23 February 2016|publisher=FIFA|date=1 June 2015}}</ref> and converted as they advanced past [[Uruguay national under-20 football team|Uruguay]] and [[Portugal national under-20 football team|Portugal]] on penalties.
In 2016, he was chosen in [[Dunga]]'s provisional 40-man squad for the [[Copa América Centenario]] in the United States, and was considered as a replacement for the injured [[Douglas Costa]] in the final selection but missed out through the lack of a [[Visa policy of the United States|U.S. visa]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Gabriel Jesus fica fora da Copa América Centenário por falta de documentação|trans-title=Gabriel Jesus remains out of the Copa América Centenario due to a lack of documents|url=http://istoe.com.br/gabriel-jesus-fica-fora-da-copa-america-centenario-por-falta-de-documentacao/|accessdate=20 June 2016|publisher=Istoé|date=28 May 2016|language=Portuguese}}</ref> Later that year, he was one of five forwards named in the squad for the team's hosting of the [[Football at the 2016 Summer Olympics – Men's tournament|Olympic tournament]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Rio 2016: Neymar and Douglas Costa in Brazil Olympic squad|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36666740|accessdate=29 June 2016|publisher=BBC Sport|date=29 June 2016}}</ref> He scored twice against Danish keeper [[Jeppe Højbjerg]] in their final group game against [[Denmark national under-21 football team|Denmark]], an eventual 4–0 win, and in the semi-final against [[Honduras national under-23 football team|Honduras]] he added two more in a 6–0 victory.<ref>{{cite web|title=Rio Olympics 2016: Neymar scores after 14 seconds as Brazil reach final|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/olympics/37111213|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=18 August 2016}}</ref> Jesus won the Olympics with his team against Germany in a penalty shootout, scoring one of the penalties.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.fifa.com/mensolympic/news/y=2016/m=8/news=neymar-s-golden-penalty-sees-brazil-to-victory-2823069.html|title=Neymar's golden penalty sees Brazil to victory|date=20 August 2016|publisher=FIFA}}</ref>
Jesus made his debut for the senior team on 1 September 2016, in a [[2018 FIFA World Cup qualification (CONMEBOL)|2018 FIFA World Cup qualification]] game against [[Ecuador national football team|Ecuador]] in [[Quito]]. He started the match and scored twice, as Brazil won 3–0.<ref>{{cite web|title=Gabriel Jesus reminds how good Brazil can be in 3–0 win over Ecuador|url=http://www.espnfc.com/world-cup-qualifying-conmebol/65/blog/post/2942340/gabriel-jesus-reminds-how-good-brazil-can-be-in-3-0-win-over-ecuador|website=ESPN FC|publisher=ESPN|accessdate=2 September 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.fifa.com/fifa-tournaments/players-coaches/people=386559/index.html|title=Gabriel Jesus|publisher=FIFA|accessdate=12 October 2017}}</ref> Jesus was Brazil's highest scorer in the [[CONMEBOL]] World Cup qualifiers, with 7 goals in 10 matches.<ref>{{cite web|title=Top Scorers World Cup Qualification CONMEBOL 2018|url=https://www.eurosport.com/football/world-cup-qualification-conmebol/2018/standingperson.shtml|website=Eurosport|accessdate=1 January 2018}}</ref> In May 2018, he was named in Tite’s final [[2018 FIFA World Cup squads#Brazil|23-man squad]] for the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]] in Russia.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44116590|title=World Cup: Neymar named in Brazil's 23-man squad|date=14 May 2018|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=2 June 2018}}</ref> Jesus started all five games for Brazil at the tournament without scoring a goal.<ref>{{cite news |title=Brazil sent packing: Kevin De Bruyne's magic fires up Belgium to knock Selecao out of World Cup |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/world-cup/2018/07/06/brazil-vs-belgium-world-cup-2018-live-score-neymar-latest-updates/ |work=The Telegraph |date=6 July 2018}}</ref>
==Style of play== A talented and versatile forward, Jesus is capable of playing in several attacking positions: he has been deployed as a [[Forward (association football)#Centre-forward|centre forward]], as an out-and-out [[Forward (association football)#Striker|striker]], as a [[Forward (association football)#False 9|false 9]], as an [[Forward (association football)#Second striker|inside forward]], as a [[Midfielder#Winger|winger]] or as an [[Midfielder#Attacking midfielder|attacking midfielder]], and is renowned for his pace, technical skills, [[Dribbling#Association football|dribbling]] ability, creativity, finishing, movement, and work ethic. Former Brazilian striker [[Ronaldo (Brazilian footballer)|Ronaldo]] has praised Jesus and touted him for future success with the [[Brazil national football team|Brazilian national team]].<ref name=neymar>{{cite web|url=http://soccerlens.com/gabriel-jesus-the-brazilian-wonderkid-on-everyones-radar/190164/|title=Gabriel Jesus: The Brazilian wonderkid on everyone’s radar - Sportslens|date=10 April 2016|publisher=}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/blog/2017/sep/30/chelsea-manchester-city-gabriel-jesus-sergio-aguero|title=Gabriel Jesus stars to help Manchester City cope without Sergio Agüero|publisher=The Guardian|author1=Barney Ronay|date=30 September 2017|accessdate=21 October 2017}}</ref>
==Video game and goal celebration== Appearing in [[EA Sports]]' [[FIFA (video game series)|''FIFA'']] video game series, Jesus’s [[goal celebration]] – ‘Alô-mãe’, where he makes a telephone gesture – features in ''[[FIFA 19]]''.<ref>{{cite news |title=UPDATED FIFA 19 new celebrations and tutorial, ft Cristiano Ronaldo, Paul Pogba and Neymar |url=https://talksport.com/football/418292/fifa-19-new-celebrations-cristiano-ronaldo-paul-pogba-neymar |accessdate=11 October 2018 |agency=Talksport}}</ref>
==Personal life== Gabriel Jesus came to England with his mother and older brother along with two friends.{{cn|date=December 2018}} He comes from a religious family and reportedly chose to wear the number 33 in tribute to the age at which [[Jesus|Jesus Christ]] is believed to have been [[Crucifixion of Jesus|crucified]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Jesus could wear Michael Johnson's old Man City shirt number|url=http://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/gabriel-jesus-number-man-city-12251145|date=30 November 2016|accessdate=2 February 2017|work=[[Manchester Evening News]]|last=Brennan|first=Stuart}}</ref> He and [[Neymar]] got matching tattoos in August 2016 depicting a boy overlooking a [[favela]].<ref>{{cite web|last=Wright|first=Chris|title=Gabriel Jesus and Barcelona ace Neymar have matching tattoos|url=http://www.espnfc.us/blog/the-toe-poke/65/post/2921757/gabriel-jesus-and-barcelona-ace-neymar-have-matching-tattoos|date=2 August 2016|accessdate=6 February 2017|publisher=[[ESPN FC]]}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|work=[[FOX Sports]]|title=Brazil teammates Neymar and Gabriel Jesus reveal matching tattoos|url=http://www.foxsports.com/soccer/story/brazil-teammates-neymar-and-gabriel-jesus-reveal-matching-tattoos-080216|date=2 August 2016|accessdate=6 February 2017}}</ref>

Foden: Summary |website=Soccerway |publisher=Perform Group |access-date=25 April 2018}}</ref> | birth_place = [[Stockport]], England | height = {{convert|1.71|m|order=flip}}<ref>{{cite web|title=2017 Under-17 World Cup squad lists|url=http://resources.fifa.com/mm/document/tournament/competition/02/90/99/30/fu17_2017_squadlists_neutral.pdf|publisher=FIFA|access-date=31 October 2017|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171030160716/http://resources.fifa.com/mm/document/tournament/competition/02/90/99/30/fu17_2017_squadlists_neutral.pdf|archive-date=30 October 2017}}</ref> | position = [[Midfielder]] | currentclub = [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] | clubnumber = 47 | youthclubs1 = [[Manchester City F.C. EDS and Academy|Manchester City]] | youthyears1 = 2009–2017 | clubs1 = [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] | years1 = 2017– | caps1 = 14 | goals1 = 0<!-- LEAGUE GOALS ONLY, NOT LEAGUE CUP--> | nationalyears1 = 2015–2016 | nationalteam1 = [[England national under-16 football team|England U16]] | nationalcaps1 = 8 | nationalgoals1 = 2 | nationalyears2 = 2016–2017 | nationalteam2 = [[England national under-17 football team|England U17]] | nationalcaps2 = 23 | nationalgoals2 = 11 | nationalyears3 = 2017– | nationalteam3 = [[England national under-18 football team|England U18]] | nationalcaps3 = 2 | nationalgoals3 = 1 | nationalyears4 = 2018– | nationalteam4 = [[England national under-19 football team|England U19]] | nationalcaps4 = 3 | nationalgoals4 = 1 | nationalyears5 = 2018– | nationalteam5 = [[England national under-21 football team|England U21]] | nationalcaps5 = 4 | nationalgoals5 = 0 | club-update = 21:59, 27th February 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 16:55, 24 November 2018 (UTC) }} '''Philip Walter Foden''' (born 28 May 2000) is an English professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[midfielder]] for {{English football updater|ManchesC}} club [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] and the [[England national under-21 football team|English under-21 national team]].
After he won the [[FIFA U-17 World Cup#Awards|FIFA U-17 World Cup Golden Ball]] award in [[2017 FIFA U-17 World Cup|2017]], Foden received significant media coverage.
On 17 December 2017, Foden was named the [[BBC Young Sports Personality of the Year]].
==Club career== Born in [[Stockport]], Greater Manchester and a boyhood supporter of [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]],<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.mancity.com/news/first%20team/first%20team%20news/2017/july/phil%20foden%20man%20utd%20v%20man%20city |title=City Starlet Foden: Silva's My Idol |date=20 July 2017 |publisher=Manchester City |access-date=17 December 2017}}</ref> he joined at the age of eight and signed his [[Manchester City F.C. EDS and Academy|Academy]] scholarship in July 2016.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.mancity.com/phil-foden |title=Manchester City U18's Phil Foden profile |publisher=Manchester City |access-date=17 December 2017}}</ref> He was privately educated at [[St Bede's College, Manchester|St Bede's College]], with his tuition fees being paid for by Manchester City.<ref name="DailyTelegraph">{{cite news |last=Ducker |first=James |date=3 August 2018 |title=Phil Foden may have gone from ballboy to 'Pep Guardiola's lad', but Man City's local hero remains firmly grounded |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2018/08/03/phil-foden-may-have-gone-ballboy-pep-guardiolas-lad-butman-citys/ |work=[[The Daily Telegraph]] |access-date=5 August 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last=Pollard |first=Rob |date=11 May 2016 |title=Pivotal Man City moment that helped shape Blues' vision for their next generation |url=https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/man-city-st-bedes-news-11311766 |work=[[Manchester Evening News]] |access-date=5 August 2018}}</ref> On 6 December 2016, City head coach [[Pep Guardiola]] included Foden in the matchday squad for the [[UEFA Champions League|Champions League]] group stage match with [[Celtic F.C.|Celtic]]; he was an unused substitute in the 1–1 home draw.<ref>{{cite news |last=McNulty |first=Phil |date=6 December 2016 |title=Manchester City 1–1 Celtic |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/38202631 |publisher=BBC Sport |access-date=17 December 2017}}</ref>
Guardiola said of Foden: "It’s dangerous to say good things about young players because they are still young, and they have to grow and they have to learn many, many things … But we have a lot of confidence to help him, because we believe he is a guy who has potential, even if he’s not strong, he’s not tall … I think he has absolutely good potential to be helped, and that is what we do."<ref name="GoalSL"/>
In July 2017, Foden was included in Manchester City's squad for the club's [[2017 International Champions Cup#United States|pre-season tour of the United States]], where he performed impressively in a 0–2 loss to [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]]<ref>{{cite news |last=Handler |first=Paul |date=21 July 2017 |title=Guardiola: Foden display 'Another level' |url=https://www.mancity.com/news/first-team/first-team-news/2017/july/phil-foden-pep-guardiola-manchester-derby |publisher=Manchester City |access-date=17 December 2017}}</ref> and also started in a 4–1 win over [[Real Madrid C.F.|Real Madrid]].<ref>{{cite news |last=Clayton |first=David |date=27 July 2017 |title=City 4 Real Madrid 1 |url=https://www.mancity.com/news/first%20team/match%20report/2017/july/city%20v%20real%20madrid |publisher=Manchester City |access-date=17 December 2017}}</ref> Guardiola stated after the Manchester United match: "It’s a long time since I saw something like this. His performance was another level. He’s 17-years-old, he’s a City player, he grew up in the academy, he loves the club, he’s a City fan and for us he’s a gift."<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.mancity.com/news/first-team/first-team-news/2017/july/phil-foden-pep-guardiola-manchester-derby |title=Foden display 'another level' |date=21 July 2017 |publisher=Manchester City |access-date=14 January 2019}}</ref>
After making several appearances on the bench at the start of the [[2017–18 Manchester City F.C. season|2017–18 season]], Foden made his Manchester City debut on 21 November 2017 in a [[2017–18 UEFA Champions League|Champions League]] game against [[Feyenoord]], coming on in the 75th minute for [[Yaya Touré]]. He became the fourth youngest English player to make an appearance in the Champions League (17 years 177 days).<ref>{{cite news |last=Dawkes |first=Phil |date=21 November 2017 |title=Manchester City 1–0 Feyenoord|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42055934 |publisher=BBC Sport |access-date=17 December 2017}}</ref> On 6 December 2017, Foden set a record for the youngest English player (17 years, 192 days) to start in a [[UEFA Champions League]] match against [[FC Shakhtar Donetsk|Shakhtar Donetsk]] in a 2–1 defeat.{{citation needed|date=January 2019}} He made his [[Premier League]] debut as a substitute in a 4–1 win against [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] on 16 December 2017, appearing at the 83rd minute for [[İlkay Gündoğan]].<ref>{{cite news |last=McNulty |first=Phil |date=16 December 2017 |title=Manchester City 4–1 Tottenham |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/42290590 |publisher=BBC Sport |access-date=17 December 2017}}</ref>
Foden featured as a late substitute for [[Sergio Agüero]] in the [[2018 EFL Cup Final|EFL Cup Final]] on 25 February 2018, helping City secure a 3–0 victory against [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] at [[Wembley Stadium]].<ref name=2018LC>{{cite news |last=McNulty |first=Phil |date=25 February 2018 |title=Arsenal 0–3 Manchester City |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/43101681 |publisher=BBC Sport |access-date=25 February 2018}}</ref>
On 13 May 2018, Foden became [[List of Premier League winning players|the youngest ever player]] to receive a [[Premier League]] winners' medal.<ref>{{cite news |last=Fay |first=Richard |date=13 May 2018 |title=Man City fans loved seeing Phil Foden make Premier League history |url=https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/man-city-foden-diaz-medal-14652426 |work=Manchester Evening News |access-date=14 May 2018}}</ref>
Foden was part of the City's starting line-up for the [[2018 FA Community Shield|FA Community Shield]] on 5 August 2018, playing a total of 75 minutes as well as assisting Agüero's first goal of the game in a 2–0 victory over Chelsea at Wembley Stadium, marking Foden's third winners' medal of the calendar year.<ref name=shield2018>{{cite news |last=Bevan |first=Chris |date=5 August 2018 |title=Chelsea 0–2 Manchester City |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44995783 |publisher=BBC Sport |access-date=5 August 2018}}</ref>
On 25 September 2018, Foden provided an assist to [[Riyad Mahrez]] and later scored his first senior goal in [[injury time]] to secure City a 3–0 away win against [[Oxford United F.C.|Oxford United]] in the third round of the [[2018–19 EFL Cup|EFL Cup]].<ref>{{cite news |last=McNulty |first=Phil |date=25 September 2018 |title=Oxford United 0–3 Manchester City |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45555893 |publisher=BBC Sport |access-date=26 September 2018}}</ref>
Foden scored his first home goal at the [[City of Manchester Stadium|Etihad Stadium]], netting the second for City during their 7–0 victory against [[Rotherham United F.C.|Rotherham United]] in the third round of the [[2018–19 FA Cup|FA Cup]] on 6 January 2019.<ref>{{cite news |last=Johnston |first=Neil |date=6 January 2019 |title=Man City put seven past Rotherham to reach fourth round |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/46713168 |publisher=BBC Sport |access-date=14 January 2019}}</ref> Three days later, Foden was again on the scoresheet as he helped City defeat [[Burton Albion F.C.|Burton Albion]] 9–0 in the first leg of the EFL Cup semi-finals.<ref>{{cite news |last=Emons |first=Michael |date=9 January 2019 |title=Man City 9–0 Burton Albion |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/46732982 |publisher=BBC Sport |access-date=14 January 2019}}</ref>
==International career== Foden is an England youth international, currently playing for the [[England national under-21 football team|U21 team]]. In May 2017, he scored in the final of the [[2017 UEFA European Under-17 Championship]] as the [[England national under-17 football team|England under-17s]] suffered a penalty defeat at the hands of [[Spain national under-17 football team|Spain]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Young Lions Beaten on Penalties in UEFA EURO U17 Championship Final|url=http://www.thefa.com/news/2017/may/19/spain-v-england-u17-report-190517|publisher=The Football Association|date=19 May 2017|accessdate=6 February 2018}}</ref>
In October of the same year, Foden gained widespread press attention after scoring twice in the final of the [[2017 FIFA U-17 World Cup]], also against Spain, as England won the competition. He was named as the best player of the tournament.<ref>{{cite news|title=England win Under-17 World Cup as Phil Foden inspires incredible comeback victory over Spain|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/international/england-win-under-17-world-cup-vs-spain-phil-foden-rhian-brewster-gibbs-white-a8025086.html|newspaper=The Independent|date=28 October 2017|accessdate=6 February 2018}}</ref>
He won the [[FIFA U-17 World Cup#Awards|FIFA U-17 World Cup Golden Ball]] award in [[2017 FIFA U-17 World Cup|2017]] where he also gained some widespread press attention and significant media coverage.<ref>{{cite news|title=England Win Under-17 World Cup as Phil Foden Inspires Incredible Comeback Victory over Spain|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/international/england-win-under-17-world-cup-vs-spain-phil-foden-rhian-brewster-gibbs-white-a8025086.html|newspaper=The Independent|date=28 October 2017|accessdate=17 December 2017}}</ref><ref name="GoalSL">{{cite web|last=Lee|first=Sam|title=Phil Foden: Who Is England’s 17-Year Old World Cup Hero?|url=http://www.goal.com/en-gb/news/phil-foden-who-is-englands-17-year-old-world-cup-hero/phu48rixtx151egq8b3nfgmsg|website=Goal|publisher=Perform Group|date=28 October 2017|accessdate=17 December 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Foden Scores England's Fifth to Seal U17 World Cup|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/41789998|publisher=BBC Sport|date=28 October 2017|accessdate=17 December 2017}}</ref>

EDS and Academy|Manchester City]] |years1 = 2017– |clubs1 = [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] |caps1 = 0 |goals1 = 0 |years2 = 2018 |clubs2 = → [[NAC Breda]] (loan) |caps2 = 1 |goals2 = 0 |nationalyears1 = 2017 |nationalteam1 = [[Montenegro national under-21 football team|Montenegro U21]] |nationalcaps1 = 2|nationalgoals1 = 0 |nationalyears2 = 2018– |nationalteam2 = [[Kosovo national football team|Kosovo]] |nationalcaps2 = 1 |nationalgoals2 = 0 |club-update = 16:17, 27 September 2018 (UTC) |nationalteam-update = 19:30, 20 November 2018 (UTC) }} '''Arijanet Anan Muric'''{{cite web |url=https://www.mancity.com/teams/first-team/goalkeepers/arijanet-muric |title=Manchester City U18s Arijanet Muric profile |publisher=Manchester City F.C. |accessdate=25 September 2018 }}{{cite news |last=Bajkowski |first=Simon |url=https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/aro-muric-manchester-city-wiki-13344020 |title=Who is Aro Muric? Manchester City goalkeeper profiled as he is named on the bench vs Wolves |newspaper=Manchester Evening News |date=25 August 2018 |accessdate=25 August 2018}} ({{lang-sq|Arijanet Samir Muriqi}}, {{lang-cnr|Arijanet Anan Murić|italic=yes}}; born 7 November 1998) is a Kosovan professional [[association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Goalkeeper (association football)|goalkeeper]] for English club [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] and the [[Kosovo national football team|Kosovo national team]],{{cite newspaper |last=Blanco |first=Yadran |url=https://www.bndestem.nl/nac/muric-klaar-voor-zijn-debuut-ilic-moet-nac-vleugje-creativiteit-geven~a1403bd8/ |title=Muric klaar voor zijn debuut, Ilic moet NAC vleugje creativiteit geven |trans-title=Muric ready for his debut, Ilic must give NAC a touch of creativity |quote=Toch lijkt het er sterk op dat doelman Arijanet Muric, die woensdag de groepstraining hervatte, zaterdag tegen [[De Graafschap]] zijn entree maakt. ,,Het ziet er positief uit, hij is fit. Nu kijken of hij geen terugslag krijgt.” Het inbrengen van Muric, die hersteld is van zijn blessure, gaat ten koste van [[Mark Birighitti]] die op weg is naar de uitgang |language=Dutch |newspaper=BN De Stem |date=17 August 2018 |accessdate=17 August 2018}} he previously played for [[Montenegro national under-21 football team]]. ==Early life== Muric was born in Schlieren, Switzerland to Albanian parents from [[Rožaje]], Montenegro. He holds [[Kosovan passport|Kosovan]],{{cite news |url=https://periskopi.com/edhe-zyrtarisht-arijanet-anan-murici-eshte-kosovar/ |title=Edhe zyrtarisht, Arijanet Anan Murici është kosovar |trans-title=Even officially, Arijanet Anan Murici is Kosovan |quote=Arijanet Muric's birthplace according to Kosovan passport is Schlieren, Switzerland |language=Albanian |website=Periskopi |date=19 October 2018 |access-date=19 October 2018}} [[Montenegrin passport|Montenegrin]] and [[Swiss passport|Swiss]] passports.{{cite news |last=Blanco |first=Yadran |url=https://www.bndestem.nl/nac/nac-huurt-doelman-muric-19-voor-een-seizoen-van-manchester-city~a43249c4a/ |title=NAC huurt doelman Muric (19) voor een seizoen van Manchester City |trans-title=NAC hires goalkeeper Muric (19) for a Manchester City season |quote=Muric wordt door NAC voor een seizoen gehuurd van Manchester City en wordt beschouwd als de opvolger van de vertrokken [[Nigel Bertrams]]. De 19-jarige Muric, een boom van een vent getuige zijn lengte van 1.98-meter, is geboren in Zürich en in het bezit van een Zwitsers en een Montenegrijns paspoort. [...] Tot op heden speelde Muric enkel jeugdwedstrijden voor Manchester City, dat hem in 2016 overnam van Grasshopper. Ondanks dat hij een leven lang in Zwitserland woonde, maakte Muric eind 2017 zijn debuut voor het nationale jeugdteam (onder 21) van Montenegro. Muric gaat spelen met nummer 1, door NAC speciaal vrijgehouden voor de goalie |language=Dutch |newspaper=BN DeStem |date=31 July 2018 |access-date=31 July 2018}} ==Club career== ===Early career=== Muric is a product of various Swiss youth teams such as [[SC Young Fellows Juventus|YF Juventus]], [[FC Zürich|Zürich]] and [[Grasshopper Club Zürich|Grasshoppers]]. In 2015, he joined with [[Manchester City F.C. EDS and Academy|youth team]] of [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]].{{cite news |url=https://football365.sk/arijanet-muric-premier-league/ |title=Profil a štatistiky hráča Arijanet Muric |trans-title=Profile and statistics of player Arijanet Muric |language=Slovak |website=football365.sk |access-date=22 August 2018}} ===Manchester City=== [[File:Goalkeeper Arijanet Muric (36243874430-cropped2).jpg|thumb|right|222px|Muric with [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] in July 2017.]] On 27 July 2017, Muric signed a three-year professional contract with [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]].{{cite tweet |user=mancityacademy |author=Manchester City F.C. EDS and Academy |number=890512088568930305 |date=27 July 2017 |accessdate=27 July 2017 |title=We are delighted to announce that Arijanet Muric has signed a three-year contract extension with the Club! Well done, Aro! #mcfc}} ====Loan at NAC Breda==== On 31 July 2018, Muric joined [[Eredivisie]] side [[NAC Breda]], on a season-long loan.{{cite web |url=http://www.nac.nl/108/newsid/12663/NAC-huurt-Muric-van-City.html |title=NAC huurt Muric van City |trans-title=NAC hires Muric from City |language=Dutch |publisher=NAC Breda |date=31 July 2018 |accessdate=31 July 2018}} On 18 August 2018, he made his debut as a professional footballer in a 3–0 home win against [[De Graafschap]] after being named in the starting line-up.{{cite news |url=https://www.ad.nl/dossier-eredivisie/live-mets-scoort-voor-nac-na-opnieuw-assist-rosheuvel~a88fc13c/ |title=De Graafschap na stunt tegen Feyenoord kansloos op 'avondje NAC' |trans-title=De Graafschap after stunt against Feyenoord no chance at 'night NAC' |quote=NAC startte met Arijanet Muric op doel. De negentienjarige keeper die wordt wordt gehuurd van Manchester City, kon vorige week nog niet spelen |language=Dutch |newspaper=Algemeen Dagblad |location=Rotterdam |date=18 August 2018 |accessdate=18 August 2018}}{{cite news |last=Eijkhout |first=Fabian |url=http://www.omroepbrabant.nl/?news/280830652/NAC+Breda+huurt+19-jarige+doelman+Arijanet+Muric+van+Manchester+City+Ik+kan+niet+wachten!.aspx |title=NAC Breda huurt 19-jarige doelman Arijanet Muric van Manchester City: 'Ik kan niet wachten!' |trans-title=NAC Breda hires 19-year-old goalkeeper Arijanet Muric from Manchester City: 'I can not wait!' |language=Dutch |website=Omroep Brabant |date=31 July 2018 |accessdate=31 July 2018}} ====Return to Manchester City==== On 22 August 2018, with Muric having only played one game with NAC Breda, Manchester City recalled him from loan to replace injured goalkeeper [[Claudio Bravo]] as their second choice.{{cite web |url=http://www.nac.nl/108/newsid/12712/Muric-keert-terug-naar-Manchester-City.html |title=Muric keert terug naar Manchester City |trans-title=Muric returns to Manchester City |language=Dutch |publisher=NAC Breda |date=22 August 2018 |accessdate=22 August 2018}} Three days later, he was named as a Manchester City substitute for the first time in a [[Premier League]] match against [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]].{{cite news |last1=McNulty |first1=Phil |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45230636 |title=Wolverhampton Wanderers 1–1 Manchester City: Aymeric Laporte rescues Molineux draw for champions |publisher=BBC Sport |date=25 August 2018 |accessdate=25 August 2018}} His debut with Manchester City came on 25 September in the [[2018–19 EFL Cup#Third round|third round]] of [[2018–19 EFL Cup]] against [[Oxford United F.C.|Oxford United]] after being named in the starting line-up.{{cite news |url=https://matchday.mancity.com/fixtures/first-team/2018/oxford-united-v-manchester-city?tab=commentary |title=Oxford United V Manchester City |publisher=Manchester City F.C. |date=25 September 2018 |accessdate=25 September 2018}}{{cite news |url=https://www.mancity.com/news/first-team/first-team-news/2018/september/oxford-v-man-city-team-news |title=Foden, Muric and Diaz all start for City |publisher=Manchester City F.C. |date=25 September 2018 |accessdate=25 September 2018}} ==International career== ===Montenegro=== ====Under-21==== On 22 August 2017. Muric received a call-up from [[Montenegro national under-21 football team|Montenegro U21]] for the [[2019 UEFA European Under-21 Championship qualification Group 9|2019 UEFA European Under-21 Championship qualification]] match against [[Kazakhstan national under-21 football team|Kazakhstan U21]] and for the [[Exhibition game#Association football|friendly match]] against [[Bosnia and Herzegovina national under-21 football team|Bosnia and Herzegovina U21]].{{cite web |url=https://fscg.me/vijesti/4829/u21-spisak-ze-meceve-sa-kazahstanom-i-bih/ |title=U21: Spisak ze mečeve sa Kazahstanom i BiH |trans-title=U21: List of matches with Kazakhstan and Bosnia and Herzegovina |language=Montenegrin |publisher=Football Association of Montenegro |date=22 August 2017 |accessdate=22 August 2017}} On 5 September 2017, he made his debut with Montenegro U21 in a friendly match against Bosnia and Herzegovina U21 after being named in the starting line-up.{{cite web |url=https://fscg.me/utakmice/crna-gora-bih-1029859/ |title=Crna Gora – BiH |trans-title=Montenegro – Bosnia and Herzegovina |language=Montenegrin |publisher=Football Association of Montenegro |date=5 September 2017 |accessdate=5 September 2017}}{{cite web |url=https://fscg.me/vijesti/4857/u21-bez-pobjednika-u-niksicu/ |title=U21: Bez pobjednika u Nikšiću |trans-title=U21: No winner in Nikšić |language=Montenegrin |publisher=Football Association of Montenegro |date=5 September 2017 |accessdate=5 September 2017}} In both matches, he played for Montenegro U21 and he was sent off after receiving straight red cards, one for handling the ball outside the box against Bosnia and Herzegovina U21 and the other for headbutting an opponent against [[Slovenia national under-21 football team|Slovenia U21]]. Despite previously declaring his will to play for Montenegro after not being called up for the [[Montenegro national football team|senior team]], he opted to represent Kosovo instead.{{cite news |url=http://www.vijesti.me/sport/slucaj-muric-dvije-utakmice-dva-iskljucenja-jedan-nokaut-i-jedan-ultimatum-1001902/ |title=Slučaj Murić": Dvije utakmice, dva isključenja, jedan nokaut i jedan ultimatum |trans-title="Muric Case": Two games, two exclusion, one knockout and one ultimatum |language=Montenegrin |newspaper=Vijesti |location=Podgorica |date=28 August 2018 |accessdate=28 August 2018}} ===Kosovo=== On 26 August 2018, The [[Football Federation of Kosovo]] through a communiqué stated that after several months of talks, Muric had decided to play for the [[Kosovo national football team|Kosovo national team]].{{cite web |url=http://www.ffk-kosova.com/federata/2018/08/26/portieri-arjanet-muriqi-i-man-city-t-i-bashkohet-kombetares-a/ |title=Portieri Arjanet Muriqi i Manchester Cityt i bashkohet Kombëtares A |trans-title=Goalkeeper Arjanet Muriqi of Manchester City joins national senior team |language=Albanian |publisher=Football Federation of Kosovo |date=26 August 2018 |accessdate=26 August 2018}}{{cite news |url=https://www.gazetaexpress.com/sport/portieri-shqiptar-i-manchester-cityt-i-thote-po-kosoves-570250/?archive=1 |title=Portieri shqiptar i Manchester Cityt i thotë po Kosovës |trans-title=Albanian goalkeeper of Manchester City say "yes" Kosovo |language=Albanian |website=Gazeta Express |publisher=MediaWorks |date=26 August 2018 |accessdate=26 August 2018}} On 9 November 2018, he received a call-up from Kosovo for the [[2018–19 UEFA Nations League D#Group 3|2018–19 UEFA Nations League]] matches against [[Malta national football team|Malta]] and [[Azerbaijan national football team|Azerbaijan]].{{cite news |url=http://ffk-kosova.com/2018/11/09/challandes-publikon-listen-e-futbollisteve-per-dy-ndeshjet-e-radhes/ |title=Challandes publikon listën e futbollistëve për dy ndeshjet e radhës |trans-title=Challandes publish the list of footballers for two next matches |language=Albanian |publisher=[[Football Federation of Kosovo]] |date=9 November 2018 |accessdate=9 November 2018}} On 20 November 2018, he made his debut with Kosovo in a 2018–19 UEFA Nations League match against Azerbaijan after being named in the starting line-up. ==Career statistics== ===Club=== {{updated|match played 9 January 2019}}{{cite news |url=https://int.soccerway.com/players/arijanet-muric/453110/ |title=Arijanet Muric nationalteam-update = }} '''Abdul-Nasir Oluwatosin Oluwadoyinsolami Adarabioyo''' (born 24 September 1997) is an English professional [[association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Defender (association football)|defender]] for [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]] on loan from [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]]. ==Club career== Adarabioyo joined the youth system at [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] aged five.{{cite news|author= |url=http://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/man-city-one-to-watch-tosin-adarabioyo-8650768 |title=Man City one-to-watch: Tosin Adarabioyo – I'll do anything to win |newspaper=Manchester Evening News |date=17 February 2015 |accessdate=30 March 2016}} He made his U18 debut for the club aged 14 and was captaining the U18s aged 16.{{cite web |url=https://www.mcfc.co.uk/teams/eds/defenders/tosin-adarabioyo |title=Manchester City Academy defender Tosin Adarabioyo |publisher=Manchester City F.C. |accessdate=25 February 2016}} On 21 February 2016, Adarabioyo made his [[first-team]] debut in an [[FA Cup]] match against [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]].{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/MCFC/status/701421127520882689 |title=Manchester City FC on Twitter: "TEAM NEWS: Full debuts given to five players today! Congrats, lads! #chelseavcity #facup #mcfc" |publisher=Twitter |date=21 February 2016 |accessdate=25 February 2016}} He made his [[UEFA Champions League|Champions League]] debut on 24 August 2016 as a substitute in a 1–0 win over [[CSA Steaua București|Steaua București]], in a Champions League [[2016–17 UEFA Champions League qualifying phase and play-off round|play-off round]] match.{{cite web|url=http://www.espn.co.uk/football/report?gameId=462997|title=Man City advance to UCL group stage with defeat of Steaua Bucharest|date=24 August 2016|publisher=ESPN|accessdate=6 November 2016}} Adarabioyo joined [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]] on loan for the 2018–19 season.{{cite web |title=Albion swoop for Man City prospect |url=https://www.wba.co.uk/news/2018/august/albion-swoop-for-city-prospect/ |publisher=West Bromwich Albion|accessdate=3 August 2018}} ==International career== Adarabioyo has represented [[England national football team|England]] up to U19 level.{{cite web|url=http://www.thefa.com/news/england/development/2015/nov/tosin-adarabioyo-previews-england-u19s-v-japan-in-manchester-101115 |title=Tosin Adarabioyo relishing chance to pull on the Three Lions in front of his fellow Mancunians on Sunday - England |publisher=The Football Association |date=10 November 2015 |accessdate=25 February 2016}} ==Personal life== Adarabioyo was born in England and is of Nigerian descent.{{cite web|url=http://www.allnigeriasoccer.com/read_news.php?nid=21307|title=Man City Whizkid Tosin Adarabioyo Turns Down Chance To Play For Nigeria:: All Nigeria Soccer - The Complete Nigerian Football Portal|website=www.allnigeriasoccer.com}} Tosin is the brother of [[Fisayo Adarabioyo]], who is a free agent after being released by [[NAC Breda]].{{cite web|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-3738715/Manchester-City-s-starting-XI-Pep-Guardiola-era-set-include-Tosin-Adarabioyo-unknown-academy-graduate.html |title=Manchester City youngster Tosin Adarabioyo in the first team picture... but who is the academy graduate? |date=13 August 2016 |accessdate=1 September 2016 |work=Daily Mail}}{{cite web |url=http://webcache.googleusercontent.com/search?q=cache:vjsn-2eU2KYJ:m.mcfc.co.uk/%3Fi%3D12321/1/0%26artId%3D536969+&cd=1&hl=en&ct=clnk&gl=uk |title=News -
