5 February 1997) is an English professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Midfielder#Winger|winger]] for Spanish [[La Liga]] side [[Girona F.C.|Girona]] on loan from [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]]. He has previously played for [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]] and [[Celtic F.C.|Celtic]].{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/41051266 |title=Patrick Roberts: Manchester City winger completes Celtic switch after medical |work=BBC Sport |publisher=BBC |date=28 August 2017 |accessdate=28 August 2017}} ==Club career== ===Fulham=== Having joined [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]] from [[AFC Wimbledon]] at the age of 13,{{cite web|url=http://www.fulhamfc.com/news/2014/february/14/roberts-deal-delight |title=Roberts deal delight |publisher=Fulham F.C. |accessdate=8 May 2014 |date=14 February 2014 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140503164907/http://www.fulhamfc.com/news/2014/february/14/roberts-deal-delight |archivedate=3 May 2014 |deadurl=unfit }}{{cite web|title=The star makers: How Fulham became one of the best youth academies in the modern game|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/news-and-comment/the-star-makers-how-fulham-became-one-of-the-best-youth-academies-in-the-modern-game-9291146.html|publisher=independent.co.uk|accessdate=19 August 2014|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140819133054/http://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/news-and-comment/the-star-makers-how-fulham-became-one-of-the-best-youth-academies-in-the-modern-game-9291146.html|archivedate=19 August 2014|deadurl=no}} Roberts signed his first professional contract shortly after his 17th birthday in February 2014, tying himself to the club until the summer of 2016.{{cite web|url=http://www.fulhamfc.com/news/2014/february/06/roberts-pro-deal |title=Roberts' Pro Deal |publisher=Fulham F.C. |accessdate=8 May 2014 |date=6 February 2014 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140503164325/http://www.fulhamfc.com/news/2014/february/06/roberts-pro-deal |archivedate=3 May 2014 |deadurl=unfit }} Roberts described signing the contract as "one of the best feelings I've ever had in my life". Roberts was named among Fulham's [[Substitute (association football)|substitutes]] for the first time on 15 March 2014 for a [[Premier League]] game against [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]],{{cite web|title=Fulham 1 – 0 Newcastle|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/26493211|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=18 March 2014|date=15 March 2014}} with Fulham manager [[Felix Magath]] describing Roberts after the match as "an extraordinary talent".{{cite web|title=Magath: I Hate To Lose|url=http://www.fulhamfc.com/news/2014/march/15/magath-i-hate-to-lose|publisher=Fulham FC|accessdate=18 March 2014|date=15 March 2014}} On 22 March 2014, he made his debut as a 55th-minute substitute in a Premier League defeat to [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]].{{cite web|title=Man City 5 – 0 Fulham|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/26590071|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=22 March 2014}} On 5 May, he scored in the second leg of the [[2013–14 FA Youth Cup|2014 FA Youth Cup final]], which Fulham lost 7–6 on aggregate to [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]].[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/27288435 "FA Youth Cup final: Chelsea beat Fulham 7–6 on aggregate"] BBC Sport. 5 May 2014. Retrieved 6 May 2014. Roberts' first appearance of the 2014–2015 campaign came as a substitute in Fulham's opening day fixture at [[Ipswich Town F.C.|Ipswich Town]] on 9 August, where he managed to grab an assist shortly after coming on.{{cite news|last=Emons|first=Michael|title=Ipswich Town 2 – 1 Fulham|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/28646535|accessdate=2 April 2016|work=BBC Sport|date=9 August 2014}} He made his first start for the Cottagers on 20 August 2014 in a home match against [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]].{{cite news|last=Flanagan|first=Aaron|title=Who is Patrick Roberts? Everything you need to know about the Liverpool transfer target|url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/who-patrick-roberts-everything-you-4602550|accessdate=2 April 2016|work=The Mirror|date=10 November 2014}}{{cite news|title=Fulham 0 Wolverhampton Wanderers 1|url=http://www.fulhamfc.com/first-team/2014_2015/league/home/wolverhampton-wanderers|accessdate=2 April 2016|work=Fulham FC|date=20 August 2014}} ===Manchester City=== On 19 July 2015, Roberts signed for [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] on a long-term deal for an undisclosed fee, believed to be in the region of £12 million.{{cite news |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11095/9917664/patrick-roberts-signs-for-manchester-city-from-fulham |title=Patrick Roberts: Manchester City sign Fulham teenager |publisher=Sky Sports |date=19 July 2015 |accessdate=19 July 2015}}{{cite web|title=Manchester City sign Fulham's Patrick Roberts to swell homegrown contingent|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2015/jul/19/manchester-city-sign-patrick-roberts-fulham|publisher=The Guardian|accessdate=22 August 2015|date=19 July 2015}} Roberts made his debut coming on as a substitute for [[Jesús Navas]] against [[Real Madrid C.F.|Real Madrid]] in the pre-season [[2015 International Champions Cup]].{{Cite web|title = Manchester City vs. Real Madrid – 24 July 2015 – Soccerway|url = https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2015/07/24/world/international-champions-cup/manchester-city-football-club/real-madrid-club-de-futbol/2032770/|website = uk.soccerway.com|accessdate = 2015-07-24}} On 22 September 2015, Roberts made his first team debut for Manchester City when he came on as a substitute during a 4–1 win against [[Sunderland A.F.C.|Sunderland]] in the [[Football League Cup|League Cup]].{{cite web |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2015/sep/22/sunderland-manchester-city-capital-one-cup-match-report |title=Sunderland 1 – 4 Man City |publisher=The Guardian |date=22 September 2015 |accessdate=22 September 2015}} He made his league debut for Manchester City in a 4–1 loss to [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]], coming on as a substitute for [[Sergio Agüero]].{{Cite web|title = Tottenham Hotspur vs. Manchester City – 26 September 2015|url =https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2015/09/26/england/premier-league/tottenham-hotspur-football-club/manchester-city-football-club/2043111|website = uk.soccerway.com|accessdate=26 September 2015}} ====Loans to Celtic==== On 29 January 2016, it was reported that [[Celtic F.C.|Celtic]] had agreed an 18-month loan deal with Manchester City for Roberts, while the player was in Glasgow for a medical.{{cite news|last=McLaughlin|first=Chris|title=Patrick Roberts: Manchester City midfielder to join Celtic on loan|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/35444000|accessdate=30 January 2016|work=BBC Sport|date=29 January 2016}} The transfer was confirmed on 1 February.{{cite news |title=Celtic sign Colin Kazim-Richards & Patrick Roberts, send Ciftci on loan |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/35459424 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=1 February 2016 |accessdate=22 February 2016}} He played for the U20 side a couple of days later in a 4–0 win over [[Motherwell F.C.|Motherwell]], scoring Celtic's fourth in the last minute and providing assists for the other three goals.{{cite news|title=Celtic fans hail Patrick Roberts after impressive debut in youth team victory over Motherwell|url=http://www.dailyrecord.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/celtic-fans-hail-patrick-roberts-7317067#9QqBpUPwrd3mcDMy.97|accessdate=2 April 2016|work=Daily Record|date=5 February 2016}} Roberts made his first team debut for Celtic on 20 February 2016, coming on a substitute for the final few minutes of Celtic's 3–0 league win over [[Inverness Caledonian Thistle F.C.|Inverness CT]] at Celtic Park.{{cite web|title=Games involving Roberts, Patrick in season 2015/2016|url=http://www.fitbastats.com/celtic/player_games.php?playerid=7903|website=FitbaStats|accessdate=2 April 2016}}{{cite news|last1=Hawkins|first1=Billy|title=Celtic fans react on Twitter to Patrick Roberts' full debut performance|url=http://www.hitc.com/en-gb/2016/03/03/celtic-fans-react-on-twitter-to-patrick-roberts-performance-v-du/|accessdate=2 April 2016|work=HITC}} He was given his first starting appearance on 2 March in a league match at home against [[Dundee F.C.|Dundee]]. Celtic could only draw 0–0, but Roberts was noted to have looked "sharp" and showed "flashes of his talent". On 2 April 2016, Roberts scored his first competitive club goal, netting a brace for Celtic in a 3–1 come-from-behind win over [[Heart of Midlothian F.C.|Hearts]].{{cite news|last=|first=|title=Celtic 3–1 Hearts: Patrick Roberts brace helps Hoops go seven points clear at top|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-3520423/Celtic-3-1-Hearts-Patrick-Roberts-brace-helps-Hoops-seven-points-clear-top.html|accessdate=7 April 2016|work="Daily Mail"|date=2 April 2016}} Following an impressive run of form during which he netted three goals, Roberts was named Scottish Player of the Month for April.{{cite news|last=Pollard|first=Rob (6 May 2016)|title=Manchester City's Patrick Roberts wins Scottish Player of the Month award|url=http://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/patrick-roberts-manchester-city-celtic-11296606|accessdate=8 May 2016|website= Manchester Evening}} He scored another brace on 8 May in a 3–2 win over [[Aberdeen F.C.|Aberdeen]], in the process helping Celtic clinch the [[Scottish Premiership]] title.{{cite news|last=Myson |first=Chris (8 May 2016)|title=Celtic 3–2 Aberdeen: Roberts double seals Scottish Premiership title|url=http://www.goal.com/en-gb/news/2881/scottish-football/2016/05/08/23273402/celtic-3-2-aberdeen-roberts-double-seals-scottish|accessdate=8 May 2016|website= Goal}} Roberts scored another goal on the final day of the season in a 7–0 drubbing of [[Motherwell F.C.|Motherwell]], thereby ending the campaign with 7 goals in 12 appearances for Celtic.{{cite news|title=Celtic celebrate title with 7–0 win against Motherwell|url=http://worldsoccertalk.com/2016/05/15/celtic-celebrate-title-with-7-0-win-against-motherwell/|date=15 May 2016|accessdate=15 May 2016|website= World Soccer Talk}} Roberts made his first ever [[UEFA Champions League|Champions League]] appearance on 20 July 2016, starting and scoring in a 3–0 win over [[Lincoln Red Imps F.C.|Lincoln Red Imps]]. He had previously rejected the opportunity to represent England at the [[UEFA European Under-19 Championship|U19 European Championship]] in order to help Celtic progress to the Champions League proper. On 6 December 2016, Roberts scored an impressive solo goal and was named man of the match in a Champions League match against his parent club Manchester City.{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/38202631|title=Manchester City 1–1 Celtic|date=6 December 2016|publisher=|via=www.bbc.co.uk}} He finished the 2016–2017 season with 43 appearances and 15 goals, helping Celtic to complete an unbeaten domestic season, in which the club secured its sixth consecutive league title. On 28 August 2017, it was announced that Roberts had rejoined Celtic on a new season-long loan.{{cite web|url=http://www.celticfc.net/news/13158|title=Delight as Patrick Roberts rejoins Celtic on loan|date=28 August 2017|publisher=[[Celtic F.C.|Celtic]]|via=www.celticfc.net}} In November, during a match against Motherwell, Roberts suffered a hamstring injury and was sidelined for a number of months. He made his return against the same opposition on 18 March 2018 when he came on a substitute for [[James Forrest (footballer)|James Forrest]] in a 0–0 draw.{{cite news|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11787/11306105/celtic-winger-patrick-roberts-refreshed-ahead-of-season-finale|title=Celtic winger Patrick Roberts refreshed ahead of season finale|publisher=SKy Sports|date=27 March 2018|accessdate=5 April 2018}} ====Loan to Girona==== Roberts joined Manchester City's Spanish partner club [[Girona F.C.|Girona]] for the 2018–19 season, with Manchester City saying that the ideal next stage in Robert's development would be testing himself in [[La Liga]], one of the world’s most technical leagues.{{cite web |last1=Pollard |first1=Rob |title=Patrick Roberts joins Girona on loan |url=https://www.mancity.com/news/first-team/first-team-news/2018/august/man-city-patrick-roberts-joins-girona-on-loan |publisher=Manchester City F.C. |accessdate=16 August 2018}} At the time of signing he was the only English player playing in the Spanish top flight and he made his debut the following day as a substitute against [[Real Valladolid]].{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2018/aug/26/patrick-roberts-reaps-rewards-girona-manchester-city-connection|title=Patrick Roberts reaping rewards of Girona’s complex City connection|publisher=The Guardian|last=Lowe|first=Sid|date=26 August 2018|accessdate=18 September 2018}} ==International career== [[File:France - England U19, 20150331 58.JPG|thumb|200px|Roberts playing for [[England national under-19 football team|England U19s]] in 2015|alt=young white man in white and blue kit]] Roberts has represented England at [[England national under-16 football team|under-16]], [[England national under-17 football team|under-17]] and [[England national under-19 football team|under-19]] levels.{{cite web|title=Patrick Roberts|url=http://www.thefa.com/england/all-teams/players/r/patrick-roberts|publisher=The Football Association|accessdate=18 March 2014}} He played an integral role in England's victory at the 2014 European Under-17 Championship in Malta, scoring three goals, grabbing four assists and being named in the team of the tournament.http://www.uefa.com/under17/season=2014/technical-report/tr-under17-2014.pdf In August 2014 Roberts received his first call up to the England [[England national under-19 football team|under-19]] squad.{{cite web|url=http://www.thefa.com/news/england/development/2014/aug/u19-squad-germany-oberhausen-izzy-brown-patrick-roberts-joe-gomez|title=Three U17 Euro winners make step up to England U19s|author=The Football Association|work=thefa.com}} Despite being just 17 years old at the time, Roberts played a massive part in the England [[England national under-19 football team|under-19]] team's progression through the 2015 UEFA European Under-19 Championship qualifying round. In the three group games played by England under-19, Roberts recorded a total of four goals and four assists. He had previously rejected the chance to be in the England squad at the [[UEFA European Under-19 Championship|U19 European Championship]] in order to help Celtic progress to the Champions League proper.{{cite news|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/wires/pa/article-3700751/Patrick-Roberts-happy-swerve-England-duty-tilt-Europe-Celtic.html|title=Patrick Roberts happy to swerve England duty for tilt at Europe with Celtic|website=Daily Mail|date=21 July 2016|accessdate=21 July 2016}} Roberts was also expected to be selected for the [[England national under-20 football team|England under-20]] squad in the [[2017 FIFA U-20 World Cup]], but he instead opted to play for Celtic in the [[2017 Scottish Cup Final]].{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/39825899 |title=Patrick Roberts passes up U20 World Cup spot to stay at Celtic |work=BBC Sport |publisher=BBC |date=5 May 2017 |accessdate=5 May 2017}} ==Personal life== Roberts was born in [[Kingston upon Thames]], [[Greater London]]. His parents are both from [[Merseyside]] and he is a fan of [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]].{{cite web|url=http://bleacherreport.com/articles/2169308-liverpool-transfer-news-english-messi-patrick-roberts-eyed-jordan-ibe-latest|title=Liverpool|author=Nick Akerman|work=Bleacher Report}} He is an alumnus of [[Wimbledon College]].{{Cite web|url=http://www.oldwimbledonians.com/history.html|title=Old Wimbledonians Association|website=www.oldwimbledonians.com|accessdate=2017-04-23}} ==Career Lukas was born in [[Hamburg]], Germany but relocated to England as a child with his family. He is a current [[England national under-21 football team|England U21]]'s international. ==Club career== He was scouted by Manchester City, where he played for their youth ranks for over a decade, before making his debut on 19 December 2017 in the [[2017–18 EFL Cup|EFL Cup]].{{cite web|url=https://www.mancity.com/news/first-team/match-report/2017/december/leicester-city-v-manchester-city-carabao-cup-match-report|title=Leicester v City: Match report|website=MCFC}} On his debut he scored the third penalty for Manchester City in their penalty shootout win over [[Leicester City F.C.|Leicester City]].{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/live/2017/dec/19/leicester-city-v-manchester-city-carabao-cup-quarter-final-live|title=Leicester City 1-1 Manchester City (3-4 on pens): Carabao Cup quarter-final – as it happened|author=Paul Doyle}} He made his Premier League debut on 29 April 2018, as a late substitute for [[Gabriel Jesus]] against [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] at the [[London Stadium]].{{cite web|title=Match Report.|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2018/apr/29/west-ham-united-manchester-city-premier-league-match-report}} He was involved in several games during Manchester City's first team squad for the 2018-19 pre season tour in the U.S. to compete in the [[2018 International Champions Cup]].{{cite news|url=https://www.mancity.com/news/first%20team/first%20team%20news/2018/july/man%20city%20us%20preseason%20tour%20travelling%20squad|title=US TOUR SQUAD CONFIRMED|publisher=Manchester City Official|date=17 July 2018|accessdate=30 July 2018}} He scored his first goal at first team level on 29 July 2018 in the pre season friendly against [[Bayern Munich]] in a 3-2 win.{{cite news|url=https://www.mancity.com/news/first-team/first-team-news/2018/july/man-city-striker-lukas-nmecha-relieved-to-get-up-and-running|title=NMECHA RELIEVED TO GET OFF THE MARK|publisher=Manchester City Official|date=28 July 2018|accessdate=3 August 2018}}{{cite news|url=https://fcbayern.com/en/matches/profis/testspiele/2018-2019/fc-bayern-muenchen-manchester-city-28-07-2018-lineup|title=Bayern Munich 2 Man City 3|publisher=Bayern Munich Official|date=28 July 2018|accessdate=30 July 2018}} Nmecha was loaned to [[Preston North End F.C.|Preston North End]] for the 2018–19 season.{{cite web |title=Lukas Nmecha joins Preston on loan|url=https://www.mancity.com/news/first-team/first-team-news/2018/august/man-city-preston-lukas-nmecha-transfer-news-season-loan |publisher=Manchester City FC|accessdate=9 August 2018}} ==International career== Born in [[Hamburg]] to German and Nigerian parents, but raised in England, Nmecha is eligible to play for [[Nigeria national football team|Nigeria]], [[Germany national football team|Germany]] and [[England national football team|England]]. Since 2016, he has featured for England's [[England national under-18 football team|under-18]] and [[England national under-19 football team|under-19]] teams. At the [[2017 UEFA European Under-19 Championship]], he scored the winning goals in both the semi-final and final to give England their 10th title. On 18 May 2018, Nmecha received a call up to [[England national under-21 football team|England U21]]s by Manager [[Adrian Boothroyd]], for the [[Toulon Tournament]] with England's group containing fixtures against [[Qatar national under-20 football team|Qatar U21]]s, China U21s and [[Mexico national under-20 football team|Mexico U21]]s.{{citenews|publisher=FA.COM|date=18 May 2018|accessdate=18 May 2018|title=ENGLAND U21S HEAD TO MAURICE REVELLO TOURNAMENT IN TOULON WITH A 20-MAN SQUAD |url=http://www.thefa.com/news/2018/may/18/england-u21s-squad-named-for-toulon-180518}} On 9 June 2018, Nmecha came on as a substitute in the [[2018 Toulon Tournament]] final against [[Mexico national under-20 football team|Mexico U21]]s with England winning the tournament after beating Mexico 2–1 in the final.{{citenews|publisher=BBC Sport|date=9 June 2018|accessdate=9 June 2018|title=England win third straight Toulon Tournament title after victory over Mexico|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/live/football/44396993}} ==Style of play== Nmecha's main positition is as a [[Forward (association football)|Centre Forward]], but he is also able to play as a [[Midfielder#Winger|Winger]] on either side. He is known for being comfortable with both feet and for his first touch and finishing ability.{{citenews|publisher=Manchester City|date=18 May 2018|accessdate=3 August 2018|title=Lukas Nmecha: Player Profile|url=https://www.mancity.com/teams/first%20team/strikers/lukas%20nmecha#profile-bio}} Nmecha described that he also likes to use his pace to run at defenders.{{citenews|publisher=Manchester City|date=30 July 2018|accessdate=3 August 2018|title=Vincent Kompany is helping Man City prospect Lukas Nmecha take his game to the next level |url=https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/man-city-lukas-nmecha-kompany-14966606}} ==Career statistics== {{updated|match played 6 January 2019}} {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" |+Appearances and goals by club, season and competition |- !rowspan="2"|Club !rowspan="2"|Season !colspan="3"|League !colspan="2"|[[FA Cup]] !colspan="2"|[[EFL Cup|League Cup]] !colspan="2"|Other !colspan="2"|Total |- !Division!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals |- |[[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] |[[2017–18 Manchester City F.C. season|2017–18]]{{cite web|title=Lukas Nmecha|url=http://www.soccerbase.com/players/player.sd?player_id=107009|website=Soccerbase}} |[[Premier League]] |2||0||0||0||1||0||0||0||3||0 |- |[[Manchester City F.C. He was the winner of the Academy Players' Player of the Year award in the 2013–14 season and signed his first professional contract with [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] in July web|last=Brennan|first=Stuart|url=http://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-city-brandon-barker-academy-10426086|title=Manchester City youngster Brandon Barker web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34745707|title=Brandon Barker: Man City midfielder joins Rotherham on loan|date=6 November 2015|publisher=BBC|accessdate=5 November 2016}} The next day {{IPA-es|aˈleʃ ɣaɾˈθi.a|lang}};{{efn|In isolation, ''García'' is pronounced {{IPA-ca|ɡəɾˈsi.ə|}}/{{IPA-es|ɡaɾˈθi.a|}}, and ''Aleix'' {{IPA-ca|əˈleʃ|}}.}} born 28 June 1997) is a Spanish professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays for [[Girona FC]] on loan from English club [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] as a [[Midfielder#Central midfielder|central midfielder]]. ==Club career== ===Villarreal=== Born in [[Ulldecona]], [[Province of Tarragona|Tarragona]], [[Catalonia]], García joined [[Villarreal CF]]'s youth setup in 2005, aged eight, after starting out at CF Ulldecona.{{cite news|url=http://www.levante-emv.com/castello/2014/07/30/trabajo-ganas-e-ilusion-hacerme/1143880.html|title=Trabajo con ganas e ilusión para hacerme con un hueco este año en el Villarreal B|trans-title=I work with eagerness and hope to fit in to Villarreal B this year|work=[[Levante-EMV]]|language=es|date=29 July 2014|accessdate=23 May 2015}} He made his senior debut with [[Villarreal CF B|the reserves]] in [[Segunda División B]] on 26 April 2014 at only 16 years of age, coming on as a late [[Substitute (association football)|substitute]] in a 1–0 away win against [[CF Badalona]].{{cite web|url=http://www.villarrealcf.es/noticias/portada-ultimas-novedades/item/5349-victoria-del-villarreal-b-en-badalona |archive-url=https://archive.is/20150902210657/http://www.villarrealcf.es/noticias/portada-ultimas-novedades/item/5349-victoria-del-villarreal-b-en-badalona |dead-url=yes |archive-date=2 September 2015 |title=¡Victoria del Villarreal B en Badalona! |trans-title=Victory of Villarreal B in Badalona! |publisher=Villarreal CF |language=es |date=26 April 2014 |accessdate=23 May 2015 }} García featured for [[Villarreal CF C|the C team]] in the [[2014–15 Segunda División B|2014–15 season]], also appearing for the B side in the same campaign. He made his first team – and [[La Liga]] – debut on 23 May 2015, replacing [[Antonio Rukavina]] in a 4–0 loss at [[Athletic Bilbao]].{{cite news|url=http://www.marca.com/eventos/marcador/futbol/2014_15/la-liga/jornada_38/ath_vil/|title=El Athletic monta la fiesta|trans-title=Athletic party mounts|work=[[Marca (newspaper)|Marca]]|language=es|date=23 May 2015|accessdate=23 May 2015}} ===Manchester City=== On 27 August 2015, García joined [[Premier League]] side [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]].{{cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.us/story/2583946/manchester-city-sign-aleix-garcia-from-villarreal|title=Aleix Garcia joins Manchester City from Villarreal|publisher=ESPN FC|first=Richard|last=Jolly|date=27 August 2015|accessdate=24 August 2016}} He was selected by then-City manager [[Manuel Pellegrini]] against [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] on 21 February 2016 in the fifth round of the [[FA Cup]].{{cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.us/english-fa-cup/story/2812117/manchester-city-give-five-young-players-debuts-at-chelsea|title=Man City give five young players debuts in FA Cup game at Chelsea|publisher=ESPN FC|date=21 February 2016|accessdate=24 August 2016}} García made his first Premier League appearance on 17 September 2016, coming on as a 75th-minute substitute in a 4–0 home win against [[A.F.C. Bournemouth|Bournemouth]].{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/37325835|title=Manchester City 4–0 Bournemouth|publisher=BBC Sport|first=Mandeep|last=Sanghera|date=17 September 2016|accessdate=18 September 2016}} On 21 September, he started in an [[EFL Cup]] match against [[Swansea City A.F.C.|Swansea City]], scoring his first goal for the club in the 2–1 away win.{{cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.com/club/manchester-city/382/blog/post/2955013/teenager-aleix-garcia-impresses-as-man-city-defeat-swansea-in-efl-cup|title=Teenager Aleix Garcia impresses as Man City defeat Swansea in EFL Cup|last=Mooney|first=David|date=21 September 2016|publisher=ESPN FC|accessdate=22 September 2016}} He next started a month later on 26 October, in another EFL Cup match, a 1–0 loss to [[Manchester United]].{{cite news|url=http://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-city-news-garcia-maffeo-12085126?|title=Guardiola praises two Man City players after EFL Cup defeat to Manchester United|work=Manchester Evening News|first=Alice|last=McKeegan|date=27 October 2016|accessdate=27 October 2016}} ====Girona loan==== On 1 August 2017, García was loaned to newly promoted [[La Liga]] club [[Girona FC]] until the end of the season.{{cite web|title=Aleix García will strengthen the midfield of Girona|url=http://www.gironafc.cat/noticia/aleix-garcia-reforcara-el-migcamp-del-girona|publisher=Girona FC|accessdate=1 August 2017|date=1 August 2017|language=ca}} ==Career statistics== {{EngvarB|date=August 2018}} {{Use dmy dates|date=August 2018}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Claudio Gomes | image = | caption = | fullname = | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|df=yes|2000|7|23}} | birth_place = [[Argenteuil]], France | height = 1.80 m<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/man-city-claudio-gomes-wiki-14940663|title=Who is Claudio Gomes? French teenager profiled after Manchester City transfer|first=Liam|last=Corless|date=5 August 2018|publisher=}}</ref> | position = [[Midfielder#Defensive midfielder|Defensive midfielder]] | currentclub = [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] | clubnumber = 81 | youthyears1 = 2006–2010 | youthclubs1 = ASC Val d'Argenteuil | youthyears2 = 2010–2011 | youthclubs2 = RFC Argenteuil | youthyears3 = 2011–2013 | youthclubs3 = [[Évreux FC 27|Évreux]] | youthyears4 = 2013–2018 | youthclubs4 = [[Paris Saint-Germain Academy|Paris Saint-Germain]] | years1 = 2017–2018 | clubs1 = [[Paris Saint-Germain Academy|Paris Saint-Germain B]] | caps1 = 1 | goals1 = 0 | years2 = 2018– | clubs2 = [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] | caps2 = 0 | goals2 = 0 | nationalyears1 = 2015–2016 | nationalteam1 = [[France national under-16 football team|France U16]] | nationalcaps1 = 13 | nationalgoals1 = 0 | nationalyears2 = 2016–2017 | nationalteam2 = [[France national under-17 football team|France U17]] | nationalcaps2 = 16 | nationalgoals2 = 0 | nationalyears3 = 2017 | nationalteam3 = [[France national under-18 football team|France U18]] | nationalcaps3 = 7 | nationalgoals3 = 1 | nationalyears4 = 2018– | nationalteam4 = [[France national under-19 football team|France U19]] | nationalcaps4 = 8 | nationalgoals4 = 0 | pcupdate = 5 August 2018 | ntupdate = 20 November 2018 }} '''Claudio Gomes''' (born 23 July 2000) is a French [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Midfielder#Defensive midfielder|defensive midfielder]] for English club [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] and the [[France national under-18 football team|France national under-18 team]]. Prior to signing for Manchester City in 2018, he represented [[Paris Saint-Germain Academy|Paris Saint-Germain B]], having played youth football with that club and a number of other French teams.
==Club career== Born in [[Argenteuil]], [[Val-d'Oise]] on 23 July 2000, Gomes played as a youth for ASC Val d'Argenteuil and RFC Argenteuil, two teams in his hometown, before joining [[Évreux FC 27|Évreux]] in 2011 and [[Paris Saint-Germain F.C.|Paris Saint-Germain]] two years later.<ref name=six>{{cite news |last1=Marie |first1=Réginald |title=Six choses à savoir sur le capitaine des Bleuets qui évolue au Paris Saint-Germain|trans-title=Six things to know about the ''Bluets'' captain who is growing at Paris Saint-Germain |url=https://www.lepopulaire.fr/limoges/sports/football/2017/09/01/six-choses-a-savoir-sur-le-capitaine-des-bleuets-qui-evolue-au-paris-saint-germain_12533517.html |accessdate=5 August 2018 |work=Le Populaire du Centre |date=1 September 2017 |language=French}}</ref>
Gomes made his senior debut for PSG's [[Reserve team|reserves]] on 18 November 2017, his one appearance for the club. He came on as a 79th-minute substitute for [[Abdallah Yaisien]] in a 2–1 home loss to [[AS Yzeure|Yzeure]] in the [[Championnat National 2]] ([[French football league system|fourth tier]]).<ref>{{cite news |last1=Gineste |first1=Franck |title=Football, National 2 : première défaite à domicile pour la réserve du PSG contre Yzeure (1–2) |trans-title=Football, National 2: first home defeat for PSG reserves against Yzeure (1–2)|url=http://www.leparisien.fr/sports/ile-de-france/football-national-2-premiere-defaite-a-domicile-pour-la-reserve-du-psg-contre-yzeure-1-2-18-11-2017-7400697.php |accessdate=5 August 2018 |work=Le Parisien |date=17 November 2017 |language=French}}</ref>
On 25 July 2018, Gomes signed with [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.mancity.com/news/first%20team/first%20team%20news/2018/july/man%20city%20sign%20claudio%20gomes|title=City Signs Claudio Gomes|publisher=Manchester City F.C.}}</ref> He had trained with the club since the expiry of his PSG contract in June, and been on their pre-season tour of the United States, but they chose to wait for him to turn 18 before signing him.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Corless |first1=Liam |title=Who is Claudio Gomes? French teenager profiled after Manchester City transfer |url=https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/man-city-claudio-gomes-wiki-14940663 |accessdate=5 August 2018 |work=Manchester Evening News |date=5 August 2017}}</ref> He made his professional debut on 5 August in a 2–0 win over [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] in the [[2018 FA Community Shield]] at [[Wembley Stadium]], coming on in added time for [[John Stones]].<ref name=shield>{{cite news |last1=Bevan |first1=Chris |title=Chelsea 0–2 Manchester City |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44995783 |accessdate=5 August 2018 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=5 August 2018}}</ref> He was in the game for one second before the final whistle blew and his team won the trophy.<ref>{{cite news |title=Is this the shortest debut in football history? |url=https://au.sports.yahoo.com/shortest-debut-football-history-031754022.html |accessdate=8 August 2018 |publisher=Yahoo! |date=7 August 2018}}</ref>
==International career== Gomes is a youth international for France, having captained the [[France national under-17 football team|France U17]]s at the [[2017 UEFA European Under-17 Championship]],<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.fff.fr/articles/equipes-de-france-1/details-articles/175692-la-liste-de-lionel-rouxel|title=Les dix-huit joueurs pour l'Euro 2017|trans-title=The eighteen players for Euro 2017|publisher=FFF|language=French}}</ref> and the [[2017 FIFA U-17 World Cup]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.lequipe.fr/Football/Actualites/La-france-au-mondial-u17-avec-geubbels-et-isidor/836103#xtor=RSS-1/|title=La France au Mondial U17 avec Geubbels et Isidor|trans-title=France at the I17 World Cup with Geubbels and Isidor|first=|last=|work=L'Équipe|language=French}}</ref> He was named in the team of the tournament at the former in Croatia, in which the French reached the quarter-finals.<ref name=team/> In France's opening match at the latter tournament in India, he scored in a 7–1 win over [[New Caledonia national under-17 football team|New Caledonia]].<ref>{{cite news |title=France prove too strong for New CaledoniaFrance prove too strong for New Caledonia |url=https://www.fifa.com/u17worldcup/matches/round=275931/match=300394731/match-report.html |accessdate=5 August 2018 |publisher=FIFA |date=8 October 2017}}</ref> In August 2018, he was called up for the first time to the [[France national under-19 football team|under-19 team]] for friendlies against [[Slovenia national under-19 football team|Slovenia]], [[Croatia national under-19 football team|Croatia]] and India.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Chochois |first1=Alexandre |title=France U19 : La liste pour les trois amicaux|trans-title=France U19: The list for the three friendlies|url=http://www.foot-national.com/foot-france-u19-la-liste-pour-les-trois-amicaux-110790.html |accessdate=8 September 2018 |publisher=Foot National |date=28 August 2018 |language=French}}</ref>
==Style of play== Gomes is nicknamed "[[N'Golo Kanté]]" by his teammates, who liken him to the French international midfielder for his efforts in recovering the ball.<ref name=six/>
==Personal life== Gomes is the son of Bissau-Guinean footballer Amarildo Gomes, who was developing at [[AS Beauvais Oise|Beauvais]] and [[Stade Rennais F.C.|Rennes]] before retiring through a knee injury.<ref name=six/><ref name=bleu>{{cite web|url=http://www.leparisien.fr/informations/claudio-gomes-se-revele-deja-en-bleu-28-05-2016-5835669.php|title=Claudio Gomes se révèle déjà en bleu|trans-title=Claudio Gomes revealing himself already in blue|work=Le Parisien|language=French}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.footballdatabase.eu/es/jugador/detalles/122565-amarildo-gomes|title=Amarildo Gomes - Jubilado|publisher=Football Database}}</ref> As of 2017, his two younger brothers were playing for [[Le Havre AC|Le Havre]] and Évreux.<ref name=six/> A 2016 profile of Gomes by ''[[Le Parisien]]'' noted his passion for history, particularly the [[French Revolution]].<ref name=bleu/>
==Career statistics== {{updated|match played 1 November 2018}}
